description: A short presentation about how to use Kotlin to simplify Android development presenting the general Kotlin advantages as well as Android specific features and tools.

speaker: Anthony FAUCOGNEY
title: BreizhCamp 2018
subject: My first Android app in kotlin: bilan
description: After an short kotlin introduction, I will compare some Android Java code with kotlin code and show how kotlin is light and powerful.

speaker: Brian Keating
title: Limerick AI - (Applications & Games) Software Development
subject: Introduction - Why Kotlin is worth considering

speaker: Pablo Baldez
title: GDG Porto Alegre
subject:
Habemus Kotlin. Mas e daí? Usando a nova linguagem oficial para Android em um app com milhões de
            downloads.

speaker: Victor Oliveira
title: Liferay dev.life (EMEA)
subject: Building a truly serverless mobile app with WeDeploy and Kotlin
description: WeDeploy helps you build from simple to complex applications. It gives you predefined services that can speed up your development process.

speaker: Bruno Aybar
title: Google Tech Lima - GTechLima
subject: Kotlin Functions: From Zero To Hero

speaker: Dmitry Zhemerov
title: JPoint 2018
subject: Идиоматичный Kotlin: от форматирования до DSL
description: Начать пользоваться Kotlin несложно — он похож на Java, и ваш существующий опыт легко позволит вам начать программировать в стиле Java. В этом докладе вы узнаете о возможностях языка и стандартной библиотеки Kotlin, которые позволят вам выйти на следующий уровень и писать по-настоящему компактный и выразительный код. Сочетание этих возможностей позволяет строить на базе Kotlin так называемые «доменно-ориентированные языки», которые позволяют декларативно выражать сложные наборы инструкций. Мы рассмотрим несколько примеров таких языков и то, как вы сможете сами создавать их.

speaker: Ivan Osipov
title: JPoint 2018
subject: Kotlin DSL: теория и практика
description:
Разработка тестов приложения — не самое приятное занятие. Этот процесс занимает долгое время, требует большой концентрации и при этом крайне востребован. Язык Kotlin дает набор инструментов, который позволяет довольно легко построить собственный проблемно-ориентированный язык (DSL). В нашем опыте Kotlin DSL заменил билдеры и статические методы для тестирования модуля планирования ресурсов, что превратило добавление новых тестов и поддержку старых из рутины в увлекательный процесс.

В ходе доклада мы разберем все основные инструменты из арсенала разработчика и то, как их можно комбинировать для решения задач тестирования. Мы с вами проделаем путь от проектирования Идеального Теста до запуска максимально приближенного, чистого и понятного теста для системы планирования ресурсов на основе Kotlin.

Доклад будет полезен практикующим инженерам, тем, кто рассматривает Kotlin как язык для комфортного написания компактных тестов, и тем, кто хочет улучшить процесс тестирования в своем проекте.

speaker: Andrey Breslav
title: JPoint 2018
subject: На плечах гигантов: языки, у которых учился Kotlin
description: Расскажем о тех языках, из которых мы заимствовали идеи и концепции, когда разрабатывали Kotlin. В числе прочего, речь пойдет о Java, C#, Scala, Groovy, Python, Gosu и т.д. Покажем, как некоторые из этих идей изменились в нашей интерпретации. И немного расскажем о том, какие известные языки теперь учатся на нашем опыте (Swift, Java, Hack, C#).

speaker: Antonel Ernest Pazargic, Gabi Bornea
title: Kotlin User Group Bucharest
subject: Kotlin Explained Series - Functional Programming
description:
Kotlin its a strong type programming language which embraces both Functional and Object Oriented paradigms. This brings the power of the two "worlds" -> functional programming in the small and object oriented programming in the large.

In this first part of the series we are going to see how Kotlin (and arrow) embraces the functional programming paradigm to lead to more maintainable, easy to reason, succinct yet expressive and concurrent friendly applications.

speaker: Artem Dorosh
title: OSDC
subject: Approaching Clean Architecture in Android with Kotlin
description:
Світ все більше рухається в сторону wearable-девайсів, об’єм мобільного трафіка росте з нереальною швидкістю, а люди ні на хвилину не розстаються зі своїми смартфонами. В таких реаліях розробка під Android стає не просто крутою професією, а невід’ємною складовою технічного прогресу.

Артем Дорош розповість про те, як писати круті Android-застосунки на Kotlin. В Артема за спиною 4 роки професійної розробки під Android, тому точно буде багато цікавої інфи.

speaker: Nando Septian Husni
title: Indonesia Mobile-app Academy
subject: Kotlin day malang
description: introducing the kotlin for android, and displaying the differences in kotlin with java, and the advantages of using the kotlin, and why should use the kotlin for now

speaker: Nando Septian Husni
title: TEKNOLOGI TECHCOMFEST 2018
subject: Build your skills with the kotlin as a multiplatform programming language for a better Indonesia
description: showcase the origin of the kotlin, where the kotlin comes from, showcases more deeply about the kotlin in depth, and draws Indonesian developers to move to the kotlinian language

speaker: Nando Septian Husni
title: KOTLIN DAY SEMARANG
subject: Who does not know Kotlin?
description: introducing the kotlin for android, and displaying the differences in kotlin with java, and the advantages of using the kotlin, and why should use the kotlin for now

speaker: Zahid Mahmood
title: RocksTech
subject: Know about kotlin
description: What is Kotlin , how it helps developers ,is Kotlin beter than java.

speaker: Mauricio Sierra
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: Reflection and Annotations in Kotlin
description: In this talk we'll explore Kotlin's annotation language features and the reflection API. We will cover the basics and compare them to their Java counterparts. Finally, we will look at some useful applications of these concepts.

speaker: Cord Jastram
title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
subject: Extending SAP systems using the SAP Java Connector and Kotlin
description: The SAP Java Connector is used to develop SAP-compatible software components which are executed on the JVM. Using the connector you can call ABAP from Java and vice versa. In this talk I show how the use of Kotlin helps to develop these components. Coroutines are used for scalability and a DSL is used to create a simplified version of the Connector API.

speaker: Yahya Bayramoglu
title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
subject: Language Abusement & Unreadablity
description: Readability is one of the most important yet challenging characteristic of a software. Because the code is always readable to its developer, but what about the next developer? As Software Developers, with new technologies, we get excited / hyped quite easily and that doesn't always make the code readable. Especially when the language is as powerful as Kotlin. In this talk, You will see some cases that you can get your code unreadable so fast by abusing the language even though you intend to write readable code.

speaker: Jolanda Verhoef
title: Utrecht Kotlin Meetup
subject: Bouw een Android App met Kotlin!

speaker: Erik Pohl
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Test and Data Driven Development in Kotlin

speaker: Balazs Varga
title: Kotlin Budapest User Group
subject: The future of mobile development: cross-platform apps with Kotlin

speaker: Sobre Andrés
title: MadridJUG
subject: Poniendo Kotlin en producción a palos
description:
Kotlin mola, vale. Pero como ocurre muy a menudo con nuevas tecnologías, plantea muchas dudas a la hora de ponerlo en un sistema en producción. A ti igual no, porque te mola, pero a la gente que tienes alrededor seguro que sí. ¿Por qué vamos a arriesgar un sistema en producción por poner un lenguaje nuevo, con imprevisibles efectos secundarios?. ¿Por qué vamos a complicar nuestro sistema haciendo que la gente tenga que conocer un lenguaje más?. ¿Por qué vamos a perjudicar la productividad de nuestros desarrollos añadiendo el coste de aprendizaje?

¿Preguntas sin respuesta real?. Es posible. Pero vamos a intentar dar respuestas. Contaré la historia, desde la experiencia personal, de cómo lo hice yo, en el contexto de un backend basado en microservicios, y todo desde el punto de vista de alguien que llega a Kotlin desde Java. Y, aunque lo consiguiera, cómo podría haberlo hecho. Y sobre todo, contaré cuáles fueron las conclusiones, razonando sobre las verdaderas ventajas y problemas que puede ofrecer este cambio y comentando cuáles son las principales mejoras que tiene el lenguaje desde un punto de vista práctico.

speaker: Juan Guillermo Gómez
title: GDG Cali
subject: Kotlin para apps y backend -- VueJS un framework progresivo

speaker: Julian Suarez
title: GDG Bogotá
subject: Capa de Red en Android usando Kotlin + ReactX + ViewModel

speaker: Tomas Tauber
title: Hong Kong Functional Programming
subject: The state of FP in Kotlin

speaker: Carlos Rodríguez Domínguez
title: Segundo Semestre 2018
subject: Programming Android apps using kotlin
description: I will explain the foundations of the kotlin programming language, and then, the students will learn how to write simple apps for Android using this language and the extensions that are specifically available to facilitate Android programming.

speaker: Bonnyfase Alex
title: Uganda Kotlin meetup
subject: Kotlin beyond Android
description: This is a 3hours’ workshop for Android developers that want to learn the Kotlin fundamentals and how to start using Kotlin on existing or new Android projects. 1 hour to review the Kotlin fundamentals, and 1 hours to use Kotlin for Android development.

speaker: Nando Septian Husni
title: KPM Meetup #5
subject: Intro kotlin for android development
description: introduces kotlin for android, and what's the difference with previous languages

speaker: Ana Capatina, Gen Ashley
title: Women Who Code
subject: Kotlin Part 3 of 3 - Loading multiple boards, UI improvements, releasing the game
description: In this Kotlin workshop, we will continue working on our simple Sudoku Game by loading multiple sudoku boards, improving the UI, creating a build.

speaker: Marcin Moskala
title: Mobile Warsaw #58
subject: Superpowers of Kotlin delegation
description: Delegation is one of the most inconspicuous Kotlin features. Property delegation is still pretty new feature in the programming world and most developers still use only small amount of possibilities it provides. On the other hand, class delegation is known for decades and it was promoted by big authorities. All it needed was language support, which was introduced in Kotlin. On this session, we are going to dive into possibilities that Kotlin delegation gives. Let's discover this features and understand its superpowers.

speaker: Marcin Moskala
title: Droidcon Turin 2018
subject: Multiplatform Kotlin Development
description: Kotlin enables you to write Android, iOS and web applications 100% natively. When you add good architecture, you can achieve enormous code reusage. In this lecture, I will show how you can do it yourself. I will present possibilities of this approach, how to apply clean architecture there and how to unit test it all.

speaker: Marcin Moskala
title: Warszawskie Dni Informatyki.pl
subject: Delegation pattern in Kotlin
description: Delegation is one of the most inconspicuous Kotlin features. Property delegation is still pretty new feature in the programming world and most developers still use only small amount of possibilities it provides. On the other hand, class delegation is known for decades and it was promoted by big authorities. All it needed was language support, which was introduced in Kotlin. On this session, we are going to dive into possibilities that Kotlin delegation gives. Let's discover this features and understand its superpowers.

speaker: Solomon Allan Opio
title: Kotlin Uganda User Group
subject: Kotlin Uganda User Group Meetup
description: In this event we'll walk through developing a web application with kotlin using spring boot, an overview of intellij idea integrated development environment and a couple of resources online to get you started with kotlin programming language to a professional kotlin programmer.

speaker: Fabio Collini
title: GDG Cochin
subject: From Java to Kotlin beyond Alt+Shift+Cmd+K
description: Kotlin is a first-class language for Android development since Google I/O 2017. And it’s here to stay! Thanks to Android Studio it’s really easy to introduce Kotlin in an existing project, the configuration is trivial and then we can convert Java classes to Kotlin using a Alt+Shift+Cmd+K. But the new syntax is the just beginning, using Kotlin we can improve our code making it more readable and simpler to write. In this talk we’ll see how to use some Kotlin features (for example data classes, collections, coroutines and delegates) to simplify Android development comparing the code with the equivalent “modern” Java code. It’s not fair to compare Kotlin code with plain Java 6 code so the Java examples will use lambdas and some external libraries like RxJava and AutoValue.

speaker: James Mark Coggan
title: GDG DevFest Pisa 0.1
subject: How to test your Android Things code in a clean way with Kotlin
description: Android things gives you the ability to connect all those Internet of things devices you have around all together. But how can you test it? In this talk you will learn in a practical way how to structure your Android Things project so you can write proper unit tests that don’t depend on your sensors, actuators or the Android framework.

speaker: Antonis Lilis
title: Java Hellenic User Group
subject: A short introduction to the Kotlin language for Java Developers
description: Do you like Java but wish you didn’t have to write so much boilerplate code? Kotlin aims to address many of the pitfalls that are common with Java development, while making your code more concise, safe, and expressive. It is also 100% interoperable with Java and can be mixed in the same project.

speaker: Kevin Lhoest
title: OnePoint
subject: Kotlin compared to Java
description: I will explain what kotlin can do better than Java. I will particulary insist on Null Safety

speaker: Bolot Kerimbaev
title: DevNexus 2018
subject: Kotlin-Class Destroyer
description: In Java, almost everything has to be a class or within a class. In Kotlin, there are several mechanisms for writing code without explicitly introducing classes. The talk will show examples using functions as first-class citizens, higher-order functions, operators, extensions, and property delegation.

speaker: Enrique Zamudio
title: DevNexus 2018
subject: Bulletproofing your foot for Kotlin
description: Kotlin is the hot new language for the JVM, and a shiny new toy for many developers. Come and learn what it has to offer, its benefits and advantages over Java, and how to avoid shooting yourself in the foot when you start using it.

speaker: Josh Long
title: DevNexus 2018
subject: Bootiful Kotlin
description:
Spring Boot, the convention-over-configuration centric framework from the Spring team at Pivotal, marries Spring’s flexibility with conventional, common sense defaults to make application development on the JVM not just fly, but pleasant! Spring Boot aims to make address the common functional and non-functional requirements that gate quickly moving to production. The framework is as clean as it gets, wouldn’t it be nice if the language matched its elegance?

Kotlin, the productivity-focused language from our friends at JetBrains, takes up the slack to make the experience leaner, cleaner and even more pleasant!

The Spring and Kotlin teams have worked hard to make sure that Kotlin and Spring Boot are a first-class experience for all developers trying to get to production, faster and safer. Come for the Spring and stay for the Bootiful Kotlin.

speaker: Justin Lee
title: DevNexus 2018
subject: Kotlin in Action
description: Kotlin comes to us from Jetbrains the same people that make the IntelliJ IDEA IDE. Designed to run on the JVM and interop cleanly with exisiting Java classes, Kotlin provides a number of upgrades from standard Java development. More than just another language tour with and ceaseless parade of tidbits and nuggets, this talk is a walkthrough of actively developed projects. We’ll look at various language features in the context of actual code rather than contrived examples designed to make the language shine.

speaker: Francesco Vasco
title: JUG Milano Meeting #98
subject: Reactive Spring
description: Spring Framework è una celebre componente per lo sviluppo su JVM. In più di quindici anni si è ampliato ed adeguato alle crescenti necessità del mercato, inclusa la programmazione reattiva e il supporto di Kotlin. Vedremo insieme come si combinano queste tecnologie, quali sono i vantaggi dello sviluppo asincrono e come risolvere alcune problematiche.

speaker: Dor Samet
title: KotlinTLV
subject: Kotlin on Android
description: In this session we will go over a few of the many ways to work with Kotlin in your Android apps. In particular, we will take a look at methods to work with the mainstream libraries like Dagger2, RxJava and Arch Components. We will show how Kotlin's capabilities work in tandem with these libraries in order to help you express yourself more when building your app.

speaker: Tania Anahi Tello
title: Androidinights
subject: How to build a react app in KOtlin

speaker: Oscar Wahltinez
title: East Bay Developers
subject: Lessons learned porting applications to Kotlin

speaker: Baris Emre Efe
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: DSLs using Kotlin
description: Learn the fundamentals of Domain Specific Languages using Kotlin.

speaker: Rogelio Orona
title: Guadalajara Kotlin User Group
subject: Microservices for better or worse
description: Kotlin proporciona un monton de ventajas sobre como escribir codigos, desde Functional Programming hasta DSL... pero como es realmente el mundo de los microservicios trabajando con Kotlin? Es realmente la interoperabilidad realmente buena y suficientemente buena para poder llevar tu backend y tus servicios con Kotlin?

speaker: Sinuhe Jaim
title: Guadalajara Kotlin User Group
subject: Advantages of the Kotlin Multiplatform
description: Kotlin tiene varias ventajas sobre otras plataformas, se ha enfocado en ser el lenguaje mas "pragmatico" en el mercado, sin embargo ha llegado al extremo de ofrecer un soporte mas extenso para poder vivir en paralelo con otros lenguajes y plataformas. Hablemos pues de que tiene de maravilloso el proyecto que ofrece tener Kotlin en todos lados.

speaker: Thomas Nield
title: Java Metroplex User Group (JavaMUG)
subject: Kotlin Fundamentals for Java Devs
description:
The JVM has seen dozens of languages. Some rose to prominence while many came and went. What is different about Kotlin?

Kotlin is a JVM language built by JetBrains, the same company that built developer tools like Intellij IDEA, PyCharm, and ReSharper. In 2017, Google backed Kotlin as the official language for Android.

Rather than seeking to be innovative and experimental, Kotlin focuses on pragmatism and industry. With practical influences from C#, Java, Groovy, and Scala, Kotlin streamlines useful features to create a productivity-focused language. With zero configuration, it also interoperates with Java codebases and libraries making it immediately accessible to Java developers.

Come to this hands-on session to learn the pragmatic syntax and language features of Kotlin, and take your productivity on the JVM to new heights.

speaker: Brayan Mamani Mamani
title: Kotlin El Alto
subject: Conociendo a Kotlin
description: Kotlin es un lenguaje relativamente nuevo que compila a Javascript y a bytecode del JVM. Fue diseñado por Jetbrains y ha crecido mucho en popularidad desde que se lanzó la versión 1.0 hace dos años. Se usa sobre todo para hacer apps de Android porque es compatible con Java SE pero tiene una sintaxis muy agradable como los lenguajes modernos de hoy. Estaremos repasando las características básicas de Kotlin y de la programación funcional en Kotlin. Si queda tiempo, habrá una demostración de async/await.

speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Ktor.io
description: Когда речь заходит о Котлине, то многие считают что его ниша это Android. Немудрено, ведь больше всего шума именно вокруг него. А пока Kotlin хайпит на Android, JetBrains спокойно разрабатывает Ktor – фреймворк для написания асинхронных веб приложений. В своем докладе я расскажу про архитектуру и устройство ktor, написание клиента и сервера, а также покрою вопрос тестирования.

speaker: Sergey Kryukov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin/Native
description:
Не все слышали, что вот уже почти год, как команда Kotlin работает над возможностью компиляции Kotlin в нативный исполняемый код. Да-да, никакой виртуальной машины!

В этом докладе я постараюсь приоткрыть завесу над этим направлением развития нашего любимого языка.

speaker: Andrey Mukamolov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin для носимых устройств: пример использования
description: В докладе речь пойдёт о разработке приложений для Wear OS by Google, о платформе в общем и об интересных вещах, встреченных во время разработки, а также примеры кода.

speaker: Kirill Rozov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Inject dependency with Koin
description: Koin – маленькая библиотека на 100% Kotlin в реализации: нет проксей, нет кодогенерации, нет рефлексии. Только DSL и магия Kotlin под капотом. Из доклада вы узнаете действительно ли Dependency Injection + Kotlin + Easy of Use == Koin.

speaker: Ed Austin
title: Edinburgh Java User Group
subject: Kotlin - Comparative Java Analysis
description: An overview of Kotlin and its relation to Java

speaker: Adrien Pessu
title: TOURAINE TECH 2018
subject: Kotlin: The back of the future
description:
Since the google's announcement of the Kotlin android support, Mobile applications developper are very interested in this language. But is only for mobile apps developper?

No! Kotlin run on the JVM so let's enjoy it in all of our projets.

Join us to discover all aspects of your next futur foster language. Throw several exercices, you will learn to transform you old Java in Kotlin and then to think directly in Kotlin for more "fun" and less "void"

Viens nous rejoindre pour découvrir toutes les facettes de ton futur prochain langage préféré. A travers plusieurs exercices tu apprendras à transformer ton vieux Java en Kotlin puis à penser directement en Kotlin pour plus de **"fun"** et moins de "void".

speaker: Marharyta Nedzelska
title: Morning@Lohika
subject: Kotlin for Java developers: How and Why
description:
In this talk you will be introduced modern programming language Kotlin. If you’re a Java developer for some years and you’re fed up with NPE, Checked Exceptions, casts and many other things that makes you mad and thinking of becoming a farmer, this talk is for you. Find out that Kotlin is a great solution for these problems. We will talk about differences between Kotlin and Java, key features of this language and how they are implemented, and of course we will read and write code.

In general this talk will try to answer two major questions: “Why do we need to learn Kotlin?” and “How to learn it?” After the break you can become a part of TDD ping-pong session with KotlinTest. Hope you’ll find something interesting for you even if you’re already familiar with Kotlin.

speaker: Leoš Přikryl
title: CZJUG Praha
subject: Kotlin na backendu
description: Java se bohužel nevyvíjí tak rychle, jak by si mnozí vývojáři přáli a v konkurenci moderních programovacích jazyků působí poněkud zastarale a neohrabaně. Je ale škoda vzdát se léty ověřeného a dobře fungujícího ekosystému. Jedna z možností, jak se s touto situací vypořádat, je Kotlin. Kotlin je moderní programovací jazyk plně interoperabilní s Javou. Oproti Javě přináší mnohá vylepšení, známá z jiných programovacích jazyků (null safety, properties, extensions, …), zároveň ale umožňuje využití existujícího Java kódu a knihoven. Kotlin byl letos uznán oficiálním jazykem pro Android, ale stejně dobře lze použít i na dalších platformách.

speaker: Jan Vondrouš, Václav Stolín
title: CZJUG Praha
subject: Kotlin a stručná historie času
description: Ve firmě Quadient Kotlin používají na springovém projektu téměř 4 roky, to znamená, že ho začali používat dávno před vydáním verze 1.0. Podělí se o některé problémy, které je po cestě potkaly, nastíní, jak některé z těchto problémů řešili, a zmíní se o tom, jak Kotlin používají dnes.

speaker: Václav Souhrada
title: CZJUG Praha
subject: Kotlin pro mobilní vývoj
description:
Kotlin v současné době zažívá velký boom a to zejména díky oznámení na Google I/O 17, kde se Kotlin stal oficiálním primárním jazykem podporovaným pro vývoj Android aplikací.

V tomto talku si ukážeme výhody Kotlinu oproti Java jazyku při psaní Android aplikací. Ukážeme si, proč je Kotlin na Androidu tak populární a co jsou jeho přednosti díky použití např. Kotlin Android Extensions a knihoven jako jsou Anko či Android KTX a také jak využít Kotlin DSL.

Věděli jste, že v Kotlinu můžete psát i multiplatformní aplikace?

speaker: Trevor Halvorson
title: Seattle Kotlin
subject: Adopting Kotlin
description: This meetup will focus on adopting Kotlin within your development team. Nate Ebel is an Android Developer at Udacity where they have been using Kotlin in production for almost a year. Nate has published several blog posts on Kotlin[1], including a detailed post on how the mobile team at Udacity successfully incorporated Kotlin into their Java code base and also started new projects using Kotlin

speaker: Dr. Holger Brandl
title: Kotlin Night Frankfurt
subject: Building Data Science Workflows & Libraries with Kotlin

speaker: Niklas Lochschmidt, Marc Reichelt
title: Kotlin Night Frankfurt
subject: Replace Java with Kotlin for fun and profit (Backend Edition)

speaker: Łukasz Andrzejewski
title: Stacja IT Poznań
subject: Kotlin Praktycznie
description:
Słyszałeś o coraz bardziej popularnym języku Kotlin, ale nie wiesz jak zacząć? Chcesz gruntownie poznać język Kotlin oraz nauczyć się jego praktycznego wykorzystania? Dobrze trafiłeś! Na tym szkoleniu nie tylko poznasz język Kotlin, ale także zrozumiesz jego najważniejsze mechanizmy oraz nauczysz się jak praktycznie go wykorzystywać.

Kotlin to nowoczesny, silnie typowany język przeznaczony do tworzenia rozwiązań na wiele platform (desktop, web, mobile). W czasie warsztatu uczestnicy poznają najważniejsze elementy języka oraz zdobędą praktyczną wiedzę z zakresu jego wykorzystania w codziennej pracy. Większość czasu na zajęciach poświęcone zostanie na pisanie kodu wspólnie z prowadzącym. Poznamy dostępne narzędzia, dowiemy się jak testować i debuggować kod Kotlina, ale przede wszystkim w jaki sposób wykorzystać język do zwiększenia efektywności codziennej pracy.

speaker: Sebastien Deleuze
title: Voxxed Days Zürich 2018
subject: Why Spring ❤ Kotlin
description:
In this talk, I will explain why Spring ❤ Kotlin and how you can leverage Spring official support for Kotlin (in Framework, Boot, Data) to build your next Spring project more efficiently and with more pleasure.

I will describe gradually how you can transform your Spring Boot 1.0 Java + Javascript project into a Spring Boot 2.0 pure Kotlin project running on top of the new WebFlux functional web framework

speaker: Janos Gericke, Christof Vollrath
title: Kotlin user group Berlin
subject: Enjoyable Testing with Kotlin Spek - Our Journey from JUnit, Cucumaber to Spek

speaker: Andrey Breslav
title: PS JAVA MEETUP #9
subject: Kotlin: практика разработки современного языка программирования
description: С Андреем Бреславом определим, из чего состоит современный язык программирования Kotlin (изначально он разрабатывался для платформы JVM, но со временем добавилась поддержка JavaScript, iOS и многих других платформ). Чуть подробнее остановимся на системе типов, которая не похожа ни на одну теоретическую статью или книжку, которую вы читали, зато похожа на большинство реально используемых систем типов. А также обсудим, какие языки повлияли на дизайн Kotlin и как.

speaker: Chetan Padia
title: Brighton Mobile
subject: Kotlin makes Java null and void
description: Chetan Padia will be guiding us through what Kotlin is and makes it so much better than Java.

speaker: Frederik Dumazy
title: Kotlin Belgium User Group
subject: Kotlin DSL's with Frederik Dumazy
description: Frederik will explain how to write DSL's in Kotlin, as a guideline you can start to read up on his blogpost https://medium.com/@dumazy/writing-dsls-in-kotlin-part-1-7f5d2193f277

speaker: Sebastian Burgstaller
title: Developer Meetup Kärnten
subject: Kotlin - Syntax und Features der Java-Alternative
description: Dieses Mal treffen wir uns zur Abwechslung woanders, nämlich beim neuen CoWorking Space see:PORT in Pörtschach. Sebastian Burgstaller wird uns die Programmiersprache Kotlin vorstellen, bei der es sich um eine statisch typisierte, objektorientierte Programmiersprache handelt, die in Bytecode für die Java Virtual Machine (JVM) übsetzt wird. Im Juli 2011 von JetBrains vorgestellt, wurde die Sprache kontinuierlich weiterentwickelt und konnte zuletzt einen entscheidenden Erfolg verbuchen: Google unterstützt sie nun offiziell als Alternative zu Java für die Android App Entwicklung.

speaker: Jossi Wolf
title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
subject: Kotlin and Java Script
description:
Have you ever developed something with JavaScript? Did you like it? Did you miss Kotlin's features? Since the release of Kotlin 1.1, you don’t have to anymore! Kotlin now is also able to compile to pure JavaScript and run without a JVM.

With Kotlin being able to compile to JavaScript, many new possibilities open up. Want to write a server with Node.js and Kotlin? Sure! A website? Yes please.

In this talk you’ll get to know how to get started with Kotlin/JS, why and when to choose Kotlin/JS, how to build a simple server with Node.js and a website.(Don't worry if you're not a Web Dev, this talk will cover the basics in an understandable manner!)

speaker: Jendrik Johannes
title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
subject: gradlew init --dsl kotlin --type kotlin-library
description:
If you are a Koltin (Android) developer, Gradle might by your primary (only) choice for a build tool. If you encounter Gradle for the first time and then need to configure your build, you are quickly confronted with a bunch of Groovy scripts.

If you reaction is: "Groovy??!! What the %&#*??!!"...then you are not alone.

Thousands of Android and Java developers had the same feeling once. But fear not! As Kotlin developer, you have another advantage over Java developers now: You can use a powerful build tool that you can configure without being forced to use yet another (scarily dynamic) language.

We will explore how Gradle and Kotlin work together on different levels. While we do this, we will look at some basic Gradle features you can leverage to make your builds better and which you can configure using...Kotlin!

speaker: Irina Galata
title: Kotlin Dnipro
subject: Animations? Easy!
description: На практиці розглянемо процес розробки анімації, починаючи з вподобаного шота на Dribbble і закінчуючи готовим компонентом на Github.

speaker: Igor Kucherenko
title: Kotlin Dnipro
subject: Functional programming in Kotlin
description: Реалізація функціональної парадигми в Kotlin є однією з найголовніших фічей цієї мови. В цьому докладі ми дізнаємося про приклади та можливості Kotlin з точки зору функціональної мови программування.

speaker: Leoš Přikryl
title: GDG Jihlava
subject: Kotlin introduction
description: Kotlin is modern, pragmatic and concise programming language 100% interoperable with Java.

speaker: Shola Slick Akinrolie
title: Kotlin Ondo User Group
subject: Diving Deep into Kotlin
description: The talk will focus on digging deep into Kotlin language in android development, taking the participants through various steps in building android app in using Kotlin Language.

speaker: Shola Slick Akinrolie
title: Kotlin Night Ondo
subject: Kotlin an Enabler and easy Language for Android development
description: This talk will focus on facts, tips and advantages of writing android applications using Kotlin, it will also enlighten participants on available tools and structures of writing Kotlin language easily.

speaker: Shola Slick Akinrolie
title: Kotlin Night Aaua
subject: Kotlin the modern language we are all waiting for.
description: The talk will take the participants through Kotlin language, its simplicity, conciseness, interoperability and advantage over other languages

speaker: Shola Slick Akinrolie
title: Kotlin Night Ondo
subject: Kotlin HackFest
description: An hackathon using Kotlin language in developing a real life / crowdfunding app that can solve real life problem.

speaker: Adetayo James
title: Kotlin Abuja User Group
subject: Kotlin in Action
description: Most developers new to Kotlin have a default mindset about the language been used only for Android Development as adopted by Google at Google I/O 2017. Beyond Android, Kotlin is a programming language applicable in other areas of software development, such as web, server-side, etc. This talk is intended to serve as an eye opener to these numerous areas where Kotlin programming language is applicable.

speaker: Adetayo James
title: Kotlin Abuja User Group
subject: Kotlin in Action
description: Most developers new to Kotlin have a default mindset about the language been used only for Android Development as adopted by Google at Google I/O 2017. Beyond Android, Kotlin is a programming language applicable in other areas of software development, such as web, server-side, etc. This talk is intended to serve as an eye opener to these numerous areas where Kotlin programming language is applicable.

speaker: Brayan Mamani Mamani
title: Kotlin El Alto User Group
subject: Fundamentos de Kotlin para Android
description: Conoceremos los fundamentos necesarios para crear aplicaciones Android con Kotlin utilizando la programación orientada a objetos.

speaker: Brayan Mamani Mamani
title: Kotlin El Alto User Group
subject: Conociendo a Kotlin
description: Kotlin es un lenguaje relativamente nuevo que compila a Javascript y a bytecode del JVM. Fue diseñado por Jetbrains y ha crecido mucho en popularidad desde que se lanzó la versión 1.0 hace dos años. Se usa sobre todo para hacer apps de Android porque es compatible con Java SE pero tiene una sintaxis muy agradable como los lenguajes modernos de hoy. Estaremos repasando las características básicas de Kotlin y de la programación funcional en Kotlin. Si queda tiempo, habrá una demostración de async/await.

speaker: Yousuf Haque
title: New York Android Developers
subject: Level up your Kotlin game
description: Most Kotlin features are easy to pick up and obvious in their benefit, but there are a bunch of features sneaking around the standard library and at the language level that are not as prominent. This talk is a grab bag of such features, tips, tricks, and patterns that you can use to bring your Kotlin skill to the next level.

speaker: Marco Ferrer
title: GDG Miami
subject: Code sharing with Kotlin (JVM / JS / Native)
description:
In this talk, Marco Ferrer will cover the principle of "Write once, target many" using Kotlin's multi-platform projects.

We will start by setting up a new multi-platform project. Once set up, we will tackle how to write our common business logic in a platform agnostic way. Finally, we will compile our common code for our target platforms, and show how to include it in a platform-specific way. In addition, we will review a full multi-platform example app by JetBrains. This example will depict the power of sharing code between Android, JVM Backend, and iOS.

Attendees wishing to follow along in the demo should bring a laptop with any Kotlin supporting IDE of their choice. Since Kotlin multiplatform is still in beta, the latest version of IntelliJ Idea is recommended because of its bundled support for Kotlin multiplatform.

speaker: Duško Bajić
title: Kotlin User Group Bosnia
subject: Think Reactive. Programming with RxJava
description:
The world is asynchronous so are apps should be as well. Let's see how RxJava helps us with that. Are there any benefits? Can we think and code other than imperative way?

We'll use RxKotlin/RxJava example to present possible advantages and imperfections of this approach. We know what procedural programming is, and we all use object-oriented approach. Could RX make it easier for us?

speaker: Adrián Bukros
title: Kotlin Budapest User Group
subject: Koin vs Kodein - Dependency injection with Kotlin

speaker: Ricardo Lage
title: Paris Android User Group
subject: Migrating from AutoValue to Kotlin data classes
description: AutoValue is a powerful tool provided by Google to generate Java immutable value classes. If you are migrating your project to Kotlin, data classes are the most direct way to replace it while keeping the same features. There are however trade-offs to take into account. In this talk we will discuss how we migrated our project from AutoValue to Kotlin data classes and how we dealt with the issues we encountered along the way. We will also discuss the advantages and disadvantages of each approach in terms of build time, apk size, method count and serialization time.

speaker: Roman Elizarov
title: Leroy Merlin Kotlin Meetup
subject: Введение в Kotlin
description: Язык Kotlin создавался как современная и прагматичная замена для языка Java. В этом докладе мы познакомимся с его основными отличительными особенностями и возможностями, комбинации которых позволяют писать на языке Kotlin лаконичный и красивый код — код, в котором меньше церемоний и больше сути. Мы увидим на примерах, как писать код, который читается как проза, и, как писать код, который является визуальным представлением объектов того бизнес-домена, с которым нам приходится работать

speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
title: Leroy Merlin Kotlin Meetup
subject: State of Kotlin Ecosystem
description: Прошло два года с релиза Kotlin 1.0. Что же поменялось за эти два года, как выросла экосистема? В этом докладе мы рассмотрим популярные библиотеки и фреймворки для Kotlin. А также на примере нескольких Java фреймворков/библиотек рассмотрим некоторые проблемы использования Java библиотек и их решение.

speaker: Hugo Witsel
title: Kotlin User Group Serbia
subject: Kotlin @ Ximedes
description: In his talk, Hugo will share the first-hand experience from the process of switching from Java to Kotlin in 2017. One of the main points you should take from the meetup is why Ximedes, a Java development house, chose to switch to Kotlin and what is their experience along the way.

speaker: Tobias Heine, Said Tahsin Dane
title: Kotlin Night Berlin 2018
subject: (Code) Sharing is caring: An Introduction to Kotlin Multiplatform projects
description: In this talk we will deep dive into JetBrains multiplatform projects feature, why you should consider using it and how you can do so to level up your product development.

speaker: Konstantin Otte
title: Kotlin Night Berlin 2018
subject: Building domain-specific languages with Kotlin
description: Our projects consist of countless domains. In this talk we will learn how to use Kotlin to create expressive ways to interact with them.

speaker: Nelson Osacky
title: Kotlin Night Berlin 2018
subject: Groovy to Kotlin migrations in build.gradle files
description: Enjoy type safety in your build.gradle files. This talk will cover some common migration scenarios as well as some pros and cons of switching from build.gradle to build.gradle.kts.

speaker: Seri
title: [秋葉原][とらのあな] Kotlin勉強会 2/20 火
subject: Kotlinを使ったWEBアプリケーション開発の始め方

speaker: Artur Czopek
title: Coimbra JUG
subject: Practical Kotlin
description: You have probably already heard about Kotlin. But why it is better than other JVM languages? What Kotlin has that Java does not? What Kotlin has in common with JavaScript? Why do Android developers love Kotlin? You can find answers for all these questions in my presentation. I will show you basic Kotlin rules, its main conceptions and how to use this language on a daily basis. Finally, we will try to create a real-life application based on Kotlin and Spring Boot.

speaker: Benjamin Schmid
title: Java User Group Darmstadt
subject: Java++: Effiziente & sichere JVM-Entwicklung mit Kotlin
description:
Kotlin ist eine innovative, freie und statisch typisierte Programmiersprache die in JVM Bytecode, Javascript und native Binaries compiliert. Auf ihrer Heimatplattform, der JVM, verfolgt Kotlin das Ziel vollständige Java-kompatibel zu bleiben und gleichzeitig sicherer und präziser zu sein. Die ausdrucksstarke und dennoch gut lesbaren Syntax mit funktionalen Features verspricht weniger Boilerplate Code bei zugleich fehlerärmeren Entwicklung. Ausgerichtet auf den Unternehmenseinsatz hat für Kotlin neben der exzellenten Interoperabilität mit Java stets auch die gute Verständlichkeit, schnelle Compilierzeiten und eine hervorragende Tooling-Unterstützungen hohe Priorität.

JetBrains war von Anfang an stets bemüht Kotlin als ein offenes, unabhängiges und dauerhaft überlebensfähiges Projekt zu etablieren. Spätestens seitdem Kotlin im Mai 2017 auf der Google I/O offiziell in die Android Plattform eingezogen ist, dürfte dies nun endgültig als gesichert gelten und es ist an der Zeit einen intensiven Blick auf diese vollwertige Java Alternative zu werfen.

In dieser Session erleben wir live, wie es sich anfühlt der NullpointerException auf Nimmerwiedersehen zu sagen und sie für Entwicklung gegen funktionale Features, Dataclasses und Extension-Methods einzutauschen. Codebeispiele helfen beim Kennenlernen der Sprache und vermitteln lebendige Eindrücke. Im Fortgeschrittenen Teil der Session blicken wir z.B. auf die Higher-order Functions und der Möglichkeit zur Gestaltung typsicherer DSLs mittels Empfängerobjekten und welche Verbindungen sich hier mit Gradle ergeben. Ein Aus- und Rückblick auf die letzten Neuerungen wie z.B. der Möglichkeit zu nativen iOS Anwendungen und Multiplattform-Projekten rundet das Ganze ab.

speaker: Josh Skeen
title: Big Nerd Ranch
subject: Kotlin Language Fundamentals
description: Join Big Nerd Ranch for a weekend of intensive learning where Josh Skeen, author, developer and instructor, will introduce Kotlin, a new language for Android development. We will cover Kotlin development techniques, language principles, and how to migrate your existing Java projects to Kotlin. We’ll show you why Google has pinned Kotlin as the future of Android development.

speaker: Todd Ginsberg
title: Oracle Code 2018
subject: Is Kotlin Right for You?
description: Sure Java pays the bills for some of us, but there’s no reason why we can’t have fun developing again. Kotlin, developed by JetBrains, has been catching on lately because of its functional nature, null safety, type inference, full interoperability with Java, cross-platform support, and ease of use with Android and Spring. Is this something you and your team should considering spending time to learn? In this session we will go over what Kotlin is, what problems it solves, and what makes it stand out from other JVM languages. You’ll come away with enough knowledge to decide if this is something you and your team should consider adopting.

speaker: Thomas Segismont
title: Virtual Eclipse Community MeetUp
subject: Unleash Your Talents- Server-Side Kotlin for Mobile Devs w/ Eclipse Vert.x
description: Kotlin is a popular alternative language for Android applications. Mobile developers love it because it brings modern programming constructs yet allows for compatibility with a wide range of devices (more than 80 percent use a runtime version released in or before 2015) and it is fully interoperable with existing libraries. But Kotlin is versatile and can be used on the server side too. In this session, you will witness the creation of a mobile backend for an Android music player. You will learn how to use the Eclipse Vert.x toolkit to build an HTTP server with Kotlin and RxJava. And then the presenter will expose a web API to provide the application with catalog, search, and streaming features. Kotlin programmers, unleash your talents and become full-stack mobile developers!

speaker: Victoria Gonda
title: Software GR and GLSEC
subject: Functional Android
description: For the most part, programming in Android has meant living in the imperative programming world. Recently, many aspects of functional programming have become standard with the adoption of Kotlin and RxJava. What does it mean to use functional paradigm properties in our Android code, and how can it help us? In this talk you’ll learn some of the fundamentals of functional programming, and what this might look like on Android

speaker: Gen Ashley, Ana Capatina
title: Women Who Code London
subject: Kotlin Workshop - Kotlin Basics: Build a simple Sudoku Game - Standalone App

speaker: John Keyes
title: Columbus Kotlin User Group
subject: Coroutines on Presentation a This is
description: Kotlin Coroutines aim to provide simplicity in a world where push-based and asynchronous programming are quickly becoming the norm. Allowing you to write more traditional, sequential code, Coroutines abstract away the complexities of modern concurrent programming into simple, concise APIs. In this talk, we'll explore how Coroutines tackle these complexities and why JetBrains believes this to be the future.

speaker: Marcus Fihlon
title: Kotlin Swiss User Group
subject: Kotlin EE – Boost Your Productivity
description:
Kotlin ist eine Sprache für die JVM, die von JetBrains vor einigen Jahren erfunden wurde. Aber was zum Teufel ist Kotlin EE? Wenn du noch nie von Kotlin EE gehört hast, keine Panik, es existiert nicht. Aber du kannst es sofort nutzen und deine Produktivität steigern!

Ich habe den Begriff Kotlin EE als Synonym für die Verwendung der Kotlin-Sprache zusammen mit der Java EE API erfunden, um Services jeder Grösse (Mikroservices, Nanoservices etc.) mit nur wenigen Zeilen Code und der Fähigkeit, sich auf die Geschäftslogik zu konzentrieren, zu entwickeln.

Kotlin und Java EE sind ein perfektes Paar, um Micro- oder Nanoservices zu schreiben. Kotlin ist eine sehr pragmatische Sprache, die auf vielen aus anderen Sprachen bekannten Konzepten und Techniken aufbaut, die mit dem Fokus auf die Produktivität des Entwicklers entworfen wurde. Kotlin arbeitet hervorragend mit allen existierenden Java-Bibliotheken und Frameworks zusammen und läuft mit derselben Performance wie Java.

Die Java EE API erlaubt es uns, gegen eine bewährte und stabile API zu programmieren. Mitgelieferte Bibliotheken wie JAX-RS für das Schreiben von RESTful APIs und Jackson für JSON (de)serializing verringern den Bedarf an zusätzlichen Bibliotheken von Drittanbietern, was zu einer kurzen Buildtime und einer geringen Artefaktgrösse führt. Profitiere auch du von sehr schnellem Build- und Test-Feedback und konzentriere dich auf deinen Code.

Im Anschluss an die Präsentation der theoretischen Grundlagen werde ich während eines riskanten Live-Codings mit Kotlin und der Java EE API sowie Docker zwei Services mit einer RESTful JSON API entwickeln, die miteinander kommunizieren und diese in einer Docker Cloud publizieren sowie skalieren. Coding, building, testing, deploying, scaling: pragmatisch, schnell und effizie

speaker: George Lesica
title: Montana Programmers
subject: Android Apps with Kotlin
description:
There are a plethora of ways to build Android apps these days. One relative newcomer is Kotlin, a JVM language from JetBrains (the IDE people). It is now an official Android language and is supported in Android Studio.

Why would someone use Kotlin instead of Java? Let’s find out! We’ll take a simple Android app written in Java and convert it to Kotlin. In the process, we’ll take a look at some of the features that might make Kotlin an attractive choice for projects new and old, and we’ll discuss the pros and cons of using Kotlin for Android development.

speaker: Vincent Carrier
title: GDG Montreal Android
subject: The Zen of Kotlin
description: Tips and tricks for maximizing code maintainability How is internal visibility in Kotlin different from package visibility in Java? When should you use a lateinit property and when should you use a lazy-delegated property? How do you use with(), let() and apply()? How do you replace your confusing Dagger annotations with something more Kotlin-esque? Find out the answer to these questions and many more with me!

speaker: Étienne Caron
title: GDG Montreal Android
subject: Kotlin Best Practices
description: We'll explore the current Kotlin best practices and idioms. We'll also take a look at the Google Kotlin Android style guide.

speaker: Nick DiPatri
title: PhillyDev
subject: Practical Kotlin with a Disco ball
description: Kotlin is the next shiny object and many of its facets will convince you to switch from Java. The last year has produced a flood of Kotlin libraries, plugins, idioms, conversion-from-Java and language style guides. In this talk, I will provide some focus on all this advice as I discuss how I converted my own ‘RoboButton’ IoT side-project to Kotlin. This talk features a live disco ball, so please dress accordingly.

speaker: Stanislav Erokhin
title: St. Petersburg Kotlin User Group
subject: Экспериментальные и релизные фичи в 1.3
description: Мы поговорим про будущий релиз Kotlin 1.3 — что нового будет добавлено, почему некоторое фичи будут экспериментальными и что это вообще означает. Также поговорим о новом back-end-е и зачем он нужен. Ну и напоследок расскажу про новый type inference и возможности, которые он привнесет.

speaker: Daniil Vodopjan
title: St. Petersburg Kotlin User Group
subject: Темные закоулки компилятора Kotlin
description:
Были ли Вы были в ситуации, когда две практически одинаковые Kotlin программы отличались в разы по производительности? И при попытке разобраться в чем же дело, Вам стали запутанно объяснять про устройство JVM и особенности компилятора Kotlin? Тогда этот доклад для Вас!

В этом докладе я поделюсь несколькими наблюдениями о том, что и как оптимизируется компилятором Kotlin, а также правилами и идиомами для эксплуатации этих оптимизаций. Мы сфокусируемся на "неявных оптимизациях", которые не описаны в документации как таковые, но незнание которых может сильно покорежить конечный байткод.

Мы посмотрим на boxing примитивов в JVM и как его обходят разработчики Kotlin, на особенности лямбд в Kotlin и их компиляцию под JVM, оценим производительность работы со стандартными коллекциями и разберемся с компиляцией циклов и хвостовой рекурсии!

speaker: Roma Marinsky
title: Kyiv Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin for API test automation
description: This talk is about how Kotlin's flexibility helps to solve API test automation problems. Also, we'll review tools, libraries and approaches for test automation that simplify writing tests with Kotlin.

speaker: Irina Galata
title: Kyiv Kotlin User Group
subject: Animations? Easy!
description: Do want to know how to develop an animation for Android from a shot on Dribbble to a ready GitHub component? Find it out on this workshop, where we’ll step by step develop an animation with the power of Kotlin.

speaker: Josh Bancroft, Max Russek
title: Boulder Android
subject: Kotlin: or, Things I Didn't Even Know I Hated Doing In Java
description:
Kotlin has changed how we make Android apps in a very short amount of time, and in the change, some of us have been thinking: "I can't believe I used to do this the hard way!"

Join Max and Josh at Boulder Digital Arts for an expose of particularly annoying things about Java that are now a snap with Kotlin. It will be a fun list of cruft, boilerplate, useless processes, backwards thinking, and needless risks. Things where, now that we're not longer doing it, we're left wondering how we coped before. We'll highlight the old and busted and detail how to use Kotlin to never have to do them again.

speaker: Bajić Duško
title: Kotlin User Group Bosnia
subject: Kotlin is here to stay
description: Overview of Kotlin usage in web and mobile with examples of functional approac h with Kotlin

speaker: Gen Ashley, Ana Capatina
title: Women Who Code London
subject: Kotlin Workshop Series - Improved Sudoku board validation and testing
description:
In this Kotlin workshop, we will continue working on our simple Sudoku Game by loading initial data from file, adding proper board validation and tests.

If you missed Part 1 last week (standalone app), go here to work on the exercise from last week >> this points to the github repository for Part 1 of the workshop >> The README file contains all links needed (tutorial + resources) >> https://goo.gl/syg2jj

** NOTE: This is a Hands-On Session, so you need to bring your laptop.

speaker: Juan Urrego
title: Cape Town Java Community (CTJC)
subject: Kotlin in a Serverless Architecture with AWS Lambda

speaker: Artur Czopek
title: Coimbra JUG
subject: Practical Kotlin
description: You have probably already heard about Kotlin. But why it is better than other JVM languages? What Kotlin has that Java does not? What Kotlin has in common with JavaScript? Why do Android developers love Kotlin? You can find answers for all these questions in my presentation. I will show you basic Kotlin rules, its main conceptions and how to use this language on a daily basis. Finally, we will try to create a real-life application based on Kotlin and Spring Boot.

speaker: Varsha Venkatesh
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Getting your team to love Kotlin
description: So you’ve discovered the joys of Kotlin, but your team isn’t feeling the love just yet. This talk will introduce a plan that will get your codebase from zero to coroutines in no time. Along the way, we will talk about how Wayfair got started with Kotlin, the things we did right the first time, and the things we could have done better.

speaker: Patrick Beagan
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Klean Kotlin - How Kotlin can enhance clean architecture
description: This talk will give an overview of clean architecture and the Wayfair implementation of it for Android. It will go into how adding kotlin into the app changed how the app was architected, and allowed for more expressiveness with greater separation of concerns.

speaker: Anthony Gallo
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Klean Kotlin - How Kotlin can enhance clean architecture
description: In this talk, Anthony will go over his findings of how to setup a multi-platform project between Android and iOS using kotlin native to share a majority of a codebase. The talk will dive into pros and cons of this implementation along with potential solutions that can make the implementation even more usable.

speaker: Christoph, Wolf
title: Ubiqum Code Academy - Berlin
subject: A Primer To Kotlin: An alternative JVM language
description: Have you been wondering what the hype around Kotlin is about? Are you curious to learn a little bit about this JVM (and other platforms) based language? Kat is a Senior Developer with over 10 years experience, primarily in Java, however currently working with Kotlin on the backend. She will be giving an introduction to the Kotlin language, including some of the main features, naturally with some comparisons to Java.

speaker: Walmyr Carvalho
title: GDG-SP
subject: Android + kotlin coroutines: Async de um jeito "diferente"

speaker: Mani Gautam
title: Deep Dive Into .NET Core, Angular v5 and Kotlin
subject: Getting Started with Kotlin for Android Application Development
description:
Introduction of Kotlin What is Kotlin? JAVA vs Kotlin Evaluation of Kotlin Version history of Kotlin Applications of Kotlin

Setup IDE for Kotlin Installation and configuration with Eclipse Installation and configuration with Android Studio Installation and configuration with Intellij

Understanding Kotlin Syntax Java syntax vs Kotlin syntax Creating kotlin classes and Activities Difference between val and var declaration Getting references of controls in Kotlin classes

Basics of Kotlin with Itellij Basic Conditional statement Example Control statements

Developing Android application using Kotlin How to create Project? About Tools will be used in Project Final Implementation of Project

speaker: Marcin Moskala
title: Voxxed Days Bucharest 2018
subject: Kotlin: Next level of Android Development
description:
Presentation is showing Kotlin features that made great impact on its popularity and describing whole Kotlin road to become Android first-class citizen.

Kotlin is becoming next Android language. Why? What are its advantages and what makes him so special that whole Android world is now switching to it? And is web development its next station?

speaker: Kirill Rakhman
title: Karlsruhe KUG. Kotlin Night Vol. 4
subject: Building a Browser Extension with Kotlin

speaker: Daniel Bälz
title: Karlsruhe KUG. Kotlin Night Vol. 4
subject: A very personal dive into my favorite Kotlin features

speaker: Benoît Quenaudon
title: Cybozu Meetup #10 モバイル で発表した内容
subject: KotlinでAndroid開発を気持ちよくしよう

speaker: Salomon Brys
title: Ch'ti JUG
subject: Découvrez Kotlin; fonctionnel ET objet, sur la VM Java ET JS ET pour Android!
description:
Nous avons le plaisir de vous convier à la prochaine session du Ch'ti JUG qui se déroulera le jeudi 15 février 2018 à 18h30 dans les locaux d'AXA France, à Wasquehal. La session sera animée par Salomon Brys et aura pour sujet le langage Kotlin.

Kotlin est un langage dont la croissance de popularite est de plus en plus impressionnante.

Meme si le langage a beaucoup d'adepte dans la communaute Android, beaucoup de plateformes beneficient de Kotlin.

Dans ce talk, je presenterai le langage dans les grandes lignes, sa syntaxe, ses principales fonctionnalites, ses outils et sa compatibilite avec Java.

Je développerai quelques concepts avancés qui font la beauté du langage, comme les coroutines.

Nous irons ensuite voir comment ce langage peut aussi compiler en Javascript, et meme en natif pour linux, windows, mac et meme iOS ! Le but de ce talk n'est pas de vous apprendre a coder en Kotlin, mais de vous donner une vue d'ensemble du langage et de ses capacités, et ainsi l'envie de l'apprendre !

Passionné de Kotlin depuis 4 ans, je suis le développeur et mainteneur de la librairie Kodein. Kodein 5.0 est la librarairie de DI n°1 en Kotlin et la première librairie Kotlin à être disponible sur toute les plateformes supportées par Kotlin.

Fortement ancré dans la philosophie Open-Source, je suis dédié à la création d'outils et de librairies pour rendre la programmation plus facile, plus sûre et plus fun.

Je suis aussi addict aux jeux de sociétés et au pilotage d'avions de tourisme.

speaker: Rebecca Franks
title: Kotlin Software Development Meetup
subject: Learning Kotlin: An Android Developer’s Journey
description: Learning a new programming language is a daunting thought. It is not an overnight accomplishment, where the next day you are suddenly well versed in the new language. Rebecca is in the process of learning Kotlin. She has often felt like the biggest imposter trying to learn this new language that is growing in popularity. She has had thoughts like: “But there are so many experts out there, I’ll never know as much as them.”, “How can I start writing Kotlin when I don’t know all the features there are in the language?”. The biggest lesson she has learned about learning Kotlin is to just write it. In this talk, she will cover some of the nifty features she has explored in Kotlin, as well as the many different ways she has gone about trying to learn this new language, slowly overcoming her imposter syndrome whilst writing Kotlin code.

speaker: Vitaly Marcus
title: St. Petersburg Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin: Ожидание - Реальность. Или почему ожидания Java программистов от Kotlin далеки от реальности
description:
Относительно новый язык Kotlin стремительно набирает популярность. Все больше новых приложений пишется практически полностью на языке Kotlin обычными Java разработчиками. При этом практика показывает, что некоторые особенности языка Kotlin для них могут быть неожиданными, а способы их обработки - неочевидными.

Основная цель доклада - разобрать типичные ошибки начинающих Kotlin разработчиков, которые они могут совершить при переходе с Java.

В докладе будут рассмотрены трудности, с которыми может столкнуться Java программист при использовании языка Kotlin на Android, а также способы их преодоления. Мы разберемся, почему происходит падение приложений с NullPointerException, почему не работают аннотации, почему Koltin код иногда выглядит недостаточно эстетично, проанализируем особенности работы интерфейсов и многое другое.

speaker: Dmitry Zhemerov
title: St. Petersburg Kotlin User Group
subject: Разработка мультиплатформенных проектов на Kotlin
description:
В Kotlin 1.2 появилась поддержка разработки мультиплатформенных проектов. Мультиплатформенные проекты позволяют вам переиспользовать бизнес-логику, написанную на Kotlin, между всеми компонентами вашего приложения - серверным кодом на JVM, фронтэндом на JS, а также мобильными приложениями. Общая часть кода компилируется под все платформы и может обращаться к платформенно-зависимым реализациям тех или иных API или библиотек. Платформенно-зависимые части также пишутся на Kotlin и имеют полный доступ к фичам соответствующей платформы.

В этом докладе мы посмотрим на фичи языка и IDE, которые позволяют разрабатывать мультиплатформенные проекты, и на библиотеки, которые могут использоваться в таких проектах. В качестве примера мы рассмотрим проект, который поддерживает изоморфную отрисовку HTML (переиспользование кода, создающего HTML, между фронтэндом и бэкэндом).

speaker: Gisele Legionnet-Klees, Wolfram Rittmeyer
title: Google Developer Group Düsseldorf
subject: Kotlin DSLs
description:
Kotlin is not just about null safety or data classes. Kotlin has much more to offer. One of the nice things is the ability to use Kotlin's features to create domain specific languages (DSLs).

In this talk you will see samples of DSLs from a wide variety of backgrounds like Spring, Android and Android testing. And you will learn how those DSLs work and how to create your own DSL based on that knowledge.

speaker: Barry Martin
title: Morgantown Codes
subject: Trimming Codebases with Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a new(ish) language started by JetBrains in 2011. It aims to be an industrial-strength object-oriented language but still be fully interoperable with Java code. Kotlin can be additionally be compiled to Javascript or to Native binaries via LLVM. Come learn how you can add Kotlin to your existing Java projects through real world examples. Additionally learn how certain Kotlin features such as Data classes help trim fat from your code bas

speaker: Xavier Detant
title: Kotlin Paris Meetup
subject: Multi-platform Kotlin in real life and Hexagonal Architecture
description:
Right now, you can write kotlin code that compile to Java and Javascript. You also can use platform specific framworks, like Spring boot for Java and React for Javascript.

But what happens when you do all of that at the same time ? During this talk we'll look at a projet that's doing just that and also see how great it is for implementing an Hexagonal Architecture.

speaker: Simone Civetta
title: Kotlin Paris Meetup
subject: Build a cross-platform module reusable on Android and iOS
description:
While building entire cross-platform apps might often turn out to be a bad idea, mission-critical client-specific logic can greatly benefit from an unique codebase, allowing code to be written - and tested - once. Since end 2016, Kotlin/Native can compile Kotlin code to a binary form, which can be embedded into a native app.

In this talk you will learn why it makes sense, and how, to leverage these experimental features and build a cross-platform module reusable on both Android and iOS.

speaker: Andrey Mishchenko
title: Google Developer Group Novosibirsk
subject: Kotlin Coroutines и Android
description:
Возможно вы уже знаете что такое Coroutines, но даже если нет, доклад постарается максимально сжато и практично объяснить что же это такое и как это можно использовать в Android разработке: работа с сетью, файлами, анимацией и даже диалогами. Как ужиться с жизненным циклом и дать шанс на решение его фундаментальных проблем.

И конечно холиварное: стоит ли переезжать с RxJava на Coroutines

speaker: Joshua Welchez
title: GDG San Pedro Sula
subject: Making Android Apps with Kotlin
description: Android Development with Kotlin is a meetup for those who want to develop Android using and discovering Kotlin. The main objective of this meetup is to cover all the topics of mobile development in Android but with the new advantages and novelties that Kotlin presents, the new language approved by Google that is presented as an alternative to Java. Come join us and learn more about this neat language, the ecosystem surrounding it and what Kotlin can do for you!

speaker: Andrii Bezruchko
title: Kyiv Kotlin User Group
subject: HTTP/2 & Servlet 4.0
description:
HTTP is one of the most widely used protocols in the world. The version of HTTP 1.1, used to this day, was developed and described 18 years ago - 1999.

With the increasing complexity of web applications, the capabilities of HTTP 1.1 are already insufficient to provide increased demands on performance and responsiveness.

So in order to meet new requirements, HTTP must evolve. HTTP 2.0 is designed to make web applications faster, simple and reliable.

In this report I will tell about

- drawbacks of HTTP 1.1 and why we need a new version of HTTP.

- which advantages HTTP/2 offers in comparison with the previous version?

- how the new protocol affected the new version of SERVLET 4.0 and how we can use it.

speaker: Andrii Bezruchko
title: Kotlin User Group Cologne
subject: Clean Architecture in Kotlin
description: An introduction into clean architecture in Kotlin. The example project will contain of a Android app.

speaker: Joost Heijkoop
title: Kotlin.amsterdam
subject: Getting to know Kotlin
description: Starting with Android strait away proved to steep, so this time we will do a walk-through through the Kotlin syntax itself using the JVM.

speaker: Abdellah Ramadan
title: GDG Foumban
subject: Android-Kotlin meetup
description: Kotlin was announced last I/O as the official programming language for Android. Playing and building something with this language is fun. It's simple and easy to learn. We'll be building a to-do app with Firebase as the database and storage. Experimenting with Kotlin will help beginner programmers to learn and adopt this language.

speaker: Leila Amel
title: GDG Tiaret
subject: kotlin codelab
description:
GDG tiaret back to you with a new codelab about kotlin In this codelab, you'll learn how to build and run your first Android app in Kotlin

G1- How to use Android Studio to build your app.

G2- How to run your app on a device or in the emulator.

G3- How to add interactive buttons.

G4- How to display a second screen.

speaker: Hardik Trivedi
title: Google Developer Group Pune: GDG Pune
subject: Kotlin - a real problem solver

speaker: Mitchell Tilbrook
title: Android Australia User Group - Sydney
subject: Kotlin Backstage
description: Kotlin can make out source code smaller and more readable. But what is it doing to our bytecode. How does Kotlin bring amazing features into a runtime that technically does not support them? In this talk, we will go backstage and look at what Kotlin is doing under the hood to make our code run.

speaker: Michael Nexø
title: DroidDevs CPH
subject: Minimalistic DI in Kotlin
description: Kotlin's language features add a lot of power compared to Java. So much, that you can write a fully functioning dependency injection library in 373 lines of code instead of Dagger's 24,160.

speaker: Silvan van Leeuwen, Alan van Dam
title: bol.com Techlab
subject: Kotlin versus Java at bol.com
description: Kotlin versus Java at bol.com - In this talk we will take some ancient (java 1.4 style) code in java and show how java 1.8 helps us clean up that code to be more robust and readable. We will try to convince you that if Java is your weapon of choice, you need to hop on the hype train and start writing a bunch of streams. Next up we will take the java examples and contrast them to the new kid on the block. We will show that Kotlin gives us the same expressive power, but more readable and in less lines of code. We will show it to be less sensitive to embarrassing bugs and we will show you how you can seamlessly move from a Java codebase to a Hybrid to a Kotlin codebase.

speaker: Ninh Doan
title: Singapore Kotlin User group
subject: How to use Spring Boot with Kotlin

speaker: Li Wen
title: Singapore Kotlin User group
subject: The various quirks and gotchas when using Kotlin with JPA

speaker: Vojtech Sazel
title: DevConf.cz 2018
subject: Kotlin - multi-platform development and testing
description: Kotlin is now gaining popularity as a programming language especially for the Android development. But Kotlin is not focused only on JVM, it also compiles to JavaScript and there is a new experimental native code compilation.

speaker: Tara Simpson
title: Kotlin Training
subject: Kotlin Development
description: An intensive course for developers moving to Kotlin from other JVM languages. (Appreciate that this may not be the forum for this, but as Svetlana Isakova will be attending and certifying the course in person we would like to get the word out - thanks!)

speaker: Yury Igor Camacho
title: GDG Cochabamba
subject: Kotlin, compartiendo codigo entre plataformas
description: se mostará un demo de como podemos compartir codigo entre varias plataformas Android, backend, browser!

speaker: Dan Lew, Steve Peterson, Edgar Cobos
title: Twin Cities Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin Night Minneapolis

speaker: Eric Schrag
title: DevFest KC 2018
subject: Kotlin, Robert Jordan, And You: Better Communication With Kotlin
description: If you haven’t already learned Kotlin and converted your Java codebase, let me be the one to suggest you should. Switching from Java to Kotlin will help you write succinct, readable, and understandable code. Switching from Java to Kotlin is like switching from epic fantasy novels to novellas. In this talk, we’ll discuss a number of easy-to-understand examples of how reasoning about your code becomes easier when you write it in Kotlin, and review easy ways to get started using Kotlin in your codebase for real.

speaker: Giedrius Graževičius
title: Kotlin Night Kyiv 2018
subject: Evaluating a programming lang: a case for Kotlin and Scala

speaker: Andrey Breslav
title: Kotlin Night Kyiv 2018
subject: The state and future of Kotlin + Q/A session

speaker: Artyom Dorosh
title: Kotlin Night Kyiv 2018
subject: Approaching Clean Architecture with Kotlin in Android

speaker: Artyom Dorosh
title: Kotlin Night Kyiv 2018
subject: Approaching Clean Architecture with Kotlin in Android

speaker: Sergii Gnatiuk, Evgenii Lopushen
title: Kyiv Kotlin User Group
subject: The pitfalls of migration Java code to Kotlin
description: Someone migrates existing code to Kotlin, someone supports mixed project - it is a matter of choice. Those processes are made as simple as possible, however, in practice, you need to overcome a number of pitfalls, which will be discussed in this talk.

speaker: Antonio Leiva
title: GDG Castellón
subject: Kotlin para Android: El futuro es ahora
description: Estás aburrido de programar con Java en Android? ¿Harto de ver cómo tu código está lleno de NullPointerException? ¿Cansado de no poder utilizar las últimas novedades de los lenguajes modernos? Gracias a Kotlin se abre un nuevo mundo de posibilidades impensables hasta ahora en el desarrollo de Apps Android. En esta charla veremos cómo Kotlin nos facilita la interacción con el framework de Android, cómo reduce la complejidad del código y mejora su legibilidad, haciendo nuestras apps más robustas y mantenibles.

speaker: Dinçel Taşpınar, Mehmet Kose
title: Coders Antalya
subject: Kotlin ile mobil uygulama geliştirme
description: Bu hafta kahvaltı sohbeti ve programlama konusu olarak Kotlin diliyle Android programlamaya giriş yapıyoruz. Sunum ve workshop tarzı uygulamamamız olacak.

speaker: Stepan Goncharov
title: Java User Group Bangladesh (JUGBD)
subject: What is Kotlin and why should you care
description: Dive to the technology behind Kotlin-JVM, Kotlin-JS, Kotlin-Native and using Kotlin for Android development.

speaker: Alex Gherschon
title: KotlinTLV
subject: Kotlin on Android & Gradle
description: As Android developers, we use gradle plugins every day but what are those plugins? Where are they stored, and where do they run? We will look at what it means to write a Gradle Plugin, which languages are generally used and where Kotlin fits into the big picture.

speaker: Joost Heijkoop
title: Kotlin.amsterdam
subject: Playing with Kotlin and Android
description:
This will be a free format meetup where you should bring a laptop with Kotlin installed.

My first goal is to get a hello world app running and see what ever extra happens.

speaker: Darran Kelinske
title: Austin Android Developers Meetup
subject: Happy New Years! Kotlin Book Club - Part 4 - Coroutines and Testing
description: The book we're reading is Kotlin for Android Developers, an example-driven book that will teach you Kotlin as you develop an app. Join us to discuss examples found in the book, ask questions, and learn more about the language with your fellow developers.

speaker: Ravindra Kumar
title: Austin Android Developers Meetup
subject: Pragmatic Kotlin for Android Developers
description: Welcome to 1st ever BlrKotlin meetup. Since this is the 1st meetup, we have limited seats. So please make sure you attend it if RSVPed. Talks can be from any topic as we haven't covered any topic. We will keep you all posted about the talks when finalized.

speaker: Adit Lal
title: Austin Android Developers Meetup
subject: Save Time in Android Development with Kotlin
description: Welcome to 1st ever BlrKotlin meetup. Since this is the 1st meetup, we have limited seats. So please make sure you attend it if RSVPed. Talks can be from any topic as we haven't covered any topic. We will keep you all posted about the talks when finalized.

speaker: Abdellah SELASSI
title: Rabat Kotlin User Group
subject: WBDD .. Spek to the rescue!
description: When you join a project you need to understand some part of the system that will work on, and I don't think that your manager will give you all the spec documents, maybe himself doesn't have them, hence the only way to understand the project is through the written tests ?

speaker: Ian Brandt
title: San Diego Kotlin User Group
subject: SD Kotlin Kick-Off Social
description: Let's kick things off with a social gathering to discuss formation questions, such as: Who might have a suitable location, and be willing, to host our regular monthly meetings? When, if not the 1st Wednesday of each month, to hold regular meetings going forward? What meeting format would people like to see (one or two speakers, lightning talks, hands-on coding or bring-your-own-problem sessions, etc.)?

speaker: Grégory Bévan, Nicolas Lepage
title: NightClazz by Zenika Nantes
subject: Découvrir et comprendre Kotlin par la pratique
description:
Kotlin est le langage de programmation révélé par JetBrains en 2011. La volonté affirmée de ce nouveau langage est de simplifier le développement d'applications compilées pour la JVM ou transpilées vers du JavaScript, voir même natives avec le compilateur LLVM. L'objectif du langage est d'être compatible avec l'existant, de permettre l'utilisation simple des paradigmes de la programmation fonctionnelle, de simplifier l'écriture du code et libérer les développeurs des erreurs les plus communes.

Kotlin gagne en popularité depuis la sortie officielle de sa version 1.0. Petit à petit, il devient la référence à la fois dans le monde du mobile (Android), du backend (Spring) et des outils (Gradle).

speaker: Akira Aratani
title: CyberAgent Group
subject: KotlinConf Report. Kotlin Types Updated
description: This presentation based on Kotlin Exposed Type by Svetlana Isakova in Kotlin Conf 2017.

speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
title: BreizhJUG
subject: Pourquoi Spring <3 Kotlin
description:
J'expliquerai pourquoi Spring <3 Kotlin et comment utiliser le support officiel de ce langage qui sera disponible dans Spring Framework 5 [1], Spring Boot 2 et Spring Data Kay pour développer votre prochaine application Spring plus efficacement tout en vous faisant plaisir.

Je décrirai comment transformer étape par étape un projet Spring Boot 1.0 écrit en Java en un projet Spring Boot 2.0 écrit en Kotlin tournant sur le nouveau framework réactif Spring WebFlux :

- Etape 1: Pourquoi choisir Kotlin et comment l'utiliser à la place de Java 8

- Etape 2: Mise à jour vers Spring Framework 5 et Spring Boot 2.0

- Etape 3: Migrer de Spring MVC à Spring WebFlux et ses API réactives

- Etape 4: Utiliser l'API fonctionnelle de Spring

speaker: Mauricio Sierra, Alberto J Arias
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: Corda.net a Distributed Ledger built with Kotlin
description:
Come to learn about Corda, one of the most promising Distributed Ledger Technologies (DLT) developed using the Kotlin programming languages, created by R3.

R3 was founded by a consortium of the largest financial institutions with the mandate to create a pragmatic DLT to implement a payment system and a smart contract platform.

Corda is open source, version 2.0 was release in Nov 2017. This platform has the potential to be used not only by financial institutions but also for many other industries.

speaker: Victor Kropp
title: GDG Nuremberg Android
subject: Kotlin coroutines with Victor Kropp (JetBrains)
description: Victor Kropp from JetBrains Munich will give a talk about his experience with Kotlin over the last years. He's been using Kotlin for several years now and can provide some deep insight into the language and its features. The main focus though is on Kotlin's suspendable functions also known as coroutines, which allow supporting async/await, yield and similar patterns. Victor will show how to use coroutines in Kotlin and how they work under the hood.

speaker: Kenny Adorisio, Jinn Kim
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Applying Kotlin at Starry / Big Data Big Kotlin
description:
Kotlin Office Hours is a monthly meetup where software developers of all backgrounds who want to learn Kotlin or improve their Kotlin skills can come, share their experiences and get help with their Kotlin projects.

Kotlin is an open-source programming language developed by JetBrains and has seen an upswell of interest since it's 1.0 release in 2016. It now supports not only JVM but JavaScript and LLVM architectures as well. We will have experts speaking about Kotlin and its use in these various architectures, showing their knowledge and the projects that they are working on.

speaker: Piotr Ślesarew
title: TOAST - Android Developers Meetups
subject: Magic sugars that can make your Kotlin codebase happier
description: Kotlin language brings tons of new concepts and features to your miserable programming life and it is really hard to use all of them in your daily duties. After almost two years of using Kotlin in production, the language itself can give me joy and satisfaction. How is it possible? Because of its many small sweet sugars .
