In this talk, I would like to share with you my favorite Kotlin candies that I discovered when I was in need of writing robust and concise components for Android applications.

speaker: Álvaro Menezes
title: GDG Porto Alegre
subject: Kotlin: Ola mundo, vim pra ficar!
description: Adotada como linguagem oficial para desenvolvimento Android em maio 2017, seu uso cresceu exponencialmente, entretanto a linguagem pode ser adotada para outras finalidades.Nesta palestra iremos passar um overview da linguagem e seus usos no cenário atual

speaker: Naoto Nakazato
title: DroidKaigi 2018
subject: Kotlinアンチパターン
description:
KotlinはJavaよりもシンプルで安全なコードを書くことができます。また、同じ処理を書く場合も、いくつかのやり方があります。文法に関する説明は、公式ドキュメントを見れば分かりますが、使いどころ、特にAndroidアプリ開発における使いどころについては、まだそれぞれ模索している段階といってよいのではないでしょうか。

このセッションでは、私がフルKotlinのアプリをチームで開発した経験の中で分かった、Kotlinの各種文法の適切な使いどころや、バグを生みやすいコードのパターンなどを紹介してみたいと思います。

例えば、lateinitとnull初期化の使い分け、interfaceのデフォルト実装とabstractクラスの使い分け、引数なしの関数とcustom getterの使い分け、定数とlazyとcustom getterの使い分けなどがあります。また、property delegationの使いどころ、スコープ関数の使いどころ、レシーバー付き関数型の使いどころなど、Kotlinの基本文法を紹介しつつ、Androidアプリ開発をした経験からActivityライフサイクルやFragmentライフサイクルに合わせた使いどころ・注意点などについて解説してみたいと思います。

speaker: Miquel Beltran
title: DroidKaigi 2018
subject: Say bye to Fragments with Conductor & Kotlin
description: Have you ever got a crash because you did something wrong with a Fragment? I did, many times! Fragments are not easy to use, and many experts even recommend to avoid them. But what is the alternative? We tried Conductor, we liked it and I am going to show you what can you do with it.

speaker: Keisuke Kiuchi
title: DroidKaigi 2018
subject: Kotlin版CleanArchitectureのテンプレート作ったら爆速開発になった話＋α
description:
CleanArchitectureは各レイヤーごとに役割が明確に決まっており、大規模開発などに非常に向いている。

しかし一方、大きなデメリットとして ・DI周りの実装がそもそも解りづらい(特にDagger) ・クラス数が多くなる→単純に作業量、コード量が増える＆ケアレスミスですぐ動かなくなる ・CleanArchitectureの構造を理解していないとオレオレ実装が蔓延る といったものがあるのではないだろうか。

そこで注目したのがKotlinとTemplateの存在。共通のテンプレートを作成し、それを使うことで、

・DIの実装が解りづらい？→Templateがやってあげるよ ・作業量が増える？→Templateがやってあげるよ ・コード量が増える？→KotlinだからJavaより減るよ＆読みやすいよ ・ケアレスミス？→Templateがミスしやすそうなところは全部やるよ ・オレオレ実装？→みんな同じTemplate使えば差異がぐっと減るよ という状況を作り出した。

本発表では、上記のCleanArchitectureのデメリットを減らし、最大限活用したら開発が爆速になったお話に加え、CleanArchitectureを採用したことで得られたメリットについてお話しようと思います。

speaker: Mitchell Tilbrook
title: DroidKaigi 2018
subject: Kotlin Backstage
description:
Kotlin offers a modern language design in contrast to Java, while at the same time maintaining fully interoperably: Data classes, properties, delegation, inline functions, string interpolation and much more. But, if Java can't offer these features how can Kotlin, what does Kotlin do to make it possible to use this Syntactic sugar?

In this talk, we will go backstage and dig into the Bytecode that Kotlin generates to make all the features we love work on a runtime that technically does not support them. We will look at the impact kotlin code generations has on method count. Get a deeper understanding of how Object and companion object work and see the implications of the use of either under different circumstances. Finally look at common patterns that can help reduce the size of both the bytecode and method count.

speaker: Taro Nagasawa
title: DroidKaigi 2018
subject: はじめてのKotlinハンズオン
description: KAndroidの公式言語として仲間入りしたKotlinの初学者向けハンズオンです。 Kotlinの概要と誕生の背景から始め、 Kotlinの基本文法、クラスやオブジェクト、拡張関数を学び、体験します。 実際に手を動かす課題としては、FizzBuzzなどの簡単なものから、 クラスの定義とその機能追加などちょっとだけ本格的な内容も含みます。 Kotlinの言語そのものにフォーカスしているため、 本セッションで得られる知識は、Androidに限らず他の分野でも応用できるでしょう。

speaker: Edwin Derks
title: Utrecht Kotlin Meetup
subject: Kotlin Meetup: Kickoff
description:
Ben jij onlangs naar een conferentie of heb jij onlangs verschillende artikelen gelezen? Dan is de kans groot dat je het nieuwe fenomeen Kotlin bent tegengekomen. Kotlin is booming en verovert een hoop grondgebied de laatste tijd. Onlangs heeft Google Kotlin als officiële programmeertaal van Android benoemd.

Wil jij weten waarom Kotlin in opkomst is en wat het jou te bieden heeft kom dan dinsdag 16 januari naar de eerste meetup van de Kotlin User Group. Op deze avond zal jij kennis maken met alles wat Kotlin te bieden heeft.

speaker: Dave Ford
title: OC Android Developers
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description:
Kotlin is a super productive and practical language from JetBrains, the makers of IntelliJ and Android Studio. It compiles to JVM, Native and JavaScript. JetBrains is positioning it as a "Statically typed programming language for the JVM, Android and the browser".

In this presentation, I'll provide an introduction to Kotlin. I'll also share some of what I have learned in porting a production Java app to Kotlin.

speaker: Yoshinori Isogai
title: M3 Engineer
subject: How to Extend Alt + Enter
description: Describe how to extend alt + enter using Kotlin

speaker: Pawel Wlodarski
title: Java User Group Łódź
subject: Kotlin - wstęp do OOP i FP
description:
• Podstawowe różnice w składni pomiędzy Kotlinem i Javą

• Jak wołać kod Javy z Kotlina

• Jak definiować klasy w Kotlinie , konstruktory , definicje dostępu do pól itd

• Obiekty towarzyszące

• Definiowanie i rozszerzanie funkcji

speaker: Denis Anfossi
title: Google Developer Group Nice
subject: Codelab - Build sa première App Android avec Kotlin
description:
Kotlin est devenu le deuxième langage de programmation supporté officiellement par Google depuis la Google I/O 2017.

Je vous propose de découvrir le développement d'applications Android avec Kotlin au travers d'un Codelab permettant de réaliser une application très simple.

C'est l'occasion de s'essayer à une alternative au développement d'applications Android en Java et de pouvoir comparer des codes sources Java/Kotlin très simples.

Que vous souhaitiez vous essayer au développement Android avec Kotlin ou au développement Android tout court, ce Codelab est fait pour vous.

Chacun pourra avancer à son rythme sur le Codelab et je serais disponible pour vous accompagner sur sa réalisation.

speaker: Dmitriy Sobko
title: Ciklum Ukraine/Belarus knowledge sharing community
subject: Designing of REST API automation tests in Kotlin
description: Уявіть собі REST API з N кількістю ендпоїнтів та PostgreSQL з Mongo DB під капотом. Цей API можливо автоматизувати дійсно у нетривіальний спосіб, використовуючи при цьому найновіші технології та фреймворки: Kotlin, Spring Boot та Cucumber BDD.

speaker: Lovis Möller
title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
subject: Gang of Four Patterns in Kotlin
description:
How would some of the most famous design patterns in computer science look like in Kotlin?

Instead of converting Java Code, I will try to find a simpler, easier or more idiomatic way to solve the same problem each pattern is solving.

speaker: Daniel Garnier-Moiroux
title: Spring Meetup Paris
subject: Soirée Du `fun` dans ton Spring Boot
description:
Spring Boot a boosté la vélocité de nombreux devs Java, avec des nombreuses opinions et pré-configurations qui en font un excellent starter pack, à la manière d'un Ruby on Rails, tout en offrant les vastes possibilités de Spring.

Pour ajouter un peu "Ruby" dans votre "Rails", Kotlin vous propose du sucre syntaxique et de nombreux constructs absents de Java, pour une utilisation beaucoup plus fun de la JVM.

Pensé par JetBrains (éditeur d'IntelliJ) comme un langage de qualité industrielle, Kotlin met l'accent sur la productivité des développeurs, tout en étant inter-opérable Java et tout son écosystème de libs open source.

speaker: Gustavo Lizárraga
title: Android Camp Bolivia 2017
subject: Kotlin de principio a fin
description: Hace algunos meses que Kotlin salió como lenguaje oficial para el desarrollo de aplicaciones Android, ahora tenemos mas posibilidades de desarrollar aplicaciones móviles en Android con un segundo lenguaje aparte de Java.

speaker: David Blanc
title: GDG Toulouse
subject: Introduction to RxJava with Kotlin
description: An introduction to the powerful library RxJava and the concept or Reactive programming for Android development, using the power of the Kotlin language

speaker: Andrii Rodionov
title: Kyiv Kotlin UG: First Blood
subject: Fun with Kotlin Generics
description:
“[Generics] are a disaster; they have made Java harder to learn and to understand, and you can’t avoid them.” — Tim Bray, Sun Microsystems (co-authors of the original XML specification)

This is about Java, but what about Kotlin?

In this talk we will try to touch the same staff in Kotlin and take a look at following topics:

- Syntax and behavior

- Invariant/covariant/contravariance in Java

- Declaration-site variance: in/out

- Type projections and Star-projections

- Generic constraints

- Function subtyping

speaker: Pedro Vicente
title: GDG DevFest Coimbra
subject: Kotlin’ize your App - Part 1
description: You develop Android with Java? Well.. don’t. Let’s change your life.. yes and it’s for better. But to do it, let’s learn how to use the tool to kotlin’ize your App

speaker: Paulina Strychacz, Brandon Williams!
title: Brooklyn Kotlin
subject: January Brooklyn Kotlin with Paulina Strychacz and Brandon Williams

speaker: Victor Kropp
title: GDG Nuremberg Android
subject: Check out Kotlin with Victor Kropp (JetBrains)
description: Victor Kropp from JetBrains Munich will give a talk about his experience with Kotlin over the last years. He's been using Kotlin for several years now and can provide some deep insight into the language and its features. There will be some code examples from the Android application he is currently developing. Victor is able to answer beginner questions as well as those from experienced Kotlin developers. So come by and benefit. Don't miss this great opportunity. Refreshing drinks of all kinds are available in the location for a small fee and pizza is sponsored by Adorsys GmbH & Co KG. Thanks!

speaker: Jason Lee
title: OKC JUG
subject: Kotlin All the Way Down
description:
Recently, JetBrains held the (inaugural?) KotlinConf in San Francisco. Along with the conference came management application to help attendees manage their schedule. What made the application unique is that every part was written in Kotlin: the web site, the mobile application and the shared backend.

In this session, we will look at some of these technologies, namely the web application framework Ktor and the Android application development library Anko, as we build a vastly simplified mobile app and backend. This demo application should give you all you need both to understand how each of these projects work as well as how to build your mobile application, all in Kotlin.

speaker: Mattias Sällström
title: Umeå Java User Group
subject: Kotlin All the Way Down
description: Kotlin är ett relativt nytt språk som utvecklats av upphovsmännen bakom IDEA IntelliJ. Språket har ett modernt utförande och har möjligheter att kompilera såväl till en JVM på både serversidan samt mobila enheter. Dessutom fungerar det för transpilering till JS.

speaker: Syamala Umamaheswaran, Juhi Gaba, Aleksandra Gavrilovska
title: Women Who Code Berlin
subject: Talk Night
description: Kotlin är ett relativt nytt språk som utvecklats av upphovsmännen bakom IDEA IntelliJ. Språket har ett modernt utförande och har möjligheter att kompilera såväl till en JVM på både serversidan samt mobila enheter. Dessutom fungerar det för transpilering till JS.

speaker: Jordan Hansen
title: Google Developer Group Salt Lake
subject: Kotlin: An Introduction and Updates from KotlinConf
description: Jordan Hansen is going to present on Kotlin, including the latest from KotlinConf in SF. Bring your questions and hunger!

speaker: Sergey Ryabov
title: St. Petersburg Kotlin User Group
subject: Пишем Java-френдли Kotlin-код
description:
B то время как Kotlin становится всё более популярным, всё больше Java-библиотек обзаводятся Kotlin-обёртками, чтобы сделать их использование в Kotlin-коде более идиоматичным. Из многочисленных докладов, а может, и по собственному опыту, вы уже знаете, что на Kotlin-код писать гораздо приятнее, так почему бы и библиотеки сразу не писать на нём? Действительно, интероп с Java широко разрекламирован. Однако, в то время как Java-код дёргать из Kotlin можно без особых проблем, работа с православным Kotlin-кодом из Java имеет свои нюансы. Расскажем, что же припасли создатели Kotlin для таких случаев.

Доклад будет полезен не только писателям библиотек, но и тем, у кого мысль о миграции большого код-бейза на Kotlin вызывает фантомные боли.

speaker: Stanislav Slavin
title: St. Petersburg Kotlin User Group
subject: Spring Boot + Kotlin = ❤️"
description:
Посмотрим что стоит написать простейший микросервис на Kotlin при помощи Spring Boot:

– Spring Boot 1.5 -> 2.0/p>

– Java/Kotlin interop/p>

– Использование coroutines

speaker: Mike Christianson
title: Phoenix Software Engineering Reading Group
subject: Kotlin in Action: Chapters 2 & 3"
description: Discussion to cover Chapters 2 & 3, lead by Matt C.

speaker: Olmo Gallegos
title: Madrid Android Developer Group
subject: Effective Android TDD with Kotlin
description: En este taller partiremos de una arquitectura testable basada en MVP, y construiremos una pequeña App de ejemplo aplicando Test Driven Development con todo el rigor que podamos. Codificaremos tantos tests como sea posible en vivo y en directo, y todo con la magia de Kotlin

speaker: Kerem Akkaya
title: Kotlin Programlama Diline Giriş
subject: Introduction to kotlin
description: Kotlin language basic syntax and sample programs, features of kotlin platform.

speaker: Dmytro Zaitsev
title: Kyiv Kotlin UG: First Blood
subject: Kotlin Delegates: reduce the boilerplate
description: The Delegation pattern is an OOD pattern that allows object composition to achieve the same code reuse as inheritance. Let's find out what Kotlin offers us in a world where we have no control over the creation of many objects to save our time in many cases.

speaker: Ahmed Nabil Mahran
title: Software Freedom Day 2017 | MUFIX Community
subject: Android and Kotlin
description: Why to be an android developer and featuring kotlin as perfect language for android development

speaker: Robin Roschlau
title: Die nächsten Treffen unseres Expertenkreises Java
subject: Kotlin – Alternative oder Ergänzung zu Java?
description:
Spätestens seit der offiziellen Unterstützung durch Google im Mai 2017 ist Kotlin in der Android-Welt in aller Munde, aber auch darüber hinaus schlägt die Sprache mittlerweile immer mehr Wellen. Und dabei handelt es sich nach der Einschätzung Vieler bei weitem nicht nur um einen kurzfristigen Hype, sondern um einen ernstzunehmenden neuen Player im Java-Ökosystem, der jedem Java Entwickler zumindest ein Begriff sein sollte.

Für alle, die Kotlin noch gar nicht oder nur vom Hörensagen kennen, gibt dieser Vortrag anhand praktischer Beispiele einen Überblick darüber, was Kotlin so interessant macht. Neben einer grundlegenden Vorstellung der Sprache als solche werden dabei auch Themen rund um den Einsatz von Kotlin in realen Projekten beleuchtet.

speaker: Lakshmanan Meiyappan
title: BITSathy Developers Fest
subject: Exploring Kotlin
description: An Introduction session on Kotlin to Student Developers and Enthusiast. The talk will introduce Android Developers and Students to Kotlin. Demo on Kotlin Variable Declaration, Data Types, Functions, Classes and Loops.

speaker: Morten Aasnes
title: javaBin Bergen
subject: En introduksjon til Kotlin
description: Kotlin har etablert seg som et seriøst alternativ til Java, spesielt innen Android utvikling. Men også på backend blir Kotlin stadig mer utbredt. Vi får en kort introduksjon til Kotlin, og ser på noen av fordelene Kotlin gir sammenlignet med Java.

speaker: Julien Viet
title: Kotlin Paris Meetup
subject: Inter-Reactive Kotlin Applications
description:
Eclipse Vert.x is a toolkit for building reactive applications on the JVM: it is event-driven and non blocking, this means your app can handle a lot of concurrency using a small number of kernel threads

Most of us are used to writing interactive code and going the reactive way is not a trivial paradigm shift for everyone: programming using asynchronous APIs can be more challenging than using a direct synchronous style, in particular, if you have several operations that you want to do in sequence. Also error propagation is often more complex when using asynchronous APIs.

With Kotlin you can write inter-reactive Vert.x applications: perform asynchronous operations and receive events in a synchronous way. Inter-reactive allows you to work with asynchronous APIs, but using a direct synchronous style that you’re already familiar with!

speaker: Salomon Brys
title: Kotlin Paris Meetup
subject: Kotlinconf feed back: Introduction to multi-platform
description:
At, the Kotlinconf, Jetbrains has announced version 1.2 RC. The main feature of this iteration is the support of multi-plateform syntax.

During the very keynote, they also announced Kotlin Native 0.4, which compiles against Kotlin 1.2 code and allows to compile Kotlin code to LLVM bytecode, which is then compiles to processor assembly that runs natively on plateforms such as linux and of course iOS.

speaker: Murat Yener
title: Google Developer Group Silicon Valley
subject: Design Patterns with Kotlin
description: Learning a new language is not always easy. All of a sudden, you lose all your experience and wisdom on the platform. Years of experience on solving a problem or even writing a simple switch statement may require a web search or take a look at a reference document. Even worse, complex and complicated approaches like Design Patterns become even harder to remember, translate and to implement. This talk will focus on Gang of Four design patterns as well as new design patterns for mobile and best practices for Kotlin. Stick with us to quickly get up to speed on Kotlin design patterns, and leverage all the wisdom and programming power you already have!

speaker: Siamak “Ash” Ashrafi
title: Google Developer Group Silicon Valley
subject: Android Architecture & Material components with Kotlin.
description: It has always been said that Android is not a complete platform. The app developer must include several popular libraries as a base just to start to build a simple production app. Now Google has expressed the same sentiment. The four App components of Android (Activities, Services, Broadcast receivers and Content providers) are not the building blocks of an Android app but a contract between the OS and Application. App developers need to rebuild the basic building blocks whenever starting a new App. This causes many problems for developers and leads to ambiguity about how to best build a robust Android App. Google is looking to remedy this problem by releasing the Android Architectural Components (Room, Lifecycle-aware components, ViewModels and LiveData). While they individually address developer pain points (Persist Data, Manage Lifecycles, Modular & remove errors) they also work together to implement a sane app architecture. In this talk we will detail each components functions and benefits.

speaker: Shashank sharma
title: GDD India
subject: Introduction to kotlin in android development
description: this talk will be a hands on codelab which will help developers to kickstart with kotlin for android development. we will also discuss ANKO for layout designing purposes.

speaker: Olmo Gallegos
title: GDG DevFest Granada
subject: Effective TDD on Android with Kotlin

speaker: Kirill Rozov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin 1.2 Sharing Code between Platforms
description: Погоговорим о основных изменениях языка в новой версии, а так же новой фиче – кроссплатформенные проекты. Пристально рассмотрим какие возможности для переиспользования кода между платформами представили разработчики языка.

speaker: Sergey Kryukov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Gradle meets Kotlin
description: Gradle — популярная система сборки проектов, набирающая обороты. Но у неё есть один фатальный недостаток: в ней используется Groovy DSL. Продолжая традиции BKUG (примерно треть докладов которого о различных DSL), Сергей расскажет о поддержке Kotlin DSL в Gradle.

speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin Coroutines: Часть 2
description: В первой части доклада, который был рассказан на BKUG #5, были даны основы корутин. Данный доклад является продолжением и раскрывает более глубокие темы, такие как: контексты, работа c shared state и написание своих корутин.

speaker: Dhananjay Nene.
title: PuneTech
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: This session will cover an introduction to the Kotlin programming language and lots of hands on examples of how Kotlin helps write concise, safe and expressive code. It will also refer to how naturally Kotlin interoperates with existing Java libraries and frameworks and how Java and Kotlin frameworks and libraries can work smoothly with each other. The session will focus on core programming rather than any specific areas such as Android or Web or other specialised types of programming.

speaker: Michael Yotive
title: Columbus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kegs + Kotlin
description:
'Tis the season... with the holidays soon arriving we know many will be out traveling.

For those of us sticking around, it's a good time to kick back, have a drink and reflect on the 2017 about all the things for which you're grateful... for instance, Kotlin!

speaker: Zalim Bashorov
title: PiterJS
subject: Kotlin 101
description: Расскажу про молодой, но амбициозный петербургский язык программирования — Kotlin. Код написанный на языке Kotlin можно компилировать JVM BC, JavaScript, LLVM bitcode или нативное приложение. А начиная с Kotlin 1.2 код можно удобным образом переиспользовать между JVM и JS. Теперь вы можете использовать одну и ту же реализацию бизнес-логики во всех компонентах вашего приложения — бэкэнде, фронтэнде в браузере и мобильном приложении под Android.

speaker: Davide Cerbo
title: Kotlin Night Rome
subject: Kotlin, ma perché?
description: Dopo 20 anni Java inizia a sentire il peso degli anni e la sua sintassi non evolve come vorremmo, ma la JVM resta sempre un ambiente affidabile ed è già in produzione presso moltissime aziende. Negli ultimi anni sono usciti molti linguaggi basati sulla JVM, ma non tutti hanno avuto il successo sperato. Kotlin ha conquistato Android e, ora, grazie a una sintassi intuitiva e grandi aziende che lo supportano potrebbe essere molto utilizzato anche in altri ambiti.

speaker: Francesco Vasco
title: Kotlin Night Rome
subject: Reactive Spring
description: Spring Framework è una celebre componente per lo sviluppo su JVM. In più di quindici anni si è ampliato ed adeguato alle crescenti necessità del mercato, inclusa la programmazione reattiva e il supporto di Kotlin. Vedremo insieme come si combinano queste tecnologie, quali sono i vantaggi dello sviluppo asincrono e come risolvere alcune problematiche

speaker: Federico Tomassetti
title: Kotlin Night Rome
subject: Building Languages Using Kotlin
description: I Linguaggi sono gli strumenti che più determinano la nostra produttività. Creare i propri linguaggi e i propri (external) Domain Specific Language è tradizionalmente un'attività che ha richiesto uno sforzo notevole. In Kotlin non è più cosí: grazie a una sintassi concisa e un linguaggio estremamente produttivo è oggi possibile creare parser, editor, e compilatori con uno sforzo molto ridotto. Nel talk vedremo un approccio pragmatico al language engineering, basato su Kotlin.

speaker: Álvaro Menezes
title: GDG Porto Alegre
subject: Kotlin: Ola mundo, vim pra ficar!
description: Adotada como linguagem oficial para desenvolvimento Android em maio 2017, seu uso cresceu exponencialmente, entretanto a linguagem pode ser adotada para outras finalidades.Nesta palestra iremos passar um overview da linguagem e seus usos no cenário atual

speaker: Nish Tahir
title: Central Virginia Javascript Enthusiasts (CVJS)
subject: KotlinJS
description: Kotlin (https://kotlinlang.org/) has made a lot of big news as a first class language on Android. But did you know that Kotlin can also be used on the Web?

speaker: Patrick Hammond, Greg Williams
title: Cincinnati Android Developers / GDG Cincinnati
subject: Build a Santa Tracker Android app in Kotlin powered by Firebase
description:
With Christmas just a few days away we're going festive this month and will be creating an Android app that lets us track Santa as he flies across the world delivering presents to good girls and boys who test their code.

As a group, we will start with an empty Android project, include Kotlin support, add in Google Maps, and then talk to a Firebase database to track Santa throughout the evening.

Previous experience building Android apps is not required to participate: this is an opportunity to learn how to get started building Android apps. This will be a code lab style event so you should be prepared to have fun coding, not be surprised if we run into a few bugs, and should encourage you to work together with the people sitting near you.

speaker: Andrew Miroshnychenko
title: Web Academy
subject: Мастер-класс "Кotlin как эффективный инструмент Аndroid-разработки"
description:
Что такое Kotlin? Чем же этот относительно молодой язык программирования сумел так быстро завоевать внимание огромной аудитории?

На нашем мастер-классе Вы узнаете о том, какие есть способы ускорения процесса разработки с помощью языка Kotlin и повышения ее эффективности.

speaker: Yassine Beldi
title: Web Academy
subject: Kotlin 101 : A friendly introduction to Kotlin
description: This will be a friendly introduction to Kotlin. Yassine Will take us through Demo of Kotlin and will answer all you questions about it. Don't forget to prepare your questions, or if you need help on some debugging, bring your laptops, GDG is here in order that we all help each other ! Important notice : we have limited seats 25 only !

speaker: Dmitry Zaitsev
title: GDG Kyiv-Center
subject: Kotlin on Android: Delegate with pleasure

speaker: Ajith v
title: GDG Kozhikode
subject: Try Kotlin for Android
description: An Introduction of Kotlin and build an app with Kotlin

speaker: John Kaster
title: Santa Cruz Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin at Looker Data Systems
description: Looker has adopted Kotlin as a replacement for Java in our products. Find out why and how we are using it.

speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
title: NDC London 2018
subject: An introduction to Kotlin by example
description: Kotlin is what Java 9 should have been if it was written from scratch. The goal of this session is to introduce audience to Kotlin programming language. The session is mostly live coding demo based on small programming problems written in Kotlin. It starts with "hello world" and continues to more complex examples ending with Kotlin puzzlers.

speaker: Andrew Fitzgerald, John Keyes
title: CodeMash 2018
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description:
What is Kotlin? Kotlin is a statically typed programming language that is built with a focus on being safe, approachable, and pragmatic. It was started in 2010 by JetBrains, the company behind Intellij Idea and Android Studio, and has grown exponentially over the last few years. It's recently gained first class support for Spring and Gradle, and is used in the products of big companies like Pinterest, Evernote, Atlassian, and Netflix. And, if you had any doubts of whether Kotlin was here to stay, Google announced Kotlin as an official language for Android at Google I/O 2017! Join us for an in depth, interactive introduction to the language. We'll cover

Basic syntax

Nullability

Object-oriented programming with Kotlin

Functional programming with Kotlin

Java interoperability

Building DSLs

speaker: Michael Yotive
title: CodeMash 2018
subject: Let’s learn Android! (Kotlin Edition)
description: Have you ever wanted to learn how to develop mobile applications for Android? Have you heard of Kotlin, the newest JVM language from JetBrains who Google has officially partnered with for Android development? In this workshop, we’ll cover everything you need to get started on your journey to becoming an Android developer with Kotlin. Even if you’re already an Android developer, this workshop will give you a great foundation in a hot new language! Bring your laptop with Android Studio installed and be ready to learn a lot!

speaker: John Keyes
title: CodeMash 2018
subject: Do More With Less: A Kotlin Primer
description:
Have you been hearing a lot about Kotlin recently? Well, there’s good reason. Created in 2010 by JetBrains, Kotlin is a statically typed programming language that was built with a focus on being safe, approachable, and pragmatic. Over the last few years, it has seen a dramatic rise in popularity due to first class support in Spring, Gradle and, most recently, Android. Used by companies like Pinterest, Evernote, Atlassian, and Netflix -- Kotlin looks like it’s here to stay.

In this talk, we’ll take a quick tour of the Kotlin syntax, what makes it so powerful, and set you on your way toward coding bliss.

speaker: David Lucass
title: CodeMash 2018
subject: Leveraging Spring Cloud Consul for Discovery
description: Twelve Factor Microservices have needs no matter if you run them in the cloud or on premise. Externalized configuration, including service location, can be a barrier to entry. Join this session and "discover" how to leverage Consul and Zuul to achieve several of the 12 factors transparently. This session will include working code (Java and Kotlin) and exploring Spring Cloud Consul, Configuration, and Zuul.

speaker: Dan Lew, Steve Peterson, and Edgar Cobos
title: Kotlin Night Minneapolis
subject: Using Kotlin with Spring, Android, and Android Instant Apps
description:
The Twin Cities Kotlin User Group and Google Developer Group-Twin Cities will be coming together to ring in the new year with a great night of Kotlin. As the hottest new language for Android mobile app and REST web service development, Kotlin has been growing in leaps and bounds for the last year. Come learn why!

Speakers include Trello's Dan Lew, BuzzFeed's Steve Peterson, and Target's Edgar Cobos.

Talks will be aimed at a broad programming audience. Bring your friends!

speaker: Daniel Heron
title: Kotlin ABQ
subject: Kotlin Study Session
description: Bring your laptop, get started learning Kotlin or keep on working on you stuff, Dan will be streaming an online course.

speaker: Adam Erb
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: Monthly meeting at Shopify
description: We'll have three lightning talks by Adam, Jimmy and Alberto. After attending KotlinConf in San Francisco they will be sharing part of what they have learned and considered the most interesting and relevant.

speaker: Christoph Leiter
title: Kotlin Vienna
subject: Kotlin Under the Hood
description: Have you ever wondered how exactly Kotlin works under the hood? In this talk we discuss the general compilation process and have a look at how specific Kotlin features are implemented. We will inspect the byte code generated by Kotlin and convert it to Java to get an easy understanding of how it works internally.

speaker: Damjan Gjurovski
title: Kotlin Vienna
subject: Migrating an Existing Java Codebase to Kotlin
description: This talk will focus on incompatibility between Java and Kotlin, and replacing Java as the main programming language in an existing, actively developed project. It will cover the development of new features, which need to work with the Java "legacy" codebase, as well as refactoring the codebase to Kotlin. While most of the refactoring and conversion can be done using IDE tools, some common pitfalls will be presented and discussed

speaker: Christoph Pickl
title: Kotlin Vienna
subject: Impressions from KotlinConf
description: This year the first KotlinConf ever took place in San Francisco. Christoph attended it for us and will report what happened and share his impressions with us.

speaker: Mark Ducommun
title: Chicago Kotlin Users Group
subject: Monthly Kotlin Meetup - Create React Kotlin App
description: Two weeks after the first KotlinConf in San Francisco, we will be taking a look at one of the biggest focuses of the event, Kotlin everywhere. With the Kotlin 1.1 release, Javascript compilation was officially taken out of experimental status and subsequent releases have only added greater stability. Setting up KotlinJS compilation was originally quite challenging, but a version of create-react-app has been released that makes it as easy as bootstrapping a normal React app. We will walk through a simple React app written in Kotlin and look at the wrappers that allow you to leverage the Kotlin type system.

speaker: Volkmar Vogel
title: Voice & Text Bots Cologne
subject: Actions on Google powered by Kotlin
description: Mit einem Einblick in die Dialogflow Plattform von Google wird Volkmar einen Bot für den Google Assistant bauen. Für das Backend des Bots wird er live eine in Kotlin geschriebene Spring Boot Application entwickeln und diese in der Google Cloud hosten.

speaker: Daniel Kraft
title: Düsseldorf Kotlin User Group
subject: Preparing for the worst with Kotlin
description: Kotlin's versatile language features allow developers to create a more robust and reliable code base than Java. This talk will discuss how we use Kotlin's error handling, smart casts, coroutines, and DSLs to deploy systems in the most hostile of environments.

speaker: Akinrolie Shola Slick
title: Kotlin Night Abuja
subject: Speed up your development with Kotlin
description: Using Kotlin for Android development has grown in popularity over the last year. Even to those who are not currently using it, the value proposition of the language immediately resonates. This talk will cover advancing your technical abilities with the use of Kotlin Language to speed up your development

speaker: Francesco Vasco
title: JUG Milano Meeting #86
subject: Costruiamo un treno in Kotlin
description: Dopo cinque anni di sviluppo JetBrains rilascia la prima versione di Kotlin, linguaggio staticamente tipizzato che pur rimanendo pienamente compatibile con Java cerca di risolverne alcuni problemi tutt'ora aperti. Presenterò un semplice programma realizzato con approccio OO/funzionale e confronteremo l'implementazione Java 8 con quella Kotlin.

speaker: Aditya Aggarwal
title: GDD India
subject: Introduction to Kotlin for Android
description: With the GDD-extended me and my friends are organising a Kotlin talk where we introduce Android and Web developers to Kotlin. The talk will cover concepts for Android Development as well as JS Transpiler for Kotlin.

speaker: Semih Bozdemir
title: GDG DevFest Istanbul 2017
subject: Handsome codes with Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a very flexible programming language. You have a chance to write more readable and good-looking code. The only limit is your imagination and creativity. I'll show you some examples which are really handsome :)

speaker: Semih Bozdemir
title: GDG DevFest Izmir 2017
subject: Handsome codes with Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a very flexible programming language. You have a chance to write more readable and good-looking code. The only limit is your imagination and creativity. I'll show you some examples which are really handsome :)

speaker: Neeraja Kukday, Francisco Velazquez
title: Kotlin at Avast
subject: Introduction to kotlin
description: Learn why and how to use Kotlin

speaker: Julien Biral
title: Kotlin at Avast
subject: Gradle build scripts w/ kotlin
description: How to use Gradle build scripts

speaker: Stav Raviv
title: Kotlin at Avast
subject: Kotlin Puzzlers
description: Unpredictable Kotlin Code

speaker: Leonardo Pirro
title: DevFest Campania 2017
subject: Getting started with Kotlin on Anroid

speaker: Andreas Wester, Niklas Lindblad
title: Javaforum Q4 2017
subject: A quick look at Kotlin in a reactive Spring 5 / Spring Boot 2 application
description:
The latest and greatest from Devoxx - We'll have a look at a reactive Spring 5/Spring Boot 2 application written in Kotlin, including:

• The new routing DSL

• Functional style Beans definitions

• Reactive all the way to the DB with WebFlux

• WebFlux Testing

speaker: Rodrigo De Luca
title: Android Devs Buenos Aires
subject: Migrando Restorando a Kotlin
description: En Restorando, en el último trimestre, reescribimos una parte muy importante de nuestra aplicación en Kotlin, el nuevo perfil del restaurante. Te vamos a contar que problemas tuvimos, cómo los resolvimos, y qué features nos hacen la vida mas fácil como desarrolladores Android, al migrar el nuevo perfil a este lenguaje.

speaker: Robin Caroff
title: Android Nantes
subject: How I brought Kotlin into my Room
description: Retour d'expérience sur l'utilisation de Kotlin et des Architecture Components dans une architecture MVP.

speaker: Kumaran Venkataraman
title: Hack&Learn Chennai
subject: A Cocktail of Kotlin & Blockchain
description: Kotlin and Bitcoin, recent trending topics of the Tech industry. How about a cocktail of these two? Join us for our third Hack&Learn session at Ajira on implementing a BlockChain using Kotlin.

speaker: Ricardo Pereira
title: Present Technologies
subject: Kotlin It's time to start using a modern programming language

speaker: David Vávra
title: DevFest Siberia 2017
subject: Tricks for converting Android Java code into Kotlin
description: Kotlin is now an official language for Android and it’s getting popular. Everybody probably starts by converting some Java code. The automatic converter in Android Studio is a start, but you usually need to do a little bit more. Most of this talk will be livecoding to convert Java code and show you some nice Kotlin features.

speaker: Adel Lamali
title: DevFest 2017 Les Rosiers
subject: What can Kotlin do for me?

speaker: Michael Yotive, John Keyes,Eric Maxwell
title: Columbus Kotlin User Group
subject: KotlinConf Recap
description:
KotlinConf, the inaugural Kotlin conference, debuted in San Francisco Nov 1st, with a workshop and 2 days of talks. Approximately 1200 attendees from all over the world came to learn more about Kotlin. Speakers flew in from all over the world too, to share their knowledge and passion for Kotlin. It was truly an amazing experience.

If you missed it, don't fret, this month Michael Yotive, John Keyes, and Eric Maxwell will recap their experiences at KotlinConf and share with you how you can watch the videos later as well as what topics were making buzz this year.

speaker: Mišo Ivanišević, Miloš Jokić
title: Kotlin User Group Serbia
subject: Recap of the KotlinConf
description:
Početkom novembra u San Francisku odražana je prva zvanična Kotlin konferencija pod nazivom KotlinConf. Ovo je bila prilika da se svi ljubitelji ovog jezika okupe na jednom mestu i da razmene svoja iskustva. Konferenciju je posetilo oko 1200 ljudi i održano je oko 45 predavanja u tri track-a.

Tema ovog meetup biće rekapitulacija KotlinConf konferencije. U prvom delu meetupa pogledaćemo jedno od keynote predavanja sa KotlinConf-a, a nakon toga ćemo imati diskusiju sa Mišom Ivaniševićem i Milošem Jokiće, članovima naše zajednice koji su imali tu sreće da posete ovaj događaj, gde ćemo moći da diskutujemo o novostima i planovima za Kotlin programski jezik koji su predstavljeni na konferenciji.

speaker: Mark Heckler
title: Seattle Java User's Group
subject: Springing into Kotlin: How to Make the Magic even more Magical
description:
Developing applications with Spring Boot is already a pretty magical experience, but could it be better? Can the magic get any more powerful than it already is

In this talk, we'll look at how Kotlin can be used to reduce boilerplate, increase code quality, and elevate your wizardry. The presenter will demonstrate how to begin incorporating Kotlin into your existing Spring applications and, once you start your journey, where it can lead. Come to this session to level up on Spring+Kotlin! (Robes optional)

speaker: Christophe Beyls
title: Kotlin Belgium User Group
subject: Kotlin meetup with Christophe Beyls
description: We'll study the bytecode generated by the Kotlin compiler in various scenarios in order to find out which code constructs come with hidden performance penalties and learn how to become better Kotlin programmers. This talk will be based on my series of blog posts about this topic and will extend it in some areas.

speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
title: AlpesJUG
subject: Pourquoi Spring ❤ Kotlin
description:
Sébastien Deleuze nous expliquera pourquoi Spring ❤ Kotlin et comment vous pouvez profiter du support officiel de Kotlin dans Spring (Spring Framework 5, Spring Boot et Spring Data) pour concevoir votre prochain projet Spring plus efficacement et surtout avec plus de plaisir.

Il décrira petit à petit comment convertir votre projet Spring Boot 1.0 écrit en Java et Javascript en un projet Spring Boot 2.0 en pure Kotlin et qui s'exécutera au dessus du nouveau cadriciel fonctionnel Web WebFlux :

speaker: Ekaterina Kromina
title: Honeypot Tech Talks Amsterdam
subject: Honeypot Tech Talk in Amsterdam: Kotlin
description: In this tech meetup, we’ll explore the power of Kotlin, Serj Lotutovici will give a talk about Kotlin as a cross-platform language and Alexey Soshin will enlighten us about Coroutines in Kotlin.

speaker: Wangi Brian
title: Kotlin Uganda User Group
subject: Learn how to use kotlin in Android Development
description: Android Kotlin

speaker: Gaetan Zoritchak
title: SnowCamp 2018
subject: Kotlin: pragmatique et fun
description: Jetbrains, dont la devise a depuis longtemps été «Develop with pleasure», nous propose avec kotlin un language qui nous permet de garder le sourire en codant.

speaker: Victor Oliveira
title: DevTalks Bauru
subject: Diminua seu código Java com Kotlin

speaker: Elisha
title: Melbourne Android GDG
subject: Write better code with Kotlin's read only collections

speaker: Simon Gerber
title: Sydney Kotlin User Group
subject: Parsing Fancy - Parser Combinators in Kotlin
description: An exceptionally brief primer on domain specific languages (DSLs) and context-free grammar. We will then implement a DSL using parser combinators, live, on-stage!

speaker: Nick DiPatri
title: GDG Philadelphia: Android Alliance
subject: Learning Kotlin: where to begin ...
description: Nick will do a quick 20 minute talk on his journey thus far in learning Kotlin. I will describe the resources I'm using, I'll point out my biggest discoveries so far, and I'll walk through some code that I've converted over.

speaker: Mike Gouline
title: Sydney Kotlin User Group
subject: KotlinConf 2017 Recap
description: Summary of the better talks, the more interesting themes, some conversations with other Kotliners and overall impressions about the first ever Kotlin conference in San Francisco. Think of it as your guide to what recorded talks to watch first

speaker: Mike Christianson
title: Phoenix Software Engineering Reading Group
subject: Kotlin in Action: Introduction & Chapter 1
description: Our next book is Kotlin in Action (https://www.manning.com/books/kotlin-in-action); we'll cover the introductory material and Chapter 1. Please note, this meeting is not being held at Gangplank; see meeting details for the new location.

speaker: Felipe Theodoro
title: Kotlin night
subject: Covariance em Kotlin
description: Após a adoção oficial de Kotlin pelo Google, a linguagem ganhou bastante força. Na 99, já usávamos antes mesmo da oficialização e vamos apresentar algumas novidades e conceitos interessantes da linguagem.

speaker: Rodrigo Sicarelli e Rodrigo Henriques
title: Kotlin night
subject: Novidades da Kotlin Conference
description: Após a adoção oficial de Kotlin pelo Google, a linguagem ganhou bastante força. Na 99, já usávamos antes mesmo da oficialização e vamos apresentar algumas novidades e conceitos interessantes da linguagem.

speaker: Rodrigo Garcete
title: GDG Ciudad del Este
subject: Kotlin, el nuevo lenguaje oficial para Android
description: Vamos a hablar sobre Kotlin. El objetivo es mostrar algunas características del lenguaje y como aplicarlo en Android.

speaker: Adrien Pessu
title: Nantes JUG
subject: Kotlin, the Java we always wanted
description: In this quick presentation, I'll will you the main concept and the short syntax of kotlin. Finally, I'll show you an example of a spring boot app with kotlin

speaker: Adrien Pessu
title: Nantes JUG
subject: Kotlin, the Java we always wanted
description: In this quick presentation, I'll will you the main concept and the short syntax of kotlin. Finally, I'll show you an example of a spring boot app with kotlin

speaker: Baris Emre Efe
title: GDG Trabzon
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: The goal of this session is to introduce Kotlin programming language to audience and explain how it can be used for Android Development.

speaker: Marharyta Nedzelska
title: IT Weekend Chernivtsi: Full Stack Development
subject: Dive in Kotlin with TDD
description: In this talk we'll crete a simple application in Kotlin using it's key features and TDD approach. We'll also use KotlinTest testing framework.

speaker: Jordan Hansen
title: Google Developer Group Salt Lake
subject: Kotlin: An Introduction and Updates from KotlinConf
description: Learn the basics of the Kotlin Language and exciting things announced at KotlinConf. See how Kotlin can make your code more concise and less error prone.

speaker: Aline Ayres
title: REC'n'Play
subject: Kotlin in Android
description: A talk about the advantages of using Kotlin in Android, a introduction about the language sintaxe, the features and the interoperability with Java

speaker: Dusko Bajic
title: Kotlin User Group Bosnia
subject: First steps with Kotlin
description: Introduction to syntax and functional paradigm.

speaker: Victor Bolinches
title: Universitat de València
subject: Asynchronous Programming
description: Good practices with the using Coroutines with Kotlin experimental

speaker: Bob Dahlberg
title: Android Stockholm
subject: Testing on Android with Kotlin
description: A discovery over the different ways of testing in kotlin. Will go through Spek, KotlinTest, HamKrest and Mockito. How to set it all up, how to do different kind of tests (intrumentation and unit).

speaker: Bowen Ma
title: Xian DevOps Meetup
subject: Kotlin - enable efficient development
description: Four parts, Why Kotlin、Start with Kotlin、Migrate to Kotlin 和 Kotlin Tricks。

speaker: Doğuş Can Aktemur
title: GDG DevFest Antalya 2017
subject: Kotlin - enable efficient development
description: Four parts, Why Kotlin、Start with Kotlin、Migrate to Kotlin 和 Kotlin Tricks。

speaker: Troy Miles
title: SoCal Code Camp Los Angeles
subject: AWS Lambda with Kotlin
description:
Kotlin is a language from the tool gurus at JetBrains. In 2016, after about six years of development, Kotlin reached version 1.0. In 2017  it won the hearts of developers and became an officially supported language for Android. 

 
Kotlin, like Java, is for more than creating Android applications. It can replace or enhance Java in all of the places it is used today including on AWS. AWS Lambda sometimes called serverless computing, is a service which lets us developers build web services without worrying about configuring servers.

speaker: Or Noyman
title: KotlinTLV
subject: Kotlinifying your project!
description: Integrating Kotlin can sure make your code cleaner but how can you leverage it to create a functional architecture that truly unlock its powers?

speaker: Refael Ozeri
title: KotlinTLV
subject: Making the transition from Java to Kotlin
description:
In my talk I would go through the different issues I faced while transitioning from Java to Kotlin while developing for the Android platform. I believe the transition is deeper than just learning a new syntax. In its core, the real transition is learning to think like a Kotlin developer, rather than a Java developer, although from my personal experience, it's easier said than done.

I developed applications for the Android platform using Java for the last 5 years and recently started working on a big project that required me to make the transition and create a fully fledged Kotlin app. I will talk about making that transition from my perspective and experience. The hard stuff, the good stuff and some neat tips & tricks I picked up along the way.

speaker: Ronel Girat
title: Fullstack Developers Israel
subject: 60 Rx minutes
description: Rx is here, live and kicking :) , We'll cover some reactive paradigms and see how we've built a recommended practices app to use Rx together with Kotlin and how it's all tied up.

speaker: Shaul Rosenzweig
title: Fullstack Developers Israel
subject: Kotlin - Don't call us, We'll call(Log) you
description:
We will go over using Content provider, DAO and tests with kotlin together with some flow from Rx covered in Talk 1.

We will see how we got a CallLog with DAO and added tests to verify our work is up to standards.

speaker: Colin Lee
title: Google Developers Group - Twin Cities
subject: Kotlin Coroutines: Awaiting the Future
description: Come join us for an exploration of Kotlin coroutines with long-time speaker and local polymath Colin Lee. We couldn't be more excited about Kotlin right now, and coroutines are tricky enough that we could all benefit from meeting up with Colin and other local experts on the topic.

speaker: Darran Kelinske
title: Austin Android Developers Meetup
subject: Kotlin Book Club - Part 3
description: The book we're reading is Kotlin for Android Developers, an example-driven book that will teach you Kotlin as you develop an app. Join us to discuss examples found in the book, ask questions, and learn more about the language with your fellow developers.

speaker: Justin Lee
title: Virtual Java User Group
subject: Kotlin from the Ground Up
description: Kotlin comes to us from Jetbrains the same people that make the IntelliJ IDEA IDE. Designed to run on the JVM and interoperate cleanly with existing Java classes, Kotlin provides a number of upgrades from standard Java development. More than just another language tour with and ceaseless parade of tidbits and nuggets, this talk is a walkthrough of actively developed projects. We'll look at various language features in the context of actual code rather than contrived examples designed to make the language shine. We'll start off with the basics and move ever upward to increasingly complex and interesting features as time allows.

speaker: Dennis Blum
title: Kotlin Karlsruhe User Group
subject: Kotlin Night @Christmas Market
description: Just a relaxed meetup at the Karlsruhe Christmas Market to talk about anything related to Kotlin or not. Let's review the meetups we had so far and collect some ideas for the upcoming Kotlin Nights next year. Come grab a Glühwein and have a AWESOME time together!

speaker: Michael H. Cox, Daniel Heron
title: Kotlin ABQ
subject: Kotlin Dec Study Session
description: Just a relaxed meetup at the Karlsruhe Christmas Market to talk about anything related to Kotlin or not. Let's review the meetups we had so far and collect some ideas for the upcoming Kotlin Nights next year. Come grab a Glühwein and have a AWESOME time together!

speaker: Danny Preussler
title: Google Developer Group - Novi Sad
subject: The power of Kotlin for your tests
description:
Whether you use Kotlin in production or not, you should use its power for your tests.

When it comes to extension functions, infix notation or possibilities for method names, Kotlin offers a lot that Java won't give you. Combined with the powers of some libraries, this brings testing to a whole new level.

I

n this live coding session we will convert some boring Java tests to *fun* tests.

speaker: Vaclav Souhrada
title: Czech Kotlin User Group
subject: Let's Learn Kotlin
description: Kotlin workshop: In the theoretical part, you will get an introduction to Kotlin, what is it, what it does for you and why is so popular with Android. In the practical part, you will learn Kotlin from scratch by directly writing the code.

speaker: Frank Tamre
title: Kotlin Kenya User Group
subject: A very friendly Hello Kotlin
description:
we have an introduction to the Kotlin language:

*Setting up your environment to run Kotlin

*Kotlin Use cases

*Why and how to make the transition from JAVA

• Kotlin Language explorations

An introduction is impossible without stories and future plans. We'll share own Kotlin experiences and several open source projects created with it.

speaker: Alex Robinson
title: Cincinnati Kotlin
subject: Learn Kotlin for Love and Sanity
description: Kotlin is the new kid on the JVM block and has been rapidly growing in popularity over the last few years, and for good reason: Kotlin is a powerful, productive language without all the boilerplate and verbosity of languages like Java. And thanks to Google, Kotlin is now a first-class citizen in the Android ecosystem.

speaker: Alexey Nesterov
title: Kotlin London
subject: Kotlin coroutines and Spring 5
description:
Spring 5 is the next major version of Spring Framework, which introduces a whole lot of improvements and new features. One of them is Reactive Web Framework, or WebFlux. It is based on implementation of Reactive Streams API by the project called Project Reactor.

And it turns out, that Kotlin and Spring WebFlux are playing very well together. Kotlin coroutines can be smoothly integrated with reactive types and Spring WebFlux uses that API for non-blocking I/O.

speaker: Tashinga Pemhiwa
title: Google Developer Group (GDG) Johannesburg
subject: Re-inventing Android development with Kotlin
description: This is an introductory talk on Kotlin, covering language features and syntax.

speaker: Stephan Oudmaijer
title: bol.com Techlab
subject: Kotlin in action
description: In a live coding session/workshop, Jarno Walgemoed and Stephan Oudmaijer will highlight some of the features Kotlin has to offer to developers coming from the Java ecosystem. Making this more tangible, we will start with a Java/Spring Boot based webapplication and migrate this to Kotlin while maintaining the interoperability with existing Java code and adding new features as we go. The goal is to provide a practical insight in how Kotlin’s concise and expressive syntax could help developers write code that’s easier to understand and maintain.

speaker: Ankit Sharma
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Coroutines and Architecture Components
description: This month, we have two excellent talks. Ankit Sharma will tell us about using the Android Architecture Components in Kotlin. In addition, Evan Denerley will give us an introduction to Kotlin Coroutines.

speaker: Ankit Sharma
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Coroutines and Architecture Components
description: This month, we have two excellent talks. Ankit Sharma will tell us about using the Android Architecture Components in Kotlin. In addition, Evan Denerley will give us an introduction to Kotlin Coroutines.

speaker: Gerard de Leeuw, Michael Borg
title: Craftsmen Utrecht
subject: Workshop Kotlin Programming Language
description: Kotlin is a programming language created by JetBrains (most commonly known from IntelliJ IDEA). Kotlin has gained massive popularity since its first release in Februari 2016, currently being promoted as the main language for Android development and the Gradle build tool. The team behind Spring framework also stated that they are moving towards Kotlin because many of its features work well together with Spring. As a professional (Java) software developer it is very likely that you will encounter code written in Kotlin in the near future and having a basic knowledge of the language will surely help you understanding whats going on.

speaker: Eyitayo Alimi
title: Kotlin Nigeria User Group
subject: Building your android app with kotlin

speaker: Marco Vasapollo
title: Bologna Developer Zone
subject: Kotlin, una reale alternativa a Java?
description: Kotlin è un nuovo linguaggio per programmare la piattaforma Java e non solo. Partendo dai nuovi costrutti che facilitano la scrittura delle applicazioni Java/JavaFX classiche e Android, daremo anche un'occhiata al lavoro che i ragazzi di JetBrains stanno portando avanti per affermare Kotlin sia come linguaggio per applicazioni client classiche che per applicazioni web.

speaker: Marcus Fihlon
title: Kotlin Swiss User Group
subject: Start a real world project using Kotlin
description: The idea for today is to start an exemplary real-world fullstack application for the RealWorld example apps project. In this project, you can find several implementations of the same frontend and backend using different technologies for comparison reasons. We want to learn how to use the Kotlin programming language and some libraries while we add an implementation using Kotlin and the ktor framework to the above project.

speaker: Volkmar Vogel
title: Kotlin User Group Cologne
subject: Kotlin + JavaScript - Ein kurzer Blick auf den aktuellen Stand

speaker: Volkmar Vogel
title: Kotlin User Group Cologne
subject: Kdux: Eine minimalistische Redux Implementierung in Kotlin

speaker: Dave Ford
title: Orange County Kotlin Meetup (OC Kotlin)
subject: Creating compile-to-JS web apps with Kotlin
description:
- How to compile Kotlin into JavaScript

- How to create a full-stack app using Kotlin

- How to share code between client and server

- JavaScript interop, to make use of existing JS libraries

- Calling native browser APIs from Kotlin

- Using Kotlin's HTML DSL

speaker: Daniel Omar
title: Wizeline Academy CDMX
subject: Kotlin Workshop: How to Convert Dollars to Bitcoins?
description:
Kotlin is a statically typed programming language for modern multiplatform applications. It is a Google official language for Android development.

During the workshop, the students will learn about Kotlin by creating their own Dollar-to-Bitcoin converter using Gradle, RxJava, Mockito, JUnit, and AssertJ. They will also learn concepts and methods that can be used in other frameworks.Kotlin is a statically typed programming language for modern multiplatform applications, it is completely interoperable with Java and Android, and now it is a google official language to Android development.

speaker: Marcin Moskała
title: NDC London 2018
subject: Kotlin: Next level of Android Development
description: Why? What are its advantages and what makes him so special that whole Android world is now switching to it? And is web development its next station?

speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
title: NDC London 2018
subject: An introduction to Kotlin by example
description: The goal of this session is to introduce audience to Kotlin programming language. The session is mostly live coding demo based on small programming problems written in Kotlin. It starts with "hello world" and continues to more complex examples ending with Kotlin puzzlers.

speaker: Dmitriy Zaitsev
title: UA Mobile 2017
subject: Coroutines in Kotlin
description: Modern programming can not be imagined without long-running operations such as CPU-intensive computations or blocking IO running in the background. Unfortunately, having too many active threads is very expensive and kills performance, but there's a solution - coroutines. They provide a way to avoid blocking a thread and replace it with a cheaper and more controllable operation: suspension of a coroutine.

speaker: Guy Heylens
title: Devoxx Belgium 2017
subject: Kotlin Deep Dive
description: Let’s take you on a journey of Kotlin, the language created by Jetbrains for the JVM. Since the announcement that Google made in May we have seen an increase in interest in this language. In this talk we will try to cover as much as possible about the language in a deep dive. In the first part we will create a Rest API with Kotlin and show you the possibilities in using Kotlin as a server side language. In part 2 we will consume the Rest API with an Android app. In both parts we will use different features, so you get a good understanding of Kotlin.

speaker: Mark Heckler
title: Devoxx Belgium 2017
subject: From Spring Boot 1 in Java to Spring Boot 2 in Kotlin
description: Mark and Sébastien will lead a live coding deep dive to show you how to transform a Spring Boot 1 web application written in Java to a Spring Boot 2 application written in Kotlin. This deep dive session will introduce you to various Kotlin features (null safety, data classes, DSLs, extensions, etc.) and explain how you can leverage Spring Framework 5.0 and Spring Data Kay dedicated Kotlin support. Both Spring MVC and Spring WebFlux will be covered. No prior knowledge of Kotlin is required.

speaker: Murat Yener
title: Devoxx Belgium 2017
subject: Design Patterns with Kotlin
description: Kotlin looks great but do you feel like suddenly loosing all your coding skills and wisdom? Let's visit the Gang of Four Design Patterns and implement them on Kotlin using IntelliJ's native Kotlin support.

speaker: Venkat Subramaniam
title: Devoxx Belgium 2017
subject: Kotlin for Java Programmers
description: Kotlin is that dark horse of JVM languages. It has gained prominence in the recent times for various good reasons. But, what does Kotlin really mean to Java programmers? In this presentation we will explore the language, learn about its key strengths and capabilities, take a peek under the hood to what it’s capabilities mean on the Java eco system, and how and where we can benefit from it.

speaker: Eugene Petrenko
title: Devoxx Belgium 2017
subject: Kotlin DSLs in 42 minutes
description: Learn how to create type-safe and statically typed DSLs in Kotlin. The session starts with an introduction to DSL related Kotlin language features. Next, we create a simple DSL in a live coding session and then continue adding expressiveness and language features. We cover a number of examples, like JSON or XML builder's, data binding, configuration & template engines, HTML builders, React wrapper, Web frameworks, Anko and Android layouts, server side and more. You will learn how to create and understand the magic behind statically typed DSLs in Kotlin

speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
title: Devoxx Belgium 2017
subject: Why Spring ❤ Kotlin
description: In this talk, I will explain why Spring ❤ Kotlin and how you can leverage Spring official support for Kotlin (in Framework, Boot, Data) to build your next Spring project more efficiently and with more pleasure.

speaker: Lieven Doclo
title: Devoxx Belgium 2017
subject: Using Kotlin to implement Clean Architecture
description: For those familiar with the teachings of Uncle Bob, Clean Architecture is no stranger. It's a set of architectural guidelines that provide a SOLID set of principes on which to base you architecture in order to have a clean, easy to understand and even easier to maintain foundation. This talk will show you how you can implement such an design and will demonstrate the power of such a design. It will also show how you can be pragmatic in implementing Clean Architecture and what the possible implications can be when making pragmatic concessions. I'll also show what features Kotlin has that makes implementing Clean Architecture a breeze, mitigating some of the concerns.

speaker: Ludovic Champenois, Éamonn McManus
title: Devoxx Belgium 2017
subject: Serverless Kotlin with App Engine - fast deployment, infinite scalability
description: After years of development of a new security sandbox, App Engine Standard now supports Java 8 and practically all of the JVM languages that runs atop of standard OpenJDK 8. In the new sandbox environment, we removed the Java security sandbox and the classes whitelist; this allows developers to use all features in the JVM and still being protected within a secure environment.

speaker: Jen Tong
title: Devoxx Belgium 2017
subject: Zero to App - Live coding an Android app on Firebase in Kotlin
description: Firebase and Google Cloud Platform together help developers build extraordinary mobile and web apps. In this session, I'll craft an app live on stage and demonstrate how to create a great user experience using Firebase. I'll then extend this app by calling into Google Cloud Platform APIs, without having to spin up servers or manage infrastructure. You’ll experience firsthand how easy it is to build with Firebase, and how easy it is to scale with Google Cloud.

speaker: Guy Heylens
title: GDG DevFest Season 2017
subject: Kotlin Introduction
description: In this first talk we will guide you through your first steps in Kotlin, what is the language all about? Who created it and why.

speaker: Guy Heylens
title: GDG DevFest Season 2017
subject: Kotlin Workshop
description: Let's play around with Kotlin.

speaker: Benjamin Lacroix, Sergio Dos Santos
title: XebiCon 2017
subject: Kotlin, état de l’art
description: Let's play around with Kotlin.

speaker: Jake Wharton, Alec Strong
title: .droidconSF 2017
subject: Generating Kotlin Code
description: Kotlin provides simpler options than traditional Java patterns like builders and factories often found in generated code. By using Kotlin to generate an API, you can not only create a pleasant experience from both languages, but also unlock the possibility of targeting native and JS. This talk will cover the tools needed to generate Kotlin code and also the features available in Kotlin that can improve your generated code.

speaker: Pablo Guardiola
title: .droidconSF 2017
subject: Building a DSL… in Kotlin!
description: Kotlin is a multipurpose language that makes building domain-specific languages (DSLs) a breeze. But, what is a DSL? A domain-specific language is a small programming dictionary designed specifically to express solutions to problems focused on a particular aspect of a software system. There are a lot of them around, like CSS for styling, HTML for websites, and SQL for querying databases. A well-designed DSL is much easier to program with than a traditional library. This is just one of the nice things about DSLs. Let me show you how I built one in Kotlin. In this session we will learn how to design a DSL and understand why we should use Functional Programming (FP) and Kotlin to build one. We will analyze Do’s and Don’ts from my experience creating a UI Automator-gesture generation DSL (https://github.com/Guardiola31337/uiagesturegen). Along with Kotlin's power and DSL building facilities, we will explore how we can make this DSL entirely stack safe, composable and reusable under different runtime requirements thanks to KΛTEGORY (https://github.com/kategory/kategory), a library which provides abstractions for FP in Kotlin. By the end of the talk, you will be itching to write your own!

speaker: Victoria Gonda
title: .droidconSF 2017
subject: Kotlin: Uncovered
description: Kotlin does a lot for us in the way of reducing boilerplate. But what is it really doing? We will be inspecting some decompiled Kotlin to discover how it does its job. By looking underneath at how it handles data classes, lambdas, and delegation, we can better understand how the language executes what we write. If you’re curious about the language, or already using it in production, you should walk away from this investigation with a deeper understanding of Kotlin, and some tools for continued exploration.

speaker: Giorgio Natili
title: .droidconSF 2017
subject: Codelab: Android Development, the Kotlin Way
description: No matter how sophisticated your Android project is, some building blocks get implemented over and over. For instance, almost every app needs to get data from RESTful API, parse the data, rendering a list of items, implementing the communication layer between activities and fragments, etc. During this workshop, you will learn how Kotlin simplifies the development of Android applications because of its concise, functional and null-safe design implementing a feed reader for Android.

speaker: Victor Kropp
title: Mobile Unplugged 2017
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description:
Kotlin is a programming language developed by JetBrains that targets multiple platforms including the JVM, JavaScript, and native binaries. It has been recently adopted as an officially supported language for Android development.

Kotlin offers clean and concise syntax, interoperability, both object oriented and functional code constructs, and a lot of other cool features with little or no overhead. In some cases, Kotlin code is even faster than its Java equivalent!

In this talk, I will show the basic language constructs, compare it to Java, and also show some nice features for Android developers.

speaker: Victor Kropp
title: Mobile Unplugged 2017
subject: Kotlin coroutines
description: More and more applications are now written in an asynchronous way. Many modern programming languages have built-in support for this programming style, like async/await in C# or goroutines in Go. Kotlin 1.1 introduced a concept of suspendable functions also known as coroutines, which allowed supporting async/await, yield and similar patterns as primitives defined in libraries, not as built-in language constructs.

speaker: Paulina Strychacz, Grzegorz Dec
title: Mobile Unplugged 2017
subject: Kotlinify your unit tests (and specs!)
description: Kotlin is finally supported by Google as a first-class language. We'll present tips on how to write readable unit tests utilizing Kotlin and already available libraries. Let's check what benefits we can get from libraries like kotlintest and how it may speed up your work. We're gonna tell you also how to apply Spek Framework to make your tests a live specification. You will be introduced to Expekt library, which can be also used for assertions. With our hints you can easily choose the best library to include in your projects.

speaker: Hiroshi Kurokawa
title: shibuya.apk #19
subject: Introduction to Kotlin Coroutine
description:
This talk introduces Kotlin Coroutine, which was a big feature of Kotlin 1.1.

Kotlin coroutine is a suspendable computation. It empowers programmers in some use cases such as async/await, generator.

speaker: Bolot Kerimbaev
title: GDG DevFest Atlanta 2017
subject: Kotlin: Class Destroyer
description: In Java, almost everything has to be a class or within a class. In Kotlin, there are several mechanisms for writing code without explicitly introducing classes. The talk will show examples using functions as first-class citizens, higher-order functions, (companion) objects, extensions, and property delegation.

speaker: Tipatai Puthanukunkit
title: TechAtAgoda #16: Kotlin workshop
subject: A walkthrough of how to create an Android Application with Kotlin with MVP and clean architecture
description: It’s time again for Tech@Agoda and this time we present you the Kotlin workshop for Android application. We just started to use Kotlin in our Agoda app recently and it make our coding more enjoyable. So, we would like to share our experience with you as well. See you in the workshop.

speaker: Ilya Lim
title: TechAtAgoda #16: Kotlin workshop
subject: Introducing to Kakao, our open source library that will make you life with UI Testing a lot easier
description: It’s time again for Tech@Agoda and this time we present you the Kotlin workshop for Android application. We just started to use Kotlin in our Agoda app recently and it make our coding more enjoyable. So, we would like to share our experience with you as well. See you in the workshop.

speaker: Guy Dupont, Peter Farlow
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Static Typing, Required: Node.js Meets Kotlin
description: Guy Dupont will give a talk titled “Static typing, required: Node.js meets Kotlin”, giving us a chance to explore Kotlin usage outside the context of the JVM. And Peter Farlow will will give a KotlinConf Recap so those of us who weren't able to attend can still hear about this exciting conference on all things Kotlin

speaker: Julien Ponge
title: Lyon Kotlin User Group
subject: Services réactifs avec Vert.x et intégration avec Kotlin
description:
Vert.x est un toolkit pour écrire des applications réactives et polyglottes pour la JVM. Il fournit aujourd’hui un écosystème complet et modulaire qui intègre le paradigme réactif de bout en bout, performant et facile à utiliser pour tous types d’applications. La richesse de l'écosystème Vert.x permet de développer aussi bien une application web de type temps réel, de faire de l’IoT, d’implémenter des adaptateurs de protocoles, d’écrire des applications distribuées et bien entendu de concevoir et intégrer des micro-services.

Cette conférence présentera Vert.x et ses fondements autour de live-coding et de démonstrations. Nous nous intéresserons également aux spécificités du support de Kotlin dans Vert.x comme l'intégration des co-routines.

speaker: Stanislav
title: Kotlin Belarus User Group
subject: Layouts DSL is the only way
description: Станислав расскажет про свой опыт вертски при помощи Anko Layouts и почему не XML, как DSL и RxJava позволяют заменить весь android.databinding парой строк и не вспоминать про lifecycle managment.

speaker: Alina Dolgikh, Pavel Shchors, Dmitry Yunitsky
title: Kotlin Belarus User Group
subject: Как прошел Kotlin Conf
description: Ни для кого не секрет что 2-3 ноября в Сан-Франциско проходит конференция посвящённая котлину – Kotlin Conf. На митапе участники конференции расскажут о своих впечатлениях о конференции, киноуте, технических докладах и возникших дискуссиях.

speaker: Arold Ádám
title: Budapest Mobile
subject: November - Új app framework, 2 év tapasztalat asszisztensekkel & egy kis Kotlin

speaker: Maciej Pigulski
title: Software Craftsmanship Wrocław
subject: Kotlin - wprowadzenie & lesson learned
description: Kotlin jest stosunkowo nowym jezykiem dla JVM stworzonym przez zespół z JetBrains który stoi za takimi produktami jak IntelliJ IDEA. Wprowadza wiele konstrukcji językowych których brakuje w Java jednocześnie nie spowalniając w znaczący sposób działania programów w nim tworzonych. Jest to język obiektowy który w założeniach twórców ma być "lepszy" niż Java, ale wciąż w pełni współpracujący z kodem napisanym w Javie umożliwiająć firmom stopniową migrację. Podczas prezentacji postaram się pokazać dlaczego warto spróbować programować w Kotlinie, pokazać jego zalety i wady oraz przedstawić wnioski z dwóch projektów komercyjnych które udało się w nim stworzyć.

speaker: Jose Luis Ramos
title: GDG Guadalajara Android
subject: Android Frameworks Using Annotation Processing - Kotlin
description: We'll look at Dagger2, Data Binding and Room Persistence Library (other frameworks can be set up similarly). All these frameworks work through annotation processing: you annotate the code to have the boiler-plate code generated for you. Annotations allow to hide all the verbosity and keep your code simple, and if you need to understand what actually happens at runtime, you can look at the generated code. Note that all these frameworks generate source code in Java, not Kotlin.

speaker: Ademar Alves
title: GDG Guadalajara Android
subject: TBD - Kotlin related
description: Ademar comes to show us the magic of Kotlin in Android and share his knowledge on this world of mobile development.

speaker: Jessie L
title: Women Who Code Sydney
subject: Introduction to Android and Kotlin
description: This is a two hour hands-on introductory workshop where you will have an opportunity to develop a simple Android chat app called DROIDTALK using Kotlin! Kotlin was announced earlier this year at Google I/O to be officially supported by Android, an exciting development in the Android space. In the workshop you will learn how to set up a brand new Android project, create a simple UI, communicate with backend services using Kotlin and see the app in action using an emulator or on a real device.

speaker: Thomas Haarbach
title: Nighthackers Munchen
subject: Freier Eintritt - Die Alternative zu Java: Kotlin für Android/Java-Entwic­kler
description: An diesem Abend lernen Sie, was Kotlin ausmacht und warum aktuell viele Java Entwickler auf diese neue Programmiersprache umsteigen. Teilnehmer lernen Kotlin praxis-nah kennen. Sie können live mitcoden und die Sprache direkt ausprobieren.

speaker: Venkatesh
title: Bangalore Google Go & Dart Lang Meetup
subject: Introduction to the Kotlin an official language for Android app development.
description:
Kotlin is an open-sourced statically-typed programming language created by JetBrains that runs on the Java Virtual Machine and also can be compiled to JavaScript source code.

Many companies like Netflix, Uber, Trello, Pinterest, Corda etc. are using Kotlin (along with other programming languages) to create applications.

Kotlin is an open-sourced statically-typed programming language created by JetBrains that runs on the Java Virtual Machine and also can be compiled to JavaScript source code.

You can use replace Java code with Kotlin seamlessly. It is 100% interoperable with Java and Android.

speaker: Michael Obi
title: GDG North Central DevFest 2017
subject: Kotlin - What's in it For Android Developers
description: We'll skim the Kotlin language features and then explore how the language makes Android development fun for the developer.

speaker: Filip Babic
title: CodeCAMP 2017
subject: Explore MVVM in Android with Architecture components and Kotlin
description: We'll see how using Kotlin and Architecture components can bring our a stable and clean architecture in Android.

speaker: Sergey Chistyakov
title: GDG DevFest Gorky 2017
subject: Kotlin, или Туда и Обратно
description: Поговорим о том, как начать использовать Kotlin в существующем Java-проекте. Несмотря на заявленную полную совместимость с Java, на стыках остаются шероховатости. Посмотрим, что происходит с Kotlin классами после компиляции и как с этим жить java-программисту

speaker: Gustavo Lizarraga
title: Android Camp 2017
subject: Kotlin para Android de principio a fin
description:
Kotlin es un lenguaje de programación que actualmente tiene soporte oficial de Android para el desarrollo de aplicaciones.

En esta charla daré a conocer, desde que es el lenguaje de programación, como funciona, que características importantes tiene, como se integra con todo, extensiones que posee y otros temas.

speaker: Gustavo Lizarraga
title: Android Camp 2017
subject: Integrando Kotlin con Firebase
description:
Kotlin es un lenguaje de programación que actualmente tiene soporte oficial de Android para el desarrollo de aplicaciones.

En esta charla daré a conocer, desde que es el lenguaje de programación, como funciona, que características importantes tiene, como se integra con todo, extensiones que posee y otros temas.

speaker: Davide Cerbo
title: Codemotion Milan 2017
subject: Kotlin: could be the right time
description: A short introduction to Kotlin and why could be the right substitute for Java. The slides ends with a demo of a very small webapplication made wiht Kotlin, React and Spring Web

speaker: Abdellah SELASSI
title: GDG DevFest'17 Casablanca
subject: Introduction and Advanced Workshop
description: everything about Kotlin

speaker: Roberto Orgiu
title: GDG DevFest Mediterranean 2017
subject: Kotlin coroutines + Kotlin workshop
description: During the DevFest, we'll keep different stuff running, and 3 full days of Kotlin :-) We'll start with introductory talks and then coroutines, then we'll do the JetBrains codelab and finally a challenge for everyone

speaker: Davide Cerbo
title: GDG DevFest Campania 2017
subject: Kotlin: maybe it's the right time
description: After 20 years, Java seems to feel the weight of the years and his syntax it isn't evolved as we live. But the JVM it is always a stable environment and it is often in production everywhere. In the past years, there were many languages based on the JVM, but they don't have a lot of success. Kotlin conquered Android and, now, thanks to an easy syntax many and big companies behind it, may be used also in web development, also as full stack language.
