During this talk, we will give a look the language and how to use it to develop a production ready web application.

speaker: Svetlana Isakova
title: Kotlin Night Taipei
subject: You can do better with Kotlin
description:
The Kotlin programming language is gaining popularity amongst the Java developer community. It’s a modern language that gives more power in everyday routines.

Kotlin code generally looks cleaner and nicer, and it’s much easier to work with when you have less verbosity or code duplication. But what’s even more important, is that Kotlin is 100% compatible with all existing Java frameworks, and has good tooling (it’s from JetBrains after all).

In this talk, we’ll discuss the concepts of the language that provide the desired expressiveness, as well as new important features introduced in the latest Koltin release.

speaker: Daniel Heron
title: Kotlin ABQ
subject: Partner Event: Android Dev Meetup
description: Android now runs on Kotlin

speaker: Grzegorz Dyrda
title: Warszawa Java User Group
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description:
W swojej prezentacji postaram się Wam pokazać największe zalety świetnego (w mojej opinii) języka programowania, jakim jest Kotlin. Koduję w nim od prawie dwóch lat, i nie sposób przecenić jego czytelności, eleganckich rozwiązań największych problemów Javy, czy mnóstwa funkcji, których w Javie doczekamy się może za 5 lat…

Dodajmy do tego fakt, że Google ogłosił go oficjalnym językiem dla Androida, oraz zyskał oficjalne wsparcie w Springu 5.0, i robi się naprawdę ciekawie ;)

speaker: Matthew Cunningham
title: CORKDEV.IO
subject: Kotlin on and off the JVM
description: Kotlin is a new(ish) and exciting JVM language which hopes to be one language for many platforms; server side, client side (in browser or JVM), mobile (Android has first class support) and IoT. We’ll discuss the language and it’s features, but more importantly what you can do with it and how it can make application and test code better.

speaker: Filip Grześkowiak
title: Studenckie Grupy .NET
subject: Podstawy architektury Androida - "Hello Kotlin World"
description:
Cykl warsztatów Androidowych poświęconych budowaniu aplikacji od podstaw z użyciem języka Kotlin oficjalnie czas rozpocząć!

Zaczniemy od omówienia podstaw działania systemu i sposobu pisania aplikacji. Dowiemy się co musi się wydarzyć, zanim nasza aplikacja będzie wyświetlona na ekranie telefonu. Poznamy również podstawy języka Kotlin oraz napiszemy pierwszą prostą aplikację, aby zobrazować przyswojoną teorię.

speaker: Jonathan Campos
title: Kotlin DFW
subject: KotlinConf Roundup!
description: This month we are focusing on announcements and learnings from people that were lucky enough to attend in person. This is the perfect time to hear the newest news from the Kotlin Community. We have a handful of people that are going and should have some great information coming back. If you are lucky enough to go please think of at least one fun thing to share. Looking forward to seeing everyone soon!

speaker: Alexey Bulavka
title: Kotlin Dnipro User Group
subject: Bringing Redux to Kotlin
description: Ласкаво просимо на Dnipro Kotlin Meetup 6! 14 листопада ми збираємося вже вшосте разом і чекаємо Android-девелоперів Дніпра та всіх, хто цікавиться мовою програмування Kotlin. Будемо говорити про Kotlin, обговорювати нові ідеї та ділитися досвідом.

speaker: Roman Kravchuk
title: Kotlin Dnipro User Group
subject: How to work with Firebase using Kotlin
description: Ласкаво просимо на Dnipro Kotlin Meetup 6! 14 листопада ми збираємося вже вшосте разом і чекаємо Android-девелоперів Дніпра та всіх, хто цікавиться мовою програмування Kotlin. Будемо говорити про Kotlin, обговорювати нові ідеї та ділитися досвідом.

speaker: Enrique Emmanuel Perez
title: Guadalajara Kotlin User Group
subject: The Extension functions mandatory talk.
description: Hablaremos de la facilidad de usar Extension Functions en Kotlin para hacer nuestro código mas legible. Como importar una Extension Function a una clase en la que no esta declarada. Como Kotlin es un lenguaje que nos permite trabajar mano a mano con Java, mostraremos como llamar una Extension Function desde Java y para finalizar una breve demostración de como estan haciendo mi vida mas facil en el código.

speaker: Sinuhe Jaime
title: Guadalajara Kotlin User Group
subject: Getting closer to 1.2. What's coming to Kotlin?
description: Hablemos un poco de lo que esta pasando tras bambalinas en Kotlin y que nuevas cosas vienen para el lenguaje, estando en 1.2 RC estamos cada vez mas cerca de el siguiente gran release y es necesario que hagamos una revisión de que sera lo siguiente.

speaker: Trevor Halvorsone
title: Seattle Kotlin
subject: KotlinConf Recap and Growing Seattle Kotlin
description: This talk will be a recap of KotlinConf, the Kotlin conference hosted by JetBrains earlier this month. We'll discuss the major announcements from the conference, some of the great talks from KotlinConf speakers, and the current state of Kotlin.

speaker: Kevin Most
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: KotlinConf Recap and Growing Seattle Kotlin
description: Kotlin's most valuable feature is arguably its 100% Java interop, which not only lowers the barrier to entry for its use in existing projects, but gives it access to Java's rich ecosystem of libraries. However, calling clean Java code from Kotlin, and calling clean Kotlin code from Java, is not always so clean. We will discuss strategies and tools that enable you to write code in either language that is clean, safe, and idiomatic whether it's being called from Java or from Kotlin.

speaker: Kishore Reddy
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Slate Kit (part 1)
description: This is part 1 of a 2 part intro to Slate Kit, by framework author Kishore Reddy. This presentation discusses the architectural design of building the backend for mobile applications and introduces Slate Kit as an open-source solution. Slate Kit (www.slatekit.com (http://www.slatekit.com/)) is a Kotlin based open-source Mobile Backend and Toolkit for building out the server-side architecture for most web and mobile applications. It serves as an open-source alternative to Parse and FireBase with the ability to be hosted anywhere. It is comprised of 3 high-level parts: Architecture components, Utilities, and Application features. These parts are very general purpose, modular and can be partially or collectively used in any application. Slate Kit currently works with MySql, Spark Java for Web APIs, and has default integration with AWS queues (SQS) and file storage (S3).

speaker: Brent Watson
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: KotlinConf 2017 Recap
description: We'll be doing a quick (10min) recap of some of the highlights from KotlinConf 2017 which happened in San Francisco last week.

speaker: Stefan Tomm
title: JUG Mainz
subject: Von Java zu Kotlin: Die ersten Monate in der Praxis
description: In letzter Zeit liest man immer mehr über Kotlin, aber kann es sich auch in der Praxis bewähren? Wir beantworten dies mit einem klaren ja und möchten in diesem Vortrag sehr praxisnah aufzeigen, warum es sich für jeden Java Entwickler lohnt Kotlin eine Chance zu geben.

speaker: Grzegorz Dyrda
title: Trojmiasto Java User Group
subject: Spotkanie 102, Introduction to Kotlin
description: W swojej prezentacji postaram się Wam pokazać największe zalety świetnego (w mojej opinii) języka programowania, jakim jest Kotlin. Koduję w nim od prawie dwóch lat, i nie sposób przecenić jego czytelności, eleganckich rozwiązań największych problemów Javy, czy mnóstwa funkcji, których w Javie doczekamy się może za 5 lat… Dodajmy do tego fakt, że Google ogłosił go oficjalnym językiem dla Androida, oraz zyskał oficjalne wsparcie w Springu 5.0, i robi się naprawdę ciekawie ;)

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: GDG Hangzhou
subject: Kotlin: Beyond Android Development
description: Kotlin is great for Android, but it can do much more. This talk gives an overview of Kotlin and how it can be used on the server, and on other platforms to achieve multi-platform development.

speaker: Keynotes by Andrey Breslav & Erik Meijer
title: Kotlin Conference
description: Two days of content from Kotlin creators and community members

speaker: Marco Ferrer
title: Kotlin South Florida Users Group/
subject: Simplified Async Programming with Coroutines
description: After being delayed by the recent "poor" weather in South Florida we're back! This meet up we will be taking a look at the inner workings of Kotlin coroutines. In doing so we will show how to implement simplified, lightweight, non-blocking asyncronous programming in the JVM.

speaker: Adrian Santalla
title: Madrid Android Developer Group
subject: Reactive Clean Architecture for Android Apps with kotlin
description: Se pretende conseguir crear una arquitectura clean siguiendo los patrones de Clean Architecture aplicados al desarrollo móvil para Android. Hacer que toda la arquitectura sea reactiva utilizando RxJava. Dividir correctamente las capas de la arquitectura para que cada una se encargue de su funcionalidad, basándonos en los principios SOLID.

speaker: Burcu Geneci
title: GDG DevFest Eskişehir 2017
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: Kotlin is introduced and backed from Google and Jetbrains at Google I/O 17. It will be a short quick and warming introduction section for Kotlin language. Performance and advantages of Kotlin language will be discussed.

speaker: Mike Hearn
title: Kotlin London User Group
subject: Experiences of building an enterprise platform API with Kotlin

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: Kotlin London User Group
subject: Asynchronous Programming with Kotlin
description: Kotlin’s approach to asynchronous programming is about giving developers the freedom to choose what fits best. By leveraging the conventions of the language and its ability to be somewhat extended by using simple functions, Kotlin provides an asynchronous model by implementing coroutines, and provides a series of out of the box functionality such as yield, async/await as part of the standard library. In this session we’re going to see how all of this works and how Kotlin even provides us the ability to implement our own asynchronous functionality.

speaker: Rafał Naniewicz
title: Poznan Android Developer Group
subject: Make your Kotlin code less Javish

speaker: Fábio Carballo
title: GDG Lisboa
subject: Improve your tests using Kotlin
description: At Google I/O this year, Google announced that it will officially support Kotlin on Android as a “first-class” language. Developed and supported by JetBrains, the company behind intellij in which android studio is based on, is also partnering with Google to set up a nonprofit Kotlin foundation to shepherd the language.

speaker: João Carvalho
title: GDG Lisboa
subject: Kotlin on the Cloud
description: At Google I/O this year, Google announced that it will officially support Kotlin on Android as a “first-class” language. Developed and supported by JetBrains, the company behind intellij in which android studio is based on, is also partnering with Google to set up a nonprofit Kotlin foundation to shepherd the language.

speaker: Wataru Mukainakano
title: CA.apk #4
subject: 運用３年のタップル誕生でJavaからKotlin移行した話

speaker: Johan Haleby
title: Java Forum Malmo
subject: Exploring Kotlin
description: In this talk we will explore the hype around the programming language Kotlin from JetBrains. We will explore the goodies and gotchas of Kotlin and why Kotlin might be a good investment for JVM and Android based applications. Come and see how JetBrains practical approach to language design increases expressiveness and code safety without necessarily sacrificing readability. The talk will give a proper introduction to the language and its syntax and continue to cover a lot of things from functional constructs to extension functions and builders.

speaker: Mauricio Sierra
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: CodeLab, Build an Android app using Kotlin
description:
Do you want to learn how to build a small Android app using Kotlin while getting support along the way?

Follow a well documented tutorial to build a simple Android application with the Kotlin programming language which its adoption is growing exponentially in the Android world after Google officially announce its support.

speaker: Lora Kulm
title: Austin Android Developers
subject: Kotlin Book Club - Part 2
description:
Hello everyone! Here's part 2 of the kotlin book club! We'll be covering chapters 11-21 this time, picking up where we left off from last time. Due to the nature of the book, you should have some basic knowledge of Android development in Java, as it does contain a fair amount of references to Android development concepts.

The book we're reading is Kotlin for Android Developers, an example-driven book that will teach you Kotlin as you develop an app. Join us to discuss examples found in the book, ask questions, and learn more about the language with your fellow developers.

speaker: Steven Zgaljic
title: Kotlin DFW
subject: Kotlin Library for Spring
description: Come and listen about his first experience using Kotlin as the server-side technology for their next major project. You’ll see Kotlin with Spring-Boot and hear about what it’s like going from Java to Kotlin.

speaker: David Lucas
title: Columbus Kotlin User Group
subject: Introduction to Kotlin Microservices
description: Although Kotlin was introduced around 7 years ago, Google has created a new energy around this statically typed language. This session will take a look at how Kotlin is more than just a mobile language for Android. We will look at how Kotlin fits on the server side and what role it might play with microservices. Some examples using web services will be provided.

speaker: Mike Plummer
title: Kansas City Java Users Group
subject: Kotlin: JVM Superpowers
description:
Kotlin is a relative newcomer to the pantheon of JVM bytecode-compatible languages. Joining veterans like Groovy and Scala, it takes a fresh approach that avoids a lot the annoying aspects of Java while providing the power and flexibility of its siblings. But it has a secret superpower - Kotlin can compile directly to both Java and JavaScript.

In this talk we'll do some brief overview of Kotlin syntax and capabilities before diving into a start-to-finish example of Kotlin in action in a client-server application. Shield your eyes from the superior syntax, reminisce about how you used to live in fear of NullPointerExceptions, laugh about all those times you had duplicate the same utility functions in Java and JavaScript.

speaker: Somasundaram M
title: GDG DevFest Mumbai 2017
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: I will be talking about Kotlin in general and will also be covering up basic Syntax

speaker: Akshay Chordiya
title: GDG Pune
subject: Kotlin Everywhere!
description:
The popularity of Kotlin has exploded in the past year and Google's announcement of first-party support for Android at I/O means it's only going to keep increasing. Now is the perfect tite to jump on the language, as its future in mobile and beyond is very bright.

In this talk, our goal is to take a look at what Kotlin is, why you should use it, what are the most benefits of using it and see where it is headed. You’ll walk away with introductory knowledge of Kotlin and how to start using it in various platforms.

speaker: Akshay Chordiya
title: GDG Pune
subject: Kotlin Everywhere!
description:
The popularity of Kotlin has exploded in the past year and Google's announcement of first-party support for Android at I/O means it's only going to keep increasing. Now is the perfect tite to jump on the language, as its future in mobile and beyond is very bright.

In this talk, our goal is to take a look at what Kotlin is, why you should use it, what are the most benefits of using it and see where it is headed. You’ll walk away with introductory knowledge of Kotlin and how to start using it in various platforms.

speaker: Markus Schmidlin
title: BaselOne 2017
subject: Kotlin for Java Developers
description: Introduction of Kotlin for Java Developers. Focusing on Java interoperability and on language features like null-safety, expressions, data classes, extension functions, properties etc. and comparing them with respective Java idioms.

speaker: Ellen Shapiro
title: Mobile Era 2017,
subject: Lessons Learned From Porting To Swift And Kotlin
description: SpotHero has been moving its entire iOS application to Swift and started moving its Android app to Kotlin. Here's some lessons learned in the process in terms of selling management on using a new languages, how to get started, and some tips on things you should do along the way.

speaker: Ahmad Rosid
title: Yogya Mobile Development Group
subject: Jump start Android Development using Kotlin
description:
When we talked about Android development, chances are one programming language immediately comes to mind: Java. But now, we have another option: Kotlin.

With this new option in our plate, should we start focusing on Kotlin or stick with Java.

speaker: Ahlem Bedoui
title: GDG Monastir
subject: Kotlin Workshop V1
description: This is the first session for students to learn Kotlin for Android Development.

speaker: Manuel Chakravarty
title: Sidney Kotlin User Group
subject: A Type is Worth a Thousand Tests
description: In this talk, I will explain the advantages of a strong commitment to a sophisticated type system. I will illustrate the impact on language and program design through a series of examples, drawn from my experience of developing one of the first Swift-based applications published in the Mac App Store and illustrated by walking through key design issues in a simple iOS app. I will discuss why type-driven design benefits from functional programming principles, and also, how it allows us to write less tests without a loss of confidence in our code.

speaker: Dariusz Lorenc
title: Sidney Kotlin User Group
subject: Application Continuum
description: The Application Continuum is a spectrum of system architecture, showing the evolution of a distributed system starting from a single application and evolving into several applications and services. This tool will help you to make conscious design decisions and potentially reduce the cost of changing code as the system needs to evolve. The continuum is language agnostic and applies to any modern programming language, however, the provided examples will be all in Kotlin. So if you like Kotlin, and enjoy a bit of monolith-vs-microservices discussion, please join us!

speaker: Antonis Lilis
title: GDG Android Athens
subject: Title: Is this Swift for Android? A short introduction to the Kotlin language
description: Do you like Java but wish you didn’t have to write so much boilerplate code? Kotlin is now an officially supported language for Android and has an answer for this. Kotlin aims to address many of the pitfalls that are common with Java development, while making your code more concise, safe, and expressive. It is also 100% interoperable with Java and can be mixed in the same project.

speaker: Russell Wolf
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Idioms in Kotlin
description: Kotlin is an open-source programming language developed by JetBrains and has seen an upswell of interest since it's 1.0 release in 2016. It now supports not only JVM but JavaScript and LLVM architectures as well. We will have experts speaking about Kotlin and its use in these various architectures, showing their knowledge and the projects that they are working on.

speaker: Pablo Angel Veliz
title: Desarrollo en Android con Kotlin
subject: Ingresando al mundo Kotlin en Android
description: El objetivo es poder presentarles y compartir las novedades del lenguaje Kotlin en Android. También aprovecharemos para ver lo que se viene en Android Studio 3 donde Kotlin, ya está como opción oficial.

speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
title: DevFest Kaliningrad 2017
subject: Kotlin Coroutines
description: The coroutines appeared in the release of Kotlin 1.1 for the experimental flag and begin to be used in projects, and beginners have many questions about what it is, why and how to use them. This report is called upon to answer these questions. The report will consider the need for asynchronous programming, the problems of writing asynchronous code, coroutines as a solution to problems of writing asynchronous code, and a standard library for working with coroutines.

speaker: Sergey Ryabov
title: DevFest Kaliningrad 2017
subject: Use the Force (of Kotlin Stdlib), Luke
description: Kotlin is an excellent candidate for the role of the main language. It has everything that Java has been missing all this time. However, while so many songs were sung about the language itself and its powerful features, the standard language library received much less attention. A huge collection of utilities and adapters for all occasions, assembled in the same pragmatic manner, nonweakly expands the language's capabilities, maximizing productivity at the expense of inlines. In the report, we will dive into Kotlin Stdlib, as well as Anko - Kotlin Stdlib for Android.

speaker: Shady Yehia Selim
title: GDG Alexandria DevFest 17
subject: Intro to Kotlin for Android
description: How to start coding in Kotlin for Android

speaker: Christoph Pickl
title: OpenSlava 2017
subject: Kotlin 101
description: This talk is going to be about the possible successor of Java: Kotlin, developed by JetBrains which is most famous for it's IntelliJ IDE. It introduces many new (old?) language concepts like null safety, type inference, properties, extension functions and is still 100% interoperable with existing Java code and frameworks, making a migration as smooth as it can get. We will cover the basic syntax and concepts of Kotlin as well as do a side-by-side comparison to good old Java and hopefully after that talk you will be convinced to at least give it a try; and trust me: once you are there, you don't want to go back -ever!

speaker: Md S Ayubi
title: Hλderabad Scala Community
subject: The case for Kotlin
description: We have Ayubi with us, who is going to provide an overview of Kotlin, and the exciting developments around that eco-system.

speaker: Julian Jurec
title: Meetnight | konferencja IT, giełda pracy | Wrocław
subject: Kotlin: plusy i zalety - czym jest trzeci oficjalny język Androida?

speaker: Tom Campbell
title: Android Manchester
subject: The Basics of Kotlin - helping you get setup with Kotlin & Android dev

speaker: Marharyta Nedzelska
title: Kotlin at JUG UA
subject: Kotlin for Java developers: How and Why
description: In this talk you will be introduced modern programming language Kotlin. If you’re a Java developer for some years and you’re fed up with NPE, Checked Exceptions, casts and many other things that makes you mad and thinking of becoming a farmer, this talk is for you. Find out that Kotlin is a great solution for these problems. We will talk about differences between Kotlin and Java, key features of this language and how they are implemented, and of course we will read and write code.

speaker: Ademar Oliveira
title: Kotlin Workshop Wizeline Academy
subject: Learn How to Convert Dollars to Bitcoins
description: During the workshop, the students will learn about Kotlin by creating their own Dollar-to-Bitcoin converter using Gradle, RxJava, Mockito, JUnit, and AssertJ. They will also learn concepts and methods that can be used in other frameworks.Kotlin is a statically typed programming language for modern multiplatform applications, it is completely interoperable with Java and Android, and now it is a google official language to Android development.

speaker: James Williams
title: Kotlin Paris User Group
subject: Real World Kotlin-Powered Android
description: Kotlin has been picking up steam as the preferred way to make Android apps bringing a wealth of features to Android development, including null safety, data classes with automatic property accessors/modifiers, first-class functions, and lambdas. Even with all those clear benefits, starting from scratch can be intimidating.

speaker: Salomon Brys
title: Kotlin Paris User Group
subject: Coroutines in Kotlin for Android
description: Coroutines are the new feature of the Kotlin language in its version 1.1. They allow you to write seamingly blocking synchronous code that is really non-bocking asynchronous. In this talk, I will present the concept of coroutines and explain how Kotlin proposes coroutines as a tool to be built upon rather than a standard to be forcibly used. I will show the low level primitives and the main coroutine library. I will then propose a live coding that shows the primitives and high level usage of coroutines in Kotlin and that demonstrates they can be used in the backend as well as UI development of and Android application.

speaker: Brian Norman
title: Twin Cities Kotlin User Group
subject: Pattern : Design by Kotlin, a study of Kotlin delegation
description: Brian Norman will demonstrate the tricks associated with Kotlin Class and Property delegation. We'll create our own custom property delegate. We may even go bobbing through JVM bytecode.

speaker: Benjamin Monjoie
title: GDG Namur Android
subject: [Débutant] Migrer vers Kotlin
description:
Lors de cette nouvelle rencontre du GDG Namur Android, nous aurons l'occasion de parler de comment migrer une application existante vers Kotlin.

Nous aborderons aussi la question de pourquoi vous souhaiteriez faire ça et des difficultés que vous allez rencontrer.

speaker: Victoria Gonda
title: Grand Rapids Java Users Group
subject: Understand Every Line of Your Kotlin Codebase
description: Kotlin allows us to write more concise and expressive code. Does this come at the cost of understanding it? In this talk we will learn about how each and every Kotlin statement is compiled down to a class file, and use some inspection tools to apply this to our own codebase. You will walk away from this investigation with a deeper understanding of Kotlin, and the tools for continued exploration.

speaker: Alan Rodriguez
title: Atlanta Android Club
subject: Intro to Kotlin Talk
description: Alan Rodriguez of Kabbage will give a brief intro to Kotlin then we'll all dive into writing our own Kotlin Android projects.

speaker: Stefan Medack
title: Kotlin user group Berlin
subject: Data Classes and parsing JSON — A Story about converting Models to Kotlin

speaker: Oleksii Fedorov
title: Kotlin user group Berlin
subject: How Kotlin’s “@Deprecated” Relieves Pain of Colossal Refactoring?

speaker: Miloš Jokić
title: Kotlin User Group Serbia
subject: Kotlin with Spring Boot
description: This lecture will be an introductory lecture on the development of the Spring Boot application in the Kotlin programming language. Lecturer Miloš Jokić will, through a practical example, show the advantages of Kotlin usage in the development of these applications.

speaker: Gustavo Lizárraga
title: Ciclo de conferencias
subject: Kotlin para Desarrolladores Android
description:
Android O cambiará muchas cosas en los dispositivos inteligentes. Una de las noticias más llamativas que se han generado es la utilización de un nuevo lenguaje de programación que reemplazará al conocido Java. Su nombre es Kotlin y es la hora de conocer mucho más sobre esta innovación que puede ser muy positiva para los desarrolladores.

Los programadores que han trabajado en la plataforma oficial de desarrollo de apps de Google, Android Studio, ya están familiarizados con Kotlin por ser uno de los lenguajes de programación aceptados en ella. Ahora el reto será mucho más fácil porque deberán adaptarse a la nueva sintaxis que tendrá.

speaker: Haim Yadid
title: JavaOne 2017
subject: Developing Microservices with Kotlin
description: Next Insurance was founded at the beginning of 2016, and the first lines of its production code started accumulating in May 2016. As the first back-end developer, this session’s speaker started writing in Java and out of curiosity was experimenting with Kotlin. Kotlin had just seen its 1.0 release two months earlier. A year later, Next Insurance’s entire back-end development team is writing all the code in Kotlin. They have six microservices and several AWS lambda functions all written in Kotlin. Migration from 1.0.x to Kotlin 1.1 was smooth, and the developers are happy. This presentation covers the language’s features and why the speaker thinks it is awesome and fits perfectly with his company’s architecture.

speaker: Hans Dockter
title: JavaOne 2017
subject: Building Kotlin Applications at Scale with Gradle
description:
Kotlin is an extremely promising new JVM language that already has strong traction among Android developers. It also has a lot to offer for enterprise usage. For productive use of Kotlin in the enterprise, it is key for Kotlin builds to be able to scale. Gradle comes with outstanding support for scalable Kotlin builds. This session covers the following:

• How to use the Gradle build cache with Kotlin

• Compile avoidance with Kotlin

• Incremental compile with Kotlin

• Parallel builds with Kotlin

• Analyzing Kotlin build performance over time

• Extending Kotlin builds in a scalable way

• Managing multiple versions of Kotlin

speaker: Roman Elizarov
title: JavaOne 2017
subject: Coroutines on JVM with Kotlin
description: We live in an asynchronous era of concurrency. Modern front-end and mobile applications provide real-time feedback and communication, and server-side applications and services handle thousands of online users while integrating dozens of microservices. Kotlin is a modern and pragmatic JVM language developed by JetBrains, with a strong emphasis on Java interoperability. Kotlin introduced coroutines as a first-class language feature. This session presents a gentle introduction to the world of Kotlin coroutines, with live examples. You'll see how you can write scalable applications with Kotlin coroutines to handle lots of concurrent actions (connections, users, conversations, animations, and so on) at once.

speaker: Thomas Nield, Edvin Syse
title: JavaOne 2017
subject: Supercharged JavaFX with Kotlin and TornadoFX
description: This session presents an introduction to TornadoFX, a lightweight JavaFX framework for Kotlin. With its unique type-safe builder DSL; type-safe CSS; built-in REST client; and unique components such as Wizard, Forms, DataGrid, and data-driven TreeView—to mention a few—TornadoFX is a breath of fresh air in the JavaFX landscape. While enabling you to leverage your existing JavaFX knowledge, TornadoFX code utilizes Kotlin, the new JVM language star from JetBrains, to produce concise, expressive, and beautiful code with close to zero boilerplate. The session includes an overview of the framework and code comparisons to vanilla JavaFX, giving you the knowledge you need in order to get started writing powerful desktop applications in TornadoFX.

speaker: Justin Lee
title: JavaOne 2017
subject: Why Bother with Kotlin
description: Most presentations introducing a new language are really just language tours. A lot of interesting language features are shown, but it’s not always clear why one would choose to adopt that new language. This presentation focuses less on every little language feature and deviations from the Java language we all know and love and focuses on fewer features with a more in-depth discussion of how these features combine to make a compelling new alternative to Java.

speaker: Thomas Segismont
title: JavaOne 2017
subject: Unleash Your Talents: Server-Side Kotlin for Mobile Developers
description: Kotlin is a popular alternative language for Android applications. Mobile developers love it because it brings modern programming constructs yet allows for compatibility with a wide range of devices (more than 80 percent use a runtime version released in or before 2015) and it is fully interoperable with existing libraries. But Kotlin is versatile and can be used on the server side too. In this session, you will witness the creation of a mobile back end for an Android music player. You will learn how to use the Vert.x toolkit to build an HTTP server with Kotlin and RxJava. And then the presenter will expose a web API to provide the application with catalog, search, and streaming features. Kotlin programmers, unleash your talents and become full-stack mobile developers!

speaker: Murat Yener
title: Silicon Valley Code Camp
subject: Design Patterns with Kotlin
description:
Kotlin looks great but do you feel like suddenly loosing all your coding skills and wisdom?

Let's visit the Gang of Four Design Patterns and implement them on Kotlin using IntelliJ's native Kotlin support.

speaker: Dmitriy Zaitsev
title: Kotlin TechTalks@Lohika
subject: Coroutines in Kotlin
description:
We will talk about generators/yield, async/await, channels, composable/delimited continuations and its usage

Consider the available API

Make overview of standard kotlinx.coroutines library

speaker: David Mayboroda
title: Kotlin TechTalks@Lohika
subject: Advanced Kotlin Programming. Kotlin functions, delegation, classes, generics, reflection
description:
We will look at interesting Kotlin features, like infix function, lambda extensions

Also, we will dive into delegation of properties, fields and generics, invariance. This live coding session helps you to understand Kotlin features.

speaker: Jorge Castillo
title: Mobilization 2017
subject: Functional approach to Android architecture using Kotlin
description: Modern languages with functional colors are mainstream lately. Kotlin is arising as one of the most powerful ones, and developers around the world are using it for personal and professional projects. It's time for Android devs to look forward and benefit from this fact, and start designing more advanced architectures based on the features provided by the language. On this talk, I will showcase a Kotlin approach (plus a sample project) to learn how to move all our side effects in the edges of our system, and implement a functional oriented architecture for our Android apps based on purity. Testing will also take part on the talk. I will also showcase a functional programing lib we are working on in the spanish community, called kategory: https://github.com/kategory/kategory If you feel OOP is just not enough and want to make a huge step forward, come to this talk. You will not regret!

speaker: Michał Kowalczyk
title: Mobilization 2017
subject: How to combine Swift/Kotlin with C/C++
description: The appearance of Swift and Kotlin is a great change in mobile world. There is a number of advantages to using them. Still, one thing didn’t change: as embedded programmers, in order to provide better performance, reduce battery utilisation, etc. we sometimes need to operate on lower level. During the speech, I will provide you with ready-to-use tools that will let you utilise a huge codebase of C and C++ in your project and discuss differences between them.

speaker: Salomon Brys
title: Mobilization 2017
subject: Coroutines in Kotlin for Android
description: Coroutines are the new feature of the Kotlin language in its version 1.1. They allow you to write seamingly blocking synchronous code that is really non-bocking asynchronous. In this talk, I will present the concept of coroutines and explain how Kotlin proposes coroutines as a tool to be built upon rather than a standard to be forcibly used. I will show the low level primitives and the main coroutine library. I will then propose a live coding that shows the primitives and high level usage of coroutines in Kotlin and that demonstrates they can be used in the backend as well as UI development of and Android application.

speaker: Lorenzo Quiroli
title: Mobilization 2017
subject: kotlin.tools() of the trade
description: Kotlin is fairly known in the Android community nowadays, and it's really easy to make the switch from Java. Getting the most out of it though it's the difficult part. In this talk we will explore together the most amazing features it has to offer, from the simplest extension functions to the functional style tricks, the coroutines and a bunch of yet-to-discover amazing things!

speaker: Guy Heylens
title: Kotlin Belgium User Group
subject: Kotlin Night Brussels
description: Simon Vergauwen, Filip Maelbrancke and Lukas Lechner will give different talks about the Kotlin language.

speaker: Adit Lal
title: GDG BlrDroid DevFest 2017
subject: Practical tips for building apps with Kotlin
description: A walk through of some best pratices with Kotlin for android

speaker: Yanbin Hung
title: Taiwan Android Developer Study Group
subject: Kotlin lambda
description:
- introduction of lambda

- Its standard libraries

- A sample implementaction

speaker: Savvas Dalkitsis
title: Mobiconf 2017
subject: Migrating a mature code base to Kotlin
description: In this presentation we will talk about the practicalities of slowly migrating a mature Android app to Kotlin. The ASOS Android app is about 4 years old. During this time, a lot of legacy code has been accumulated, and many different technologies used. We will present our approach of integrating Kotlin, the lessons we learned and a few Kotlin features we love and can no longer do without.

speaker: Michał Ćwikliński
title: Mobiconf 2017
subject: Mobile Team on daily basis
description: Managing mobile team with multiple technologies might be difficult. But sometimes it comes with pleasure. Great team of very good developers providing high-quality code, well organized in Agile environment is a dream of every Project Manager or Product Owner. How we did it? Did we achieve it? We will try to explain our approach based on our Mobile Team of iOS and Android developers in Grand Parade.

speaker: Ash
title: GDG Berlin Android
subject: Kotlin Testing Robots
description:
Following the announcement at this years Google IO we've seen a dramatic uptake in Kotlin and over the last few months we've learnt how we can use it to improve and produce clean architecture applications and supercharge our unit tests, but what about our UI tests?

In this session, I'll show you how you can utilise Kotlin with the Robot pattern to build concise, terse and easy to read UI tests

speaker: Wm
title: GDG Berlin Android
subject: What's Awesome about Flutter
description: Flutter is a new architecture for building fast, beautiful apps that have received over a million downloads mobile for Android and iOS from Google. This talk will discuss what is new and different about Flutter, and why developers are excited about it.

speaker: Danny Preussler
title: Mobile Tea Revolution
subject: The Power of Kotlin for Your Tests
description: If you use Kotlin in production or not, you should use it's power for your tests. When it comes to extension functions, infix notation or possibilities for method names, Kotlin offers a lot that Java won't give you. Combined with the powers of libraries like Kotlin Mockito or Kluent this brings testing to a new level. In this session we will convert some boring Java tests to fun tests.

speaker: Antonel-Ernest Pazargic
title: Kotlin User Group Bucharest
subject: Kotlin Programming Language - Develop with pleasure
description: In this presentation (which is intended to be part of a series) the presenter is going to provide a gentle introduction to one of the latest JVM languages, Kotlin, from the simple hello world application to most importand language features to Kotlin ecosystem.

speaker: Carlos Ballesteros
title: Schibsted Spain Events
subject: Kotlin: de cero a producción
description:
Integrar un nuevo lenguaje de programación en un proyecto ya en marcha puede no ser lo más fácil del mundo, menos cuando trabajas en un equipo con más desarrolladores o se trata de un proyecto grande con varios años de vida. El cambio tiene que valer la pena, tiene que funcionar y es necesario tener la motivación para hacerlo. En el caso de Kotlin tenemos más de una razón para querer hacer el esfuerzo.

Integrar un nuevo lenguaje de programación en un proyecto ya en marcha puede no ser lo más fácil del mundo, menos cuando trabajas en un equipo con más desarrolladores o se trata de un proyecto grande con varios años de vida. El cambio tiene que valer la pena, tiene que funcionar y es necesario tener la motivación para hacerlo. En el caso de Kotlin tenemos más de una razón para querer hacer el esfuerzo.

En este evento haremos una introducción a Kotlin explicando sus puntos clave y dando distintos ejemplos de aplicación: por qué deberías integrarlo, para qué y cómo.

Daremos también solución a las dudas o dificultades iniciales que su integración pueda suponer para un equipo: “de cero a producción” sin problemas.

En la app Android de InfoJobs se ha llevado a cabo recientemente la integración de Kotlin. Compartiremos nuestro camino y experiencia real. Estamos seguros de que puede servir de motivación para dar el salto y empezar con este nuevo lenguaje.

title: Schibsted Spain Events

speaker: Grzegorz Dyrda
title: Torun JUG
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: W swojej prezentacji postaram się Wam pokazać największe zalety świetnego (w mojej opinii) języka programowania, jakim jest Kotlin. Koduję w nim od prawie dwóch lat, i nie sposób przecenić jego czytelności, eleganckich rozwiązań największych problemów Javy, czy mnóstwa funkcji, których w Javie doczekamy się może za 5 lat… Dodajmy do tego fakt, że Google ogłosił go oficjalnym językiem dla Androida, oraz zyskał oficjalne wsparcie w Springu 5.0, i robi się naprawdę ciekawie ;)

speaker: Tomas Theunissen­
title: TostiTalks & Techdays
subject: Techday - Kotlin
description: We will start with a presentation about the alternative for Java, to be followed up with a hands-on session to change a part of your own application to Kotlin or do some other interesting exercise with Kotlin. Afterwards, we will discuss whether Kotlin could be a serious alternative for your next project.

speaker: David Crescence, Lionel Duport
title: GDG Lyon Android User Group LYAUG
subject: Getting started with Kotlin
description:
Certains l’utilisaient déjà depuis quelque temps, d’autres n’en connaissent que le nom… Depuis le 17 mai 2017, date de l’annonce faite par Google de l’adoption du langage Kotlin comme langage officiel Android, nombreux sont les développeurs qui vont avoir envie de développer sur ce nouveau langage par conviction ou par simple curiosité. S’identifiant tout à fait à un langage moderne comme peut l’être le Swift à l’instar de l’Objective-C, le changement que représente Kotlin peut décourager certains aficionados du langage historique adopté par Android.

Cette présentation a pour objet de vous présenter les possibilités du langage Kotlin. Pour les plus néophytes, les points forts et principales features du langage seront abordées. Pour les initiés, l’intégration de différents frameworks couvrant les principaux besoin d’une application sera expliquée. Pour les plus expérimentés, les détails d’une architecture typique sera analysée. Afin de reprendre des cas d’usage courants, cette présentation s’appuiera sur une application type réseau social à la manière de la todo app Google avec les bonnes pratiques à adopter pour ce langage.

speaker: Zhang Jingjing, Shao Longfay, Zhang Jianhui
title: Zhangjiakou GDG
subject: Android Kotlin 开发交流

speaker: Miloš Vasić
title: Technology of the Future
subject: Upoznajte programski jezik Kotlin
description: Kotlin je novi general-purpose programski jezik koji se izvršava na Java virtuelnoj mašini i koji se sa svojim izvanrednim funkcionalnostima vrlo brzo istakao i postao popularan. Da je ovo jedan od programskih jezika budućnosti govori i činjenica da je nedavno zvanično uvršten kao oficijalni programski jezik za razvoj na Android platformi od strane Google-a, a postaje i sve popularniji u Spring zajednici za razvoj backend-a.

speaker: Cyril Mottier
title: Android Nantes
subject: How to ride Kotlin like a cowboy
description: qui nous fera une présentation de Kotlin, de ces particularités, de ces avantages, de ces ajouts, etc

speaker: Jake Wharton
title: DevFest Pittsburgh 2017
subject: Opening Keynote - Jake Wharton on Kotlin

speaker: Will Madison
title: Atlanta Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin Lightning Talks
description: Group discussions about how you know Kotlin, why Kotlin attract you and what you have done with Koltin

speaker: Scott Thisse
title: GDG Tampa Bay
subject: Using Kotlin to develop for Android with an intro to Progressive Web Apps
description: Kotlin is the latest and greatest way of developing your Android apps. We'll introduce you to some of the basics and then have a live coding session where we will build a simple app. We'll also get into how to integrate Kotlin and Java in the same project and some of the differences between the languages.

speaker: Keita Kagurazaka
title: DroidKaigi 2018
subject: Introduction to Kotlin coroutines
description: 本セッションではKotlin v1.1から登場したcoroutinesについて基礎から実践的な内容までを解説します。coroutinesとは何かから始め、非同期処理を同期的に記述するasync/awaitパターンやactorやChannel/ selectを用いた並行プログラミングについて紹介します。また、Androidアプリに実際に組み込む際にあたっての注意や設計指針、RxJavaとの関係についてもお話します。

speaker: Moyuru Aizawa
title: DroidKaigi 2018
subject: Introduction of Kotlin stdlib
description:
本セッションではKotlin stdlibに用意されている関数の用法と仕組みについて話す予定。

letやapplyなどのスコープ関数、委譲プロパティを利用して遅延評価を行えるlazy、closableのclose忘れを防ぐuse、コレクション操作を容易にするtoやmap, reduce, filterなどKotlin stdlibには便利な関数が多数用意されています。これらを知ることでJavaで今まで書いていた無駄なコードを省く事ができることがあります。

speaker: Sayo Oladeji
title: JavaOne 2017
subject: End-to-End Kotlin in a Java Enterprise
description:
Kotlin is taking over the world! As the language was announced as official for Android development by Google during I/O '17, a lot of developers got curious about this new language made by JetBrains. But Kotlin is actually not that new, so why the buzz right now?

Kotlin is taking over the world! As the language was announced as official for Android development by Google during I/O '17, a lot of developers got curious about this new language made by JetBrains. But Kotlin is actually not that new, so why the buzz right now?

speaker: Walmyr Carvalho
title: The Conf 2017
subject: Kotlin: The "New" Kid on The Block!
description:
Java has undoubtedly come a long way and has served businesses well. Part of what makes Java great is its outstanding backward compatibility. This, however, comes at a cost, a cost that partly necessitated the emergence of new languages targeting the same battle-tested JVM platform. This session’s speakers discuss their journey in a Java enterprise from standard Java to Kotlin—the motivations, the gains, and the gotchas. They address practical concerns such as build times, footprints, testing support, framework support, tooling support, and typical issues faced in 100% Kotlin as well as mixed-source projects. They approach this discussion from two production perspectives: a Java EE project (back end) and a native Android project (front end).

In this talk we're going to learn how Kotlin can help you to be more productive, the benefits of it compared to other JVM languages, how you can start to use it for Android and backend (or even iOS in a near future!) and Pinterest, Uber, Gradle, Evernote, 99, Nubank, Google, Trello and many other companies are already using it in production!

speaker: Tomasz Kleszczyński
title: JDD 2017
subject: Kotlin dla programistów Java
description:
Kolejny język dla JVM? Dlaczego Kotlin? Czy to już czas na porzucenie Javy?

Chcę się podzielić moim odczuciem na temat języka Kotlin począwszy od motywacji dla której powstał, przez cechy które posiada, po stan obecny i perspektywę rozwoju. Jeśli chcielibyście używać cech innych znanych języków na platformie JVM, nie przepisując całych aplikacji - poznajcie alternatywę.

speaker: Gustavo Lizárraga
title: XVII Cisaisi 2017
subject: Kotlin para desarrolladores Android
description:
KAndroid O cambiará muchas cosas en los dispositivos inteligentes. Una de las noticias más llamativas que se han generado es la utilización de un nuevo lenguaje de programación que reemplazará al conocido Java. Su nombre es Kotlin y es la hora de conocer mucho más sobre esta innovación que puede ser muy positiva para los desarrolladores. Los programadores que han trabajado en la plataforma oficial de desarrollo de apps de Google, Android Studio, ya están familiarizados con Kotlin por ser uno de los lenguajes de programación aceptados en ella. Ahora el reto será mucho más fácil porque deberán adaptarse a la nueva sintaxis que tendrá.

En esta charla se les dará una introducción teórica, beneficios y todo lo que se puede decir de este lenguaje para desarrollar aplicaciones Android, además de un demo de la interoperabilidad con Java.

speaker: Ahmed Nabil Mahran
title: GDG 6th October DevFest'17
subject: Kotlin For Android Workshop
description: Introduce the power of Kotlin in creating Android apps

speaker: Neil Power
title: Vancouver Kotlin
subject: Kotlin Beginners Night
description: After a few requests, we've decided to host a Kotlin Beginners Night! Come learn how to get started with Kotlin, Tips, Tricks, and more. Details on the structure of the night will follow.

speaker: Alexey Soshin
title: Kotlin TLV
subject: Introduction to coroutines in Kotlin
description:
Why coroutines

Limitation of spawning threads

Concept of coroutines in Kotlin

Working with coroutines: starting, pausing, cancelling

Diving into internal implementation

speaker: Alexander Gherschon
title: Kotlin TLV
subject: Coroutines in Android
description:
In this talk I would like to see what Kotlin brings to Android through the Kotlin Android extensions and Anko.

We will check what is the added value to Android besides the new Programming Language itself. We will learn how Android can benefit from Coroutines.

speaker: Michał Kosmulski
title: Devoxx Belgium 2017
subject: Kotlin BOF (Birds-of-a-Feather session)
description: Birds-of-a-Feather session dedicated to Kotlin during devoxx.be. No fixed agenda, just free talk in a group, moderated by the host (i.e. me). Exchanging experiences and real-life use cases between developers who use (or would like to use) Kotlin.

speaker: Renu Yadav
title: Wo-tech (Women in Tech)
subject: Learn kotlin
description: This event is for basic learning about kotlin , Those who have zero experience in programming , but want to start are more than encouraged to join.

speaker: Artem Zinnatullin
title: Silicon Valley Java User Group
subject: Pros of Kotlin for Java Developers
description:
Artem spent last year and couple months writing production Kotlin every day. For Android, CLI tools, CI/CD, microservices and test frameworks. Ironically, that happened right after he used it for a year+ in personal projects and a blog post "Why I don't want to use Kotlin for Android Development yet"

Many things were improved since then and Kotlin is definitely ready for mass use now. We'll start with everyday Java problems that are solved in Kotlin, discuss state of build systems, IDE and tooling support, and then touch Kotlin type system that in many cases allows you write safer and more elegant code

speaker: Roger O'Dell
title: Google Developer Group Kansas City
subject: Getting Started w/ Kotlin & Android Studio 3.0
description:
Building an app shouldn't be hard and Google has introduced many new features and tools that make it the easiest yet! As many of you know, Kotlin is now a supported language in Android!

A lot of new information that has come out since this year's Google I/O and you will get caught up on it all. We will explore some of the new features of Android Studio 3.0, Android 8.0 (Oreo), and getting started Kotlin.

With Kotlin now being a supported language in Android, I wanted to see what all the hype was about, so we will explore together how it works. We will talk about some of the cool things you can do with Kotlin and see it in action. I am excited in what Kotlin can do and I hope you will too!

speaker: Juan Liska
title: Guatemala Kotlin Meetup
subject: Spring 5.0 Webflux y Rifa de entrada a Kotlinconf en SF
description:
En esta ocasión volvemos a hablar de backend. JP Liska estará presentando Webflux que es parte de Spring 5.0

Webflux, basada en reactive streams, es una nueva alternativa a Spring MVC para la definición de un API http. Estaremos comparando con Ktor que se demostró anteriormente y con otras alternativas.

title: Kotlin user group Berlin

title: Kotlin user group Berlin
subject: Data Classes and parsing JSON — A Story about converting Models to Kotlin

title: Google Developer Group Pitești
subject: Intro in Kotlin
