speaker: Mikhail Goryunov
title: GDG South DevFest 2017
subject: Advanced Kotlin Patterns on Android. Sealed classes
description: В своём докладе я расскажу, как использовать привычные всем классы из Android более эффективно и безопасно. Поясню, какие радости и проблемы может принести Anko и как можно использовать эту библиотеку; как благодаря Kotpref полностью избежать шаблонного кода, работая с SharedPreferences. Покажу, как в некоторых распространённых случаях избегать процедурщины и писать понятный и поддерживаемый код.

speaker: Ange Bagui
title: Abidjan Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin After Work
description: Small Introduction about Kotlin and organize the next Workshop.

speaker: Tobias Blaschke
title: Softwerkskammer Magdeburg
subject: Kotlin für die Android-Entwicklung
description: Kotlin ist nur eine weitere Programmiersprache für die JVM. Warum also bewirkt die verhältnismäßig dröge Ankündigung zur Unterstützung einer JVM-Sprache solche Begeisterung? Was ist das Besondere an Kotlin gegenüber Java? Der Vortrag gibt einen ersten allgemeinen Einblick in die Sprachfeatures von Kotlin und gibt Kotlin-Neulingen die Möglichkeit sich selbst einen Eindruck über die Sprache zu verschaffen.

speaker: Andy Glassman
title: Greater Milwaukee Java Meetup
subject: Intro to Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a new language developed by Jet Brains (IntelliJ). It has been increasing in popularity, and there are claims it simplifies a lot of the headaches that come with writing code in Java.

speaker: Robert Chrzanowski
title: GDG Hampton Roads
subject: Kotlin: From Zero to Hero (Part 2)
description: Come learn the cool new programming language, Kotlin. Google now officially supports Android development using Kotlin.

speaker: Rod Mesquita
title: Google Developer Group Ann Arbor Android
subject: From Java to Kotlin
description:
Convert the Firebase Friendly Chat (Java) app to Kotlin. Bring your computer with Android Studio 3.0 to explore Kotlin in our interactive meet up.

Get the Java code from github.com/rmesquit/friendlychat-android

Get the latest Android Studio from https://developer.android.com/studio/preview/index.html

Agenda:

6:30pm

• Pizza and pop sponsored by Arbormoon Software, Inc.

• Download Java code

7:00pm

• Convert to Kotlin

• Review and Debug issues

• Discuss Kotlin concepts

About Speaker:

Rod has been building things since his dad taught him how to solder the wiring of his childhood home in Brazil. He moved to the US in 2011 and decided to build something that improves his English. As a Windows pc owner, learning Android was the logic way to go. He built his first useful Android app to help increase his vocabulary. It inspired him to pursue a career as a software engineer with Arbormoon Software, Inc. You can learn more about him from www.rodrigo.today

speaker: Michael Yotive
title: Columbus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin: Under the Hood
description: In this talk, we’ll explore Kotlin at a lower level. We’ll take a look at the class file which gets generated from the Kotlin compiler and explore what happens when it gets decompiled back to Java.

speaker: Francesco Vasco
title: EclipseDay Milano 2017
subject: Vert.x + Kotlin – fuga dal callback-hell
description:
Vert.x is an event-driven framework well known for high-performance microservice development.

Unfortunately using Java for asynchronous development make the code ugly to write and really hard to read, so let’s see how programming a multi-reactor using Kotlin without going to the hell.

speaker: Svetlana Isakova
title: YOW! Connected Workshop
subject: Kotlin for Java Developers
description: The Kotlin programming language developed by JetBrains is now an officially-supported language for Android Development. This full-day Kotlin tutorial workshop aims to share with you the power and the beauty of the language.

speaker: Dan Lindeman
title: Software GR
subject: A Talk About Kotlin
description: What is with all the hubaloo around Kotlin? After Google IO this May, Kotlin went from the darling of a few, to the promised land of many. In this talk, Dan Lindeman will present an introduction to the Kotlin programming language, showing off some marquee features. Further we will discuss several stories that the language seeks to address.

speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
title: Montpellier JUG
subject: Pourquoi Spring <3 Kotlin
description:
Pourquoi Spring <3 Kotlin et comment utiliser le support officiel de ce langage qui sera disponible dans Spring Framework 5, Spring Boot 2 et Spring Data Kay pour développer votre prochaine application Spring plus efficacement tout en vous faisant plaisir.

Sébastien nous décrira comment transformer étape par étape un projet Spring Boot 1.0 écrit en Java en un projet Spring Boot 2.0 écrit en Kotlin tournant sur le nouveau framework réactif Spring WebFlux :

- Etape 1: Pourquoi choisir Kotlin et comment l'utiliser à la place de Java 8

- Etape 2: Mise à jour vers Spring Framework 5 et Spring Boot 2.0

- Etape 3: Migrer de Spring MVC à Spring WebFlux et ses API réactives

- Etape 4: Utiliser l'API fonctionnelle de Spring

speaker: Tom Wadzinski
title: Twin Cities Kotlin User Group
subject: DevJam Jam Session - Kotlin
description: DevJam is hosting a Kotlin-themed jam session in September.

speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
title: SpringOne Platform
subject: Kotlin in Practice
description:
In this new talk, I will explain why Spring <3 Kotlin and how you can leverage Spring official support for Kotlin (in Framework, Boot, Data) to build your next Spring project more efficiently and with more pleasure.

I will describe gradually how you can transform your Spring Boot 1.0 Java + Javascript project with into a Spring Boot 2.0 pure Kotlin project running on top of the new WebFlux functional web framework.

speaker: Ivan Shorich
title: MBLTdev 2017
subject: Android-анимации на Kotlin и RXJava2
description: Доклад рассматривает эффективную цепочку Android-анимации с использованием RxJava2 и Kotlin. Данный подход также совместим с Java. При анимации элементов пользовательского интерфейса платформа Android предоставляет различные анимационные события, такие как запуск, аннулирование, остановка и так далее. Рассмотрим перенос логики анимаций в последовательные вызовы RxJava, делая весь процесс «реактивным» с улучшенным синтаксисом и контролем потока управления.

speaker: Christina Lee
title: Øredev
subject: Kotlin: Beyond the Language
description:
Kotlin encourages best coding practices and surfaces code smell in the Java files it interacts with.

A build system made with Java in mind will hiccup when handling a mixed codebase. Build tools should be the biggest consideration when integrating Kotlin

There is coding danger on the boundaries where Kotlin and Java interact and developers should pay strict attention to these areas.

Kotlin is young enough to not have established style guides or idiomatic language guides. On-boarding becomes all the more important in such an atmosphere.

At this point in time, most Android developers have heard of Kotlin and are familiar with some of its advantages. In previous talks, I've covered why and how developers in large companies can attempt to introduce a new language, and all of it's associated paradigms, into a legacy codebase. In this talk, we'll cover some of the more advanced components of introducing a new language, including on-boarding new team members, orchestrating team wide trainings, setting code and style guidelines, and adapting existing infrastructure tools to accept hybrid codebases. This talk aims to go beyond the why's of adopting Kotlin and into the how's of actually doing it, giving the developer a framework to use when thinking about adopting (or not) Kotlin into their own codebase.

speaker: Filip Babic
title: KulenDayz Kidz 2017
subject: Kotlin advanced constructs and idioms in Android development
description: You’ve all probably heard the big news some time ago, yet you still see the major buzzwords all over the place : lambdas, functional programming, extension functions, delegates. Of course we can interpret that with a single word -> Kotlin! And if you still haven’t made it your absolute favourite language for Android development (there are so many, I know), now is the time! Going through some very annoying and time-consuming operations and problems we deal with in Android, we’ll see that there really is a better way. Join us for an amazing adventure!

speaker: Nicolas Fränkel
title: Odessa Java Group
subject: Spring Boot and Kotlin, a Match Made in Heaven
description:
Despite being very new, spring boot has seen a spectacular start as an amazing kickstarter for spring-based application. You can now start your project in a matter of minutes, not days!

On the other hand, you’re still using Java, with all its ceremony regarding code… Wouldn’t it be great if we could pair Spring Boot with a powerful yet simple language?

In this talk, I’ll live code a Spring Boot application using Kotlin, the friendly language provided by JetBrains. Come discover how you can now cut through all the red tape and finally focus only the important stuff.

speaker: Krzysztof Zienkiewicz
title: Nashville Java Users' Group
subject: Kotlin Intro
description: Come learn the basics of Kotlin by working through examples!

speaker: Yossi Elkrief, Ronel Girat
title: Fullstack Developer Israel
subject: 60 Rx minutes
description: Rx is here, live and kicking :) , We'll cover some reactive paradigms and see how we've built a recommended practices app to use Rx together with Kotlin and how it's all tied up.

speaker: Shaul Rosenzweig
title: Fullstack Developer Israel
subject: Kotlin - Don't call us, We'll call(Log) you
description: We will see how we got a CallLog with DAO and added tests to verify our work is up to standards.

speaker: Mark Chandler
title: Cincinnati Software Craftsmanship
subject: An Adventurer’s Guide to Kotlin
description: Come join us for an introduction to the coolest new kid on the JVM block.

speaker: Walmyr Carvalho
title: GDG Krakow
subject: Kotlin in production
description: At 99, one of the biggest ride hailing companies in Brazil, we're using Kotlin in production since the last year. On this talk I want to show some basic info and overview about the language, show some real production code made with Kotlin and remove the fears of using this language in production applications

speaker: Huyen Tue Dao, Christina Lee
title: droidconNYC 2017
subject: The Road to Kotlintown
description: Even if you’re brand new to Kotlin, you might know that you can right-click any Java file and convert it automatically. Score! But wait, what are all these “!!” and why is the code littered with “?”. Sure, the code compiles, but how do you make the code not just compile but follow best practices? How do you get closer to making your code idiomatic? In this talk we are going to discuss how you can get started in Kotlin by converting current code and adding new code, how to make that code more Kotlin-esque, including some good practices and some things to avoid. Hopefully, you will leave this talk being able to get over those bumps and speed your way to Kotlintown.

speaker: Lisa Wray
title: droidconNYC 2017
subject: Data Binding in a Kotlin World
description: If you like Butterknife, get ready to discover a whole new tool drawer. Data binding in 2017 is a stable framework that can drastically reduce boilerplate code and transform the way you write UI—even if you already use RxJava or Kotlin Android Extensions. Animate, transition, and respond to user input without cluttering your code. Add your own custom properties to Android’s View classes (like android:font or android:imageUrl)! We'll start at the very beginning with Kotlin support, discover tricks to supercharge your XML, and end in a deep dive to lambdas and two-way binding. No prior knowledge of data binding needed.

speaker: Brent Watson
title: droidconNYC 2017
subject: Full-Stack Kotlin
description: Kotlin can be used for pretty much every part of your dev stack. And that's exactly what we'll look at: Backend using Kotlin (we'll look at a couple of Kotlin web frameworks), Frontend (using Kotlin/Javascript support), Mobile (Kotlin for Android, of course), and build tools to tie it all together (Gradle-Kotlin or Kobalt).

speaker: Dan Kim
title: droidconNYC 2017
subject: Getting to 100% Kotlin: A practical guide
description: A lot of teams are super excited by Kotlin and are ready to go all-in with it. But while exciting, it can also be stressful — learning a brand new language while converting old code and writing new features, all at the same time? How does a team get there as smoothly as possible? We’re here to help! At Basecamp we’ve worked hard to make our codebase 100% Kotlin over the course of the last year. We learned a lot and want to share a roadmap of how you can get there too. If you're just starting out with Kotlin but can already see its potential, this talk is for you. We’ll share our best overarching strategies and tips based on a year of real-world shipping — how to get started, how to keep moving forward, and pitfalls to keep an eye out for. No theory here, this is all based on our actual experiences getting to 100% Kotlin.

speaker: Ihor Kucherenko
title: Yalantis Kotlin Community
subject: How to work with Android NDK using Kotlin
description: Ігор почне з невеликого Getting Started with the NDK. Ви дізнаєтеся про те, як викликати нативний код з Kotlin і навпаки. Обговоримо, які проблеми можуть виникнути і як їх уникнути.

speaker: Anna Severinovskaya
title: Yalantis Kotlin Community
subject: Kotlin design patterns vs Java design patterns
description: Аня порівняє реалізацію патернів Singleton, Decorator, Builder, Fabric Method, Adapter в Kotlin і Java, розповість про реалізації патернів в Kotlin. Ви дізнаєтесь про плюси і мінуси реалізації цих патернів на Kotlin і Java.

speaker: Kyrylo Penzykov
title: Yalantis Kotlin Community
subject: Kotlin Android Extensions
description: Кирило розповість, що дає нам Kotlin Android Extensions, як вони були розширені з оновленням Kotlin 1.1.4. А також трохи розповість про підтримку Kotlin для написання скриптів Gradle.

speaker: Sergey Ryabov
title: GDG DevFest Voronezh
subject: Use the Kotlin Stdlib
description: Kotlin — прекрасный кандидат на роль основного языка. В нем есть все, чего так не хватало в Java все это время. Однако пока так много песен было спето про сам язык и его мощные фичи, стандартная библиотека языка получила гораздо меньше внимания. Огромная коллекция утилит и адаптеров на все случаи жизни, собранная в той же прагматичной манере, неслабо расширяет возможности языка, максимально сохраняя производительность за счет inline-функций. Мы погрузимся в Kotlin Stdlib и Anko — Kotlin Stdlib for Android — по самые уши, оставив старые Java-привычки, почерпнем новых Kotlin-приемов и разберемся, как же эта вся красота работает под капотом.

speaker: Ohad Shai
title: Tech Talk Teach
subject: Scala--pack your Future[T]; Kotlin is coming!
description:
Kotlin is the new kid in the JVM landscape that was recently adopted by Google as the "Swift of Android".

Many people ask why Kotlin is better than X (where X is Scala, Java or Groovy) or sometimes claims the opposite. We will discuss all those extra features which are present in Scala but absent in Kotlin, and some more advantages of Kotlin comparing to other JVM languages. In this talk, we will also recap some of the basics and awesome features that make Kotlin a great language to use.

speaker: Cameron Ketcham
title: Brooklyn Kotlin
subject: Kotlin at Etsy, how we are starting to adopt it?

speaker: Shady Selim
title: GDG Minia
subject: Kotlin for Android 101
description: The small big details in Kotlin that will ease & fasten Android app production

speaker: Torstein Skulbru
title: GDG Bergen
subject: Kotlin - Introduksjon og workshop
description: Kotlin er et programmeringsspråk utviklet av JetBrains (folkene bak IntelliJ, Resharper osv). Språket ble sidestilt med Java som førsteklasses plattformspråk for Android under Google IO 2017.

speaker: Serj Lotutovici
title: IT NEXT Meetup
subject: Kotlin for the masses
description: Kotlin is a general purpose language from JetBrains, that won the hearts of tens of thousands Android and Java developers. It’s cleanliness, conciseness and sheer beauty makes it appealing for those stuck in the old Java world. But the story of Kotlin goes beyond the JVM. With full fledge JS support and Kotlin-Native in the works, we are looking at a language that can power every part of your stack: from backend to frontend, from build scripts to mobile.In this talk, we’ll explore the power of Kotlin and how it can bring all technologies together.

speaker: Steve Peterson
title: Mobile Twin Cities
subject: Kotlin: Android's New Old Programming Language
description: Kotlin is the "new" (meaning 5 years old) programming language alternative for Android Development. It was developed by JetBrains (the maker of IDEs for Android and other platforms), and as of 2017, embraced and approved by Google. This presentation will show numerous code examples and include tips on how to get started for your project.

speaker: Dmitry Khomutov
title: Java Zagreb
subject: Kotlin for Java developers
description: Start of using Kotlin by migrating real project written in Java to Kotlin. Basic oKtlin idioms which allow decreasing amount of code. Features which could help to improve the solution of a problem. Useful testing approaches.

speaker: Ross Tuck
title: PHPAmersfoort
subject: Derping Through Kotlin
description: I've been playing around in Kotlin, a cool, practical alternative to Java. I would like to share a basic overview of the language with you, as well as my experiences flailing around.

speaker: Jonathan Campos
title: Kotlin DFW
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: We will look at some of the features of the language, see code samples, and understand a bit more how it works.

speaker: Renu Yadav
title: Women Who Code Singapore
subject: Kotlin Coding
description: Kotlin has been steadily on the rise and is now being widely adopted. Touted as an open source language developed by the industry programmers to address problems Java developers face in the industry.

speaker: Lukas Lechner
title: Kotlin Vienna
subject: How Effective Java influenced Kotlin
description: Java was released over 20 years ago and in the last two decades we've learned a lot about language design. In this talk Lukas will present how the famous book "Effective Java" by Joshua Bloch influenced design decisions in Kotlin. He will discuss which items were implemented and what they look like.

speaker: Jan Michael Auer, Martin Prebio
title: Kotlin Vienna
subject: Fun with kotlin.js
description: The Kotlin 1.1 release moved the Javascript backend from experimental to stable. But how useful is it in reality? We will have a look at a simple Kotlin JS application, an overview what’s possible and what’s not, and an outlook which scenarios will benefit from Kotlin’s move to JS.

speaker: Daniel Rosowski
title: Java User Group Bielefeld
subject: Kotlin Vorstellung
description:
Spätestens seit der offiziellen Unterstützung durch Google im Mai 2017 ist Kotlin in der Android-Welt in aller Munde, aber auch darüber hinaus schlägt die Sprache mittlerweile immer mehr Wellen. Und dabei handelt es sich nach der Einschätzung Vieler bei weitem nicht nur um einen kurzfristigen Hype, sondern um einen ernstzunehmenden neuen Player im Java-Ökosystem, der jedem Java Entwickler zumindest ein Begriff sein sollte.

Für alle, die Kotlin noch gar nicht oder nur vom Hörensagen kennen, gibt dieser Vortrag anhand praktischer Beispiele einen Überblick darüber, was Kotlin so interessant macht. Neben einer grundlegenden Vorstellung der Sprache als solche werden dabei auch Themen rund um den Einsatz von Kotlin in realen Projekten beleuchtet.

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: Google Developer Days Europe
subject: What can Kotlin do for me?
description: By now, you've probably heard of Kotlin and may have even taken a look at some of its features. And you might be wondering what the big deal is. Sure, it's got some nicer syntax—and what else? The thing about Kotlin though is that it's not about a list of features, but how, together and in harmony, these features lead to a more enjoyable and productive development experience. In this video, Hadi Hariri focuses on showing why Kotlin solves some of the pain points you often encounter when writing code—be it Android, Server, or any other type of software development.

speaker: Szabo Adam, Voros Gyula
title: Kotlin Budapest User Group
subject: Learn how to integrate services with Akka HTTP and Kotlin?

speaker: Samiksha Ande, Nilaja Patankar
title: GeekNight September 2017 - Android
subject: A taste of Kotlin for Android.
description:
Kotlin being highly popular and having a lot of unique features creates new opportunities for all developers. As Android team has officially added support for Kotlin, making it a first-class language, more and more people are getting involved in it. So would you like to taste kotlin with Android with us?

As part of this session, we would be introducing basics of kotlin, pros and cons and its comparison to Java.

speaker: Dusko Bajic
title: Kotlin User Group Bosnia
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: Showing the language basics and the power of functional programming

speaker: Igor Laborie
title: DEVOXX Morocco
subject: Kotlin par l'exemple
description: En annoncant le support officiel de Kotlin pour Android lors de la dernier Google I/O, Google a donné un énorme élan à ce superbe langage. Ce n'est pas si surprenant, car en s'inspirant du meilleur de Scala, Groovy, Go, ... et en ciblant la meilleure VM disponible, Kotlin part avec beaucoup d'avantages. En prenant le temps avant de sortir la v1.0, beaucoup de pièges classiques ont étés évités. Dès aujourd'hui le langage profite d'un outillage mature, tout en étant très abordable pour les développeurs. Au travers d'exemples concrets, venez découvrir les éléments du langages qui ont su nous séduire.

speaker: Nicolas Fränkel
title: Java User Group of Lausanne
subject: Spring Boot et Kotlin, une combinaison gagnante

speaker: Jinn Kim
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Kotlin Office Hours Launch Party!
description:
This is our first meeting that will launch the new Kotlin Office Hours meetup. After the introduction to this new meetup we will have our first speakers Russell Wolf and Kenton Guan give a presentation called "A brief survey of Kotlin," which covers some of the basic Kotlin features in order to give newcomers an introduction to the language, as well as looking at its history and some of the exciting future possibilities. We looking forward to seeing you here at the birth of our brand new meetup!

We're also excited to announce that JetBrains has provided us with a ticket to the first ever KotlinConf, in San Francisco on November 2-3. We'll be raffling this ticket off to attendees, so come join us if you'd like a chance to attend this exciting conference on all things Kotlin.

speaker: Russell Wolf, Kenton Guan
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: A brief survey of Kotlin
description: An introduction to the language, as well as looking at its history and some of the exciting future possibilities.

speaker: Hemanta Sapkota
title: Android Australia User Group Sydney
subject: Declarative UX in Android with Kotlin and Anko
description: In its current state, UX construction in Android is a rather painful experience. While XML layout resources are good for rapid layout creation, they incentivise unnecessary modularisation of components which create maintenance hassles & needless indirections. In this talk, I'll go through how complex UX can be constructed and managed with ease, thanks to Kotlin and Anko

speaker: Giovanni Marques, Jussi Hallila
title: Dublin Kotliners
subject: How HubSpot is using Kotlin on Android?
description: This time the meet will be hosted at HubSpot at their beautiful One Dockland Central offices. Giovanni Marques from HubSpot's mobile team will share their experiences on adopting Kotlin for Android development. Jussi Hallila will go through his journey on integrating Kotlin to server side development with Spring Framework.

speaker: David Julia
title: Chicago Kotlin Users Group
subject: Monthly Kotlin Meetup
description: This week's meetup will be a hack night, so bring your laptop! Work on whatever you'd like. If you don't have a project, we'll have some code Katas to work on. Pair programming is encouraged! Work with other folks to up your Kotlin skills.

speaker: Gabe Hicks
title: Seattle Java User's Group
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: There are many different JVM languages ranging from the very script-like Groovy to the highly structured such as Scala and Closure. Kotlin by Jetbrains is one of the newest additions to the family of languages on the JVM. In this talk we will cover the basic features of the Kotlin language, how does it compare to vanilla Java, and what are some reasonable use cases for the language.

speaker: Ilya Vorobev
title: Singapore Kotlin User Group
subject: Making Magic with Kotlin Collections
description: Collections in Kotlin explained and few magic lessons about them.

speaker: Ruslan Kim
title: Singapore Kotlin User Group
subject: Java to Kotlin. Finally, let’s convert!
description: The story behind converting large code base from Java to Kotlin.

speaker: Andrey Mischenko
title: Singapore Kotlin User Group
subject: Lambda, Closure, Anonymous Function and Where to Find Them
description: Dive to the most used features of Kotlin.

speaker: Rick Chen
title: Auckland Android Community
subject: Introduction to Function Currying in Kotlin
description: A short exploration around an function currying in Kotlin: what it is, why it is interesting, and how you can use it on Android and elsewhere!

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: Android Australia User Group Sydney
subject: A Deeper Dive into Kotlin
description: In this talk we're going to dive a bit deeper into some powerful aspects of Kotlin that provide us with great functionality. We're going to cover topics such as delegation, higher-order extension functions, inline and reified functions, and some other features that allow us to create DSL for using in our applications. In addition we'll look at some of the new things coming out in Kotlin 1.1, and in particular Coroutines, Type Aliases, Local Delegation Properties and Inline Properties.

speaker: Mike Gouline
title: Android Australia User Group Sydney
subject: Asynchronous Vert.x Applications in Kotlin
description: Looking at web development, Spring seems to be the star of most Kotlin articles and tutorials. This talk will explore an asynchronous alternative that is Vert.x and evaluate its production readiness. We’ll do that by writing a simple (but working) web API, with some neat Kotlin features to boot, and figure out what the benefits of using this framework are

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: Sydney Kotlin User Group
subject: Asynchronous Programming with Kotlin
description: Kotlin’s approach to asynchronous programming is about giving developers the freedom to choose what fits best. By leveraging the conventions of the language and its ability to be somewhat extended by using simple functions, Kotlin provides an asynchronous model by implementing coroutines, and provides a series of out of the box functionality such as yield, async/await as part of the standard library. In this session we’re going to see how all of this works and how Kotlin even provides us the ability to implement our own asynchronous functionality.

speaker: Neal Maloney
title: Sydney Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin after 20 years as a Java developer or: How I learned to stop worrying and love type inference
description: This talk will discuss things I’ve learned moving from Java to Kotlin. Example code for a Bluetooth LE driver in both Java and Kotlin (with RxJava) demonstrating the advantages with Kotlin and some of the things that took a little getting used to.

speaker: Erik Pragt
title: Sydney Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin with Spring Boot 2
description: Based on an Reactive application, Erik will show the benefits of using Kotlin in the backend using Spring Boot 2 and Spring 5.

speaker: Koichiro Oishi
title: Swift/Kotlin合同勉強会
subject: Kotlin/Swift 有理数クラスのすすめ

speaker: Paul Davies, Niamh Power, Joe Timmins
title: GDG Liverpool
subject: Test-driven development, featuring Kotlin!
description:
In this demo, we'll be implementing a simple app that keeps the score of a ten-pin bowling game, using test-driven design, pair programming and Kotlin.

Kotlin is the newly-Google-supported language from JetBrains, the company behind IDEs such as WebStorm, Android Studio and IntelliJ IDEA. It's concise, statically typed and runs on the JVM, and it's one of the fastest growing languages in the world, according to the Tiobe Index. Come along and see what it can do.

We've chosen to put Kotlin and our TDD skills through their paces by going over a classic kata from Uncle Bob Martin. Using only tests to guide us, we'll (hopefully) code up a fully working app that can keep score of a ten pin bowling game.

We'll be following the guidelines of TDD by using ping pong pairing - one person writing a failing test, the other making it pass, then switching.

For those of you that aren't familiar with test-driven approaches, this is an ideal opportunity to see how they can benefit you.

For those that are familiar with TDD, it's an ideal opportunity to come and tell us where we're going wrong!

speaker: Jorge D. Ortiz-Fuentes
title: Droidcon Berlin 2017
subject: Home impovement: Architecture & Kotlin
description:
Two of the most relevant news from the recent Google IO were the Guide to App Architecture and the adoption of Kotlin as a first-class language. Both have a very positive impact in our applications.

In my talk I will introduce and advanced architecture inspired in the Clean Architecture of Uncle Bob and I will show the impact of these two elements.

First I will cover the components provided for integration with the lifecycle and how this saves a lot of effort to preserve view models or presenters. I will briefly cover th methods that we had available until know focusing on the use of a fragment with no view that had the retained instance property set to true.

speaker: Hendrik Kokocinski
title: Droidcon Berlin 2017
subject: BRAVE NEW WORLD!? EXPLORING APP DESIGN WITH ARCHITECTURE COMPONENTS AND KOTLIN
description:
Software architecture in Android has come a long way in the past years. With MVP and MVVM currently being very popular and concepts like React Native and Redux on the horizon Android developers can not complain about a lack of viable options these days

With "Architecture Components" Google finally presented their own solutions to some of the biggest problems Android developers face every day. This talk will give an introduction to these components and will show how they can be intregrated into a Kotlin based App.

speaker: Danny Preussler
title: Droidcon Berlin 2017
subject: The power of Kotlin for your tests
description:
If you use Kotlin in production or not, you should use it's power for your tests.

When it comes to extension functions, infix notation or possibilities for method names, Kotlin offers a lot that Java won't give you.

Combined with the powers of libraries like Kotlin Mockito or Kluent this brings testing to a new level.

speaker: Brandon Davis
title: Denver Android Developers Group
subject: Getting Started with Kotlin Basics
description: Google is now officially supporting Kotlin as a language for Android Development, but learning a new language can be intimidating! At this months meeting, Brandon Davis will teach you Kotlin in an interactive way, from setting up a project, to basic syntax, to ways of writing "beautiful" Kotlin code.

speaker: Dmitry Zaytsev
title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
subject: Algebraic Data Types
description: We'll talk about what algebraic data types are and how you can start using them today. We are not going to dive into any frameworks, so it does not matter whether you are a frontend or backend developer - it will be equally useful.

speaker: Leandro Sobocinski Castro
title: Kotlin Night Campinas 2017
subject: Grandes vantagens do Kotlin
description: Comparação do Kotlin com outras linguagens de programação, mostrando alguns recursos avançados

speaker: Jesper Holmberg
title: JavaZone 2017
subject: Kotlin - the new darling of open source frameworks
description: After an introduction to Kotlin in general, I will show how to use the Kotlin extensions in Spring Framework 5.0, and how to use Kotlin for writing Gradle build scripts.

speaker: Nevin Chen
title: MOPCON 2016
subject: Kotlin on Android development
description: Kotlin solves some issues in Java 6/7 on Android. Although java 8 is now partially supported, Kotlin still provides a lot of value when developing Android applications. In this talk I'll share my personal experience wirting my production app in Kotlin

speaker: Nevin Chen
title: JCCon 2016
subject: Redux for Android using Kotlin
description: Redux & Kotlin

speaker: Nevin Chen
title: JCCon 2015
subject: 菜鳥的 Kotlin on Android 之路
description: Kotlin Basics

speaker: Nevin Chen
title: GDG Taipei #26
subject: Single Activity and Kotlin
description:
1. Single Activity Android architecture.

2. Kotlin Basics

speaker: Tom Wadzinski
title: Jam Session
subject: Jam Session - Kotlin
description: DevJammer, Tom Wadzinski has been following Kotlin for several years and has created Spring Boot and Android applications using Kotlin. Tom will be giving a fast-paced talk on Kotlin with live code examples. He will demonstrate the productivity and code quality benefits of the language as well as the trade offs and how Kotlin compares to other languages such as Java, Groovy and Scala.

speaker: Svetlana Isakova
title: YOW! Night 2017 Sydney
subject: You Can Do Better With Kotlin
description:
Introduction to the language

Introduction to Kotlin Coroutines

Practical sides of Java interop

speaker: Ross Tuck
title: DomCode
subject: Derping Through Kotlin
description: I've been playing around in Kotlin and would like to share a basic overview of the language with you, as well as my experiences.

speaker: Matjaž Domen Pečan
title: Kotlin User Group Berlin
subject: Kotlin, Spring 5 and testing with Spek

speaker: Garth Gilmour
title: Belfast Java User Group
subject: Everything Right With Kotlin in 15 mins

speaker: Gustavo Lizárraga
title: Ciclo de Conferencias Codelabs y Talleres
subject: Kotlin para Desarrolladores Android (parte 1)
description:
Una de las noticias más llamativas que se han generado es la utilización de un nuevo lenguaje de programación que reemplazará al conocido Java. Su nombre es Kotlin y es la hora de conocer mucho más sobre esta innovación que puede ser muy positiva para los desarrolladores.

Los programadores que han trabajado en la plataforma oficial de desarrollo de apps de Google, Android Studio, ya están familiarizados con Kotlin por ser uno de los lenguajes de programación aceptados en ella. Ahora el reto será mucho más fácil porque deberán adaptarse a la nueva sintaxis que tendrá.

En esta charla se les dará una introducción teórica, beneficios y todo lo que se puede decir de este lenguaje para desarrollar aplicaciones Android.

speaker: Denis Nek
title: Singapore Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin syntax lecture
description:
Kotlin is the modern programming language that is now officially supported by Google for Android development.

It is our second workshop. We have learned a lot with previous one, refined lecture part, improved samples, removed server side concentrating only on Android development and tested all new updates of tools.

speaker: Denis Nek
title: Singapore Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin Android app concept lecture
description:
Kotlin is the modern programming language that is now officially supported by Google for Android development.

It is our second workshop. We have learned a lot with previous one, refined lecture part, improved samples, removed server side concentrating only on Android development and tested all new updates of tools.

speaker: Denis Nek
title: Singapore Kotlin User Group
subject: Creating the first screen of our Android app
description:
Kotlin is the modern programming language that is now officially supported by Google for Android development.

It is our second workshop. We have learned a lot with previous one, refined lecture part, improved samples, removed server side concentrating only on Android development and tested all new updates of tools.

speaker: Denis Nek
title: Singapore Kotlin User Group
subject: Advanced concepts of Kotlin for Android
description:
Kotlin is the modern programming language that is now officially supported by Google for Android development.

It is our second workshop. We have learned a lot with previous one, refined lecture part, improved samples, removed server side concentrating only on Android development and tested all new updates of tools.

speaker: Kim Boom
title: GDG Korea Campus
subject: 안드로이드에서 MVVM패턴을 Kotlin과 rxJava를 통해 구현해본다면!?

speaker: Colin Lee
title: Twin Cities Kotlin User Group
subject: You'll Never Believe How Kotlin Happened
description: Learn more about Kotlin and Android

speaker: Philipp Hauer
title: JUG Saxony Day
subject: Kotlin in Practice
description: Wir bei Spreadshirt haben begonnen, punktuell die JVM-Sprache Kotlin einzusetzen. Schnell stellte sich heraus, dass Kotlin Java deutlich überlegen ist. Kotlin vermeidet eine signifikante Menge an Boilerplate, verhindert gängige Fehler durch kluges Sprachdesign und ist obendrein auch noch besser lesbar. Zusätzlich ermutigen die Sprachkonstrukte den Entwickler zu einem besseren Softwaredesign. Interessant ist auch die Verwendung von etablierten Java-Frameworks (Vaadin, Spring Boot, Spring Data, Jackson, JAXB) mit Kotlin. Einerseits gibt es Situationen, in denen man von Kotlin besonders profitieren kann, andererseits gibt es aber auch Pitfalls zu beachten. In diesem Vortrag möchte ich euch Kotlin vorstellen und unsere gesammelte Praxiserfahrung teilen.

speaker: André Luiz Cardoso
title: Android DevConference 2017
subject: Kotlin after 9 months
description: In this talk I'll expose my experience using Kotlin for 9 months in a real Android project, I'll discuss the gains, the pains and show some tips that I've learned

speaker: Douglas Cabral
title: Android DevConference 2017
subject: Kotlin - Tips and Tricks para quem quer migrar do Java
description: Mostrar de maneira Hands-On como um APP era programado em Java e como pode ser em Kotlin, mostrando vantagens e desvantagens de cada uma das linguagens, além de apresentar as diversas maneiras de como fazer, saindo do simples comparativo entre Java e Kotlin para criação de variavéis, funções, etc e sim, na prática como fica o uso de Kotlin para componentes, layouts, testes, etc. A ideia é ser um "Deep Kotlin", voltado principalmente para quem quer migrar APPs de Java para Kotlin e não sabe por onde começar. Também entender e solucionar as principais dúvidas que ocorrem antes e após a migração, configurações necessárias, plugins e as extensões interessantes para complementar o desenvolvimento. Todos os exemplos serão criados de maneira prática para que o visitante possa se imaginar na situação.

speaker: Suelen Carvalho, David Robert Camargo de Campos
title: Android DevConference 2017
subject: Introdução ao Kotlin
description: Kotlin é agora a linguagem oficialmente suportada para Android. Esta palestra fornece uma introdução a linguagem, abrangendo conceitos básicos e dicas para os desenvolvedores.

speaker: Felipe Rodrigues
title: Android DevConference 2017
subject: Usando Delegations no Kotlin
description: Kotlin provê o Delegation pattern por padrão na linguagem, nessa apresentação aprenderemos o conceito de Delegation, o que é Delegation properties e como extrair todo o potencial dessa feature do Kotlin.

speaker: Arnaud Giuliani
title: DevFest Toulouse 2017
subject: Plus loin avec Kotlin
description: How to use Kotlin language for building better API & deeply understand important subjects

speaker: Abdellah SELASSI
title: Rabat Kotlin User Group
subject: RxKotlin will bend the knee
description:
Reactive programming has become a very basic tools that every developer (especially Mobile developers) must have in his arsenal.

In our #2 meetup there will be around 4 sessions; 20 minutes by session, with an optional Kotlin workshop.

Speakers level : Architect, Android Lead, Senior and Confirmed Android developer.

speaker: Svetlana Isakova
title: Mobile Era 2017
subject: Kotlin Coroutines
description:
The async/await feature allows you to write the asynchronous code in a straightforward way, without a long list of callbacks. Used in C# for quite a while already, it has proven to be extremely useful. In Kotlin 1.1 you have async and await as library functions implemented using coroutines.

A coroutine is a light-weight thread that can be suspended and resumed later. Very precise definition, but might be confusing at first. What ‘light-weight thread’ means? How does suspension work? This talk uncovers the magic.

We’ll discuss the concept of coroutines, the power of async/await, and how you can benefit from defining your asynchronous computations using suspend functions.

speaker: Kiyoshi Fujiwara
title: GDG神戸 Android Oreo with Kotlin&Android Studio 3.0
subject: 今すぐ始めるKotlinによるAndroidアプリ開発
description: これからKotlinでAndroid開発を始める方向けに、Kotlinの考え方、Kotlinの言語機能、Kotinの学習方法についてお話させて頂きます。

speaker: Tatsuya Konishi
title: Japan Kotlin User Group
subject: Convert Java File to Kotlin File

speaker: Antonio J. R.
title: GDG Innsbruck
subject: Flirting with Kotlin
description: Then, I would like to proceed with a technical talk about Kotlin. As many of you know, Google announced in this year I/O conference that the language will receive official support from the Google team.

speaker: Irvin Castellanos
title: Kotlin CDMX User Group
subject: Creando módulos multiplataforma con Kotlin
description: Kotlin es un lenguaje que no solo puede ser utilizado para crear aplicaciones Android, aprende cómo puede ser utilizado para crear módulos reutilizables en tus proyectos Java y Javascript.

speaker: Sebastián Téllez
title: Kotlin CDMX User Group
subject: Cómo ser un Lazy Developer
description: En esta plática se verán las ventajas que tiene Kotlin sobre Java a la hora de programar y evitar Boilerplate code innecesario, ademas de algunos tips y recomendaciones.

speaker: Juan Pablo Villegas
title: GDG Guatemala
subject: Kotlin y Android
description:
Kotlin ha ido ganando cada vez más popularidad. Como un lenguaje JVM es bastante fácil de aprender y más agradable de trabajar que Java.

Es por ello que Los invitamos a todos este dia Miércoles 23 Agosto a la reunión de la comunidad GDG Guatemala en Chamba Coworking. en esta ocasión nos estará compartiendo Juan Pablo Villegas sobre Kotlin y como podes hacer el manejo de base de datos con Kotlin.

speaker: Dan Kim
title: Android Summit Conference 2017
subject: Getting to 100% Kotlin: A Practical Guide
description:
Lots of teams want to go all-in with Kotlin but are just starting out. It’s exciting but also stressful—who knows what lies ahead on this long, windy road?

We’re here to help! At Basecamp we’ve worked hard to make our codebase 100% Kotlin over the course of the last year.

We’ll share our best strategies/tips based on that year of real-world shipping—how to get started, how to keep moving forward, and pitfalls to keep an eye out for.

speaker: Stuart Kent
title: Android Summit Conference 2017
subject: Kotlin & Swift: Convergent Evolution?
description: At Google I/O this year, the Android team announced first-class support for Kotlin! Kotlin is a modern and compact language that looks and feels very similar to Apple’s Swift. Both are rapidly rising in popularity. Once you’ve learned one of these two languages, the barriers to becoming a cross-platform (native) mobile developer are significantly reduced. Join me for a journey through the two languages, and leave inspired to learn one, then both, then to conquer the entire (mobile) world!

speaker: Aaron Sarazan
title: Android Summit Conference 2017
subject: Making a Real App with Kotlin & Room
description: Build a note-taking app using Kotlin and modern frameworks. Learn where the rough edges are and how to avoid them. You’ll also pick up some new tricks along the way!

speaker: Josh Skeen
title: Android Summit Conference 2017
subject: Pragmatic Kotlin on Android
description: In this talk we’ll understand how Kotlin isn’t just syntactic sugar, it’s a better way to build Android apps. We will start with a modern java-based Android project and walk through a complete migration to Kotlin. In the process, you will see objective examples of how the Android concepts you’re already familiar with are expressed in Kotlin. You will leave equipped to write your Android apps more accurately, with less code, and with far fewer chances for bugs!

speaker: Rene de Groot
title: GDG The Dutch Android User Group
subject: Everyday Kotlin
description: With domain languages, lamda's. coroutines, tail recursions, operator overloading and (weird) JVM-annotations Kotlin might seem overwhelming. So lets take a look at everyday Android development and how Kotlin helps you there. We take a look on how your knowledge of Java and Java best practises puts in an advantage when programming in Kotlin.

speaker: Serj Lotutovici
title: GDG The Dutch Android User Group
subject: Getting Schwifty: Functional Programming with Kotlin
description: Writing good software is hard, writing bug free software is next to impossible, but that doesn’t mean that we should never tend to that mythical abstract of `fun` and sustainable code. Add multithreading, state management and a pile of interconnected components to your system and you’ll find that functional programming is your best bet against the vicious spaghetti monster. So, let’s take off… our hats, and get schwifty with Kotlin.

speaker: Simon Vergauwen
title: GDG The Dutch Android User Group
subject: Sealing in the flavor with Kotlin
description: Kotlin brings sealed classes and functional programming paradigms to the table. A type safe design can do miracles for your codebase so let's take a look how we can model runtime errors in our type system and what advantages FP concepts offer.

speaker: Brandon Roberts
title: Kotlin South Florida Users Group
subject: A Look at Kotlin Through The Eyes of Android

speaker: Josh Skeen
title: Mobile Era 2017
subject: Pragmatic Kotlin on Android
description: In this talk we’ll understand how Kotlin isn’t just syntactic sugar, it’s a better way to build Android apps. We will start with a modern java-based Android project and walk through a complete migration to Kotlin. In the process, you will see objective examples of how the Android concepts you’re already familiar with are expressed in Kotlin. You will leave equipped to write your Android apps more accurately, with less code, and with far fewer chances for bugs!

description: Let’s explore how you can write better and less crashable apps with Kotlin while having fun developing them and fill the gap of missing modern language in Android. We will look at some cool features of Kotlin and how you can use them in Android.

title: Kotlin London User Group

Syntax highlights

Testing

ntegration with Maven and Jenkins

title: Kotlin Athens
subject: Kotlin Introduction
description: First session of the Kotlin meet-up in Athens Greece. It will be an opportunity to get to know fellow Kotlin developers, and present an introduction to the language.

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: NDC Sydney 2017
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a programming language developed by JetBrains that targets multiple platforms including the JVM, Android, JavaScript and native support in the works. The language provides object oriented as well as functional constructs and has been adopted by Google as an official language for Android Development, and being used by many well-known companies such as Gradle, Netflix, Basecamp, BBC, Pinterst and many others.

speaker: Nevin Chen
title: COSCUP 2017
subject: Kotlin idioms in Android
description:
1. Kotlin Basics(10)

2. Kotlin idioms(20)

3. Kotlin idoms in Android(20)

4.QA

speaker: Garth Gilmour
title: Cork Java User Group
subject: Kotlin as a Better Java
description: This talk will provide a complete overview of Kotlin. We will start with the core language but quickly move into real world tasks such as TDD with KotlinTest, writing RESTful services with Spring MVC and building Android clients. All the code will be provided so you can follow along as we go.

speaker: Atsheko Feki
title: Retty Tech Night 2017
subject: 「KotlinとReduxをAndroidアプリに導入して幸せになった話（仮）」

speaker: Guy Heylens
title: Belgian Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin Code Lab
description: This course will cover an introduction to Kotlin and after the course you'll be able to start working with the language and start adding it to your own codebases. If you already know the language, we'll also offer exciting and challenging content for you which will help improve your skills.

speaker: Mohit Sarveiya
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Functional Programming with Kotlin
description: Functional programming is in fashion today even though it has been around since the 1940s. We will look at the principles of functional programming and how they can applied with Kotlin. Functional programming has many techniques such as composition, currying and partial application. It also provides structures such as Monads. How do we apply these techniques and structures with Kotlin? Kotlin is not a purely functional language like Haskell. It is a multi-paradigm language. But, we will see how we could build reusable functional constructs in Kotlin that languages like Haskell provide. Even though Android and Backend apps are written following an OOP paradigm, you could still apply many of the techniques of functional programming to build consistent and testable applications.

speaker: Kevin Most
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Dependency Injection
description: Dependency Injection is a widely-adopted design pattern meant to decouple code and make it easier to reuse, compose, and test components. There are many popular dependency injection frameworks that work on the JVM, with the most popular at the moment being Guice and Dagger. We'll walk through these and other DI frameworks, such as Kodein, specifically designed to work well with Kotlin, analyzing their performance, readability, scalability, and ease of use.

speaker: Vasavi Vempati
title: Coder Consortium
subject: Kotlin for the Neophyte Android Developer
description: Come one and all to hear the soothing melodies of The Vasavi Vempati speak of using Kotlin for Android App development. As a neophyte herself with Android development, Vasavi will give a demonstration on how to get started with this amazing new(-ish) language that can be used for almost anything including Android development. Learn how Kotlin can give you a solid edge over the tired if true Java.

speaker: John Keyes
title: TechLife Columbus
subject: COJUG - Introduction to Kotlin
description: Kotlin is the newest contender in the programming language arena. It has all the modern language features you love, a refreshingly concise syntax, and it runs almost anywhere (JVM, Android, JS, Native). In this presentation, you’ll get a thorough introduction to the Kotlin syntax and features and see what makes it a language worth considering.

title: ironSource Mobile Guild

description: In this hands on lecture we'll see examples and cover the basics of Kotlin such as syntax, object oriented programming principles of design, and how to write simpler better faster code.

description:

I want to share some patterns, ideas and tips I have gathered since I started using Kotlin 2+ years ago. Things which will hopefully change the way you develop on Android.”

subject: Kotlin, Einführung und Überblick

Android O cambiará muchas cosas en los dispositivos inteligentes. Una de las noticias más llamativas que se han generado es la utilización de un nuevo lenguaje de programación que reemplazará al conocido Java. Su nombre es Kotlin y es la hora de conocer mucho más sobre esta innovación que puede ser muy positiva para los desarrolladores.

Los programadores que han trabajado en la plataforma oficial de desarrollo de apps de Google, Android Studio, ya están familiarizados con Kotlin por ser uno de los lenguajes de programación aceptados en ella. description: Many people ask why Kotlin is better than Scala, or sometimes claims the opposite. We will discuss all those extra features which are present in Scala but absent in Kotlin, and some more advantages of Kotlin. In this talk we will also recap some of the awesome features that makes Kotlin a great language to use.

Kotlin is an amazing language, now officially supported by Google for Android development. Kotlin makes code cleaner and expressive while maintaining complete Java interoperability.

However it is important to understand how it complies down to java/dex bytecode, and what precisely the Android runtime is seeing. We are going to explore and discuss tradeoffs and caveats, to make an effective app. If time permits we talk about java/dex bytecode tips and tricks :).

title: GDG Ekiti State University
subject: Kotlin Night Ekiti State University
description: Google announced official support for Kotlin and made it their first-class language for writing Android apps during I/O '17. And there is a lot more to Kotlin's magic, as JetBrains looks to make Kotlin the first choice for multi-platform development.

speaker: Alexandre Gherschon
title: Kotlin TLV
subject: Kotlin Workshop I
description:
There will be no presentations, just us sitting together to write some awesome Kotlin code.

To make it as much interesting as possible for each of us, we won't give a specific topic. This means you can start to write your new pet project, try for the first time the Kotlin Koans, or whatever you want to do in Kotlin.

speaker: Marcus Fihlon
title: JavaOne 2017
subject: Kotlin EE: Boost Your Productivity
description: Kotlin and Java EE are a perfect couple for writing microservices. Kotlin is a very pragmatic language—built on many concepts and techniques from Java—designed for developer productivity. The Java EE API enables us to code against a proven and stable API. Provided libraries decrease the need for additional third-party libraries, meaning a short build time and a small artifact size. Benefit from very fast build and test feedback, and stay focused on your code. Live on stage, this session’s speaker writes a service in Kotlin with a RESTful JSON API with only a few lines of code and runs the service, using a local Docker cloud. Coding, building, testing, deploying, scaling: fast and efficient!

speaker: Stuart Kent
title: Motor City CocoaHeads
subject: Android & iOS & Kotlin & Swift w/
description:
Android and iOS development tools have consistently converged over the past few years. The arrival of Kotlin as a second officially supported language for Android development is perhaps the most significant example of this to date.

Kotlin and Swift were designed independently but share many foundational principles. In this talk, I’ll compare and contrast these exciting languages and show you just how similar native Android and iOS development feel while using them. I’ll also touch briefly on some important changes in layout design tools that have further aided platform parity.

speaker: Takashi Kudo, Koichi Tanaka, Takeshi Sato
title: Kotlin読書勉強会
subject: Kotlinスタートブック読書勉強会 #3
description: Kotlinスタートブックの読書会を全n回開催する予定で、これが3回目です。 想定している参加者は、KotlinでAndroidアプリの開発を始めたい人、iOSアプリ開発の経験があるけどKotlinにも興味がある、サーバーサイドでKotlinを書いてみたい方を対象としています。 今回は「第5章 関数」の予定です。

speaker: Dimitar Ivanov

subject: Starting with Kotlin for Android

title: GDG Dnipro

subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: Even though this is an introduction, the demo app we create will showcase all sorts of cool Kotlin features. So even if you are a seasoned Kotlin developer you may learn some cool new things.

speaker: Joseph Banta
title: Nashville Mobile Developers User Group
subject: Kotlin on Android, with Sean Beach
description: The Kotlin programming language is now a "first class" language for the Android platform, supported in the primary IDE, Android Studio. Kotlin makes some things very easy, and some things are different -- in Kotlin, there are no raw types, arrays in Kotlin are invariant, and Kotlin does not have checked exceptions. The list of differences is actually vast, meaning that there will be a learning curve for developers migrating from other languages.

speaker: Jake Wharton
title: The London Android Group
subject: It's a Kotlin, Kotlin, Kotlin World
description: Kotlin's popularity has exploded in the past year and Google's announcement of first-party support at I/O means it's only going to keep increasing. Now is the perfect time to jump on the language as its future in mobile and beyond is very bright. This talk start with a short introduction to the language syntax and features and their benefits. We'll then cover its use in building Android apps, writing Gradle build scripts, and using in IDE/Gradle plugins. Finally we'll take a look at where the language is headed and see if it can deliver on a promise of cross-platform use.

speaker: Gustavo Lizárraga
title: GDG Android Bolivia
subject: Kotlin para Desarrolladores Android
description:
Android O cambiará muchas cosas en los dispositivos inteligentes. Una de las noticias más llamativas que se han generado es la utilización de un nuevo lenguaje de programación que reemplazará al conocido Java. Su nombre es Kotlin y es la hora de conocer mucho más sobre esta innovación que puede ser muy positiva para los desarrolladores.

Los programadores que han trabajado en la plataforma oficial de desarrollo de apps de Google, Android Studio, ya están familiarizados con Kotlin por ser uno de los lenguajes de programación aceptados en ella. Ahora el reto será mucho más fácil porque deberán adaptarse a la nueva sintaxis que tendrá.

speaker: Charles Muchen
title: GeekNight Kampala: July 2017
subject: Kotlin For Android Development
description:
Kotlin is a statically typed programming language for the JVM, Android, the browser and *native.

Developed by Jetbrains, officially supported for Android

Development and it’s 100% interoperable with Java.

For Android developers, Kotlin support is a chance to use a modern and powerful language, helping solve common headaches such as runtime exceptions and source code verbosity.

At the just ended Google I/O, the Android team announced first-class support for Kotlin

speaker: Ahmed Nabil Mahran
title: GDG Cairo
subject: Kotlin For Android
description: An intro about kotlin and a short workshop building Android app with Kotlin (Organized by Kotlin Egypt user group, GDG Cairo, and hosted by Mushtarak)

speaker: Deny Prasetyo, Muhammad Salis
title: GO-JEK & JVM User Group
subject: Our Journey with Kotlin
description: Did you know Kotlin is designed with Java Interoperability in mind? In fact, Kotlin can call existing Java code, and Kotlin code can be called from Java rather smoothly as well. In this edition of GO-TALK, Deny Prasetyo, Co-founder of the Kotlin.id Community & Backend Engineer at GO-JEK Indonesia, and Muhammad Salis, Product Engineer at GO-JEK Indonesia, will share their journey in adding Kotlin to the existing Java architecture, all the pain points, and what they found along the way. So don't miss it!

speaker: Nicolas Fränkel
title: JavaOne 2017
subject: Writing a DSL with Kotlin
description: Kotlin is one of those “new” JVM languages that are currently rocking the boat. Although it’s made a great impact on Android, it’s equally good on the server side. Domain-specific languages are constrained by the language they run on, but Kotlin frees developers from Java fluent builders to propose something better. Learn more in this session. Taking the example of a Vaadin UI DSL, I’ll demo how one could design its own DSL with Kotlin.

speaker: Walmyr Carvalho
title: The Developer Conference São Paulo 2017
subject: Kotlin: The "New" Kid On The Block!
description:
Kotlin está dominando o mundo! Após a linguagem ser anunciada como oficial para desenvolvimento Android pelo Google durante o Google I/O '17 muitos desenvolvedores ficaram curiosos com essa "nova" linguagem criada pela JetBrains. Mas na verdade o Kotlin não é tão novo assim, então porque o buzz só agora?

Nesse talk, vamos aprender como Kotlin pode te ajudar a ser mais produtivo, os benefícios dela comparada a outras linguagens JVM, como podemos começar a utilizá-la para desenvolvimento Android e web (ou até mesmo iOS no futuro) e porque empresas como Pinterest, Uber, Gradle, Evernote, Google, Trello 99, Nubank e muitas outras empresas já estão usando a linguagem em produção!

speaker: Roman Elizarov
title: SPTCC 2017
subject: Lock-Free Algorithms for Kotlin Coroutines
description:
Kotlin is a modern and pragmatic language, developed by JetBrains, that compiles to Java Virtual Machine (JVM). Kotlin 1.1 introduced coroutines for writing scalable asynchronous code. Basically, Kotlin coroutines are very light-weight threads, and millions of concurrent coroutines can be easily running, each coroutine occupying just a few dozen bytes of the heap when suspended. Because of the inherent scalability requirement, many concurrent data structures used in the coroutines, such as communication channels between coroutines, are expected to be lock-free and disjoint-access parallel, yet they have to be practical and readily implementable in the confines of JVM. This creates unique challenges for the design of the corresponding support libraries.

In this lecture we shall walk through the basics of lock-free doubly-linked lists by Sundell & Tsigas and multi-word compare-and-swap (CASN) by Harris - two practical lock-free constructions that serve as a backbone for many lock-free algorithms in Kotlin coroutines support libraries. We'll discuss challenges of designing linearisable implementations for complex data structures and how to extend CASN to support limited, but practically needed combinations of several operations on different data structures in the form of atomic transactions, without going into full-blow implementation of general-purpose software transactional memory.

speaker: Ryota Murohoshi, Akira Aratani, Taro Nagasawa
title: Japan Android Group
subject: 日本Androidの会 2017年7月定例会「Kotlin & Android Studio 3.0」
description:
Kotlinとはそもそも何か？概要と誕生の背景について

コードベースをスリムにするKotlinのGood Parts

バグの作り込みを防ぐKotlinのGood Parts

導入時の注意点

Kotlin界隈、コミュニティ、エバンジェリストの未来

Google I/O 2017で発表されたAndroid Studio 3.0の新機能を紹介します。また、Android Studio + KotlinでAndroidアプリをどのような感じで書いていくかをデモを交えて説明します。

Kotlinだからnullにまつわる問題は起きないと思っていませんか？Kotlinでも、書き方を間違えるとnull関連の問題が発生します。本セッションでは、最近Kotlinを始めた方をメインターゲットにプラットホーム型について説明し、Kotlinでのnullにまつわる落とし穴と気をつけるべきポイントを紹介します。

subject: Kotlin in Action - Actions on Google für das Google Home (api.ai, SpringBoot & Google Cloud)
