title: AlmeriaJS
subject: Kotlin JS, ¿Por qué conformarnos solo con TS, Dart, Coffeescript, JSX...?
description:
Kotlin es un lenguaje que inicialmente nació para sustituir a Java ofreciendo total compatibilidad con él a nivel binario, pero desde hace un tiempo también permite compilar nuestro código a Javascript y comunicarnos con las bibliotecas de este.

A diferencia de TS o Coffeescript, Kotlin no es un superset de Javascript, es un lenguaje totalmente nuevo, fuertemente tipado, con características de los últimos lenguajes y toques funcionales, y gracias a su versión JVM, podremos usar el mismo lenguaje en la cara del servidor (¿Spring Boot por ejemplo?)

speaker: Marco Ferrer
title: Kotlin South Florida User Group
subject: Kotlin + Raspberry Pi
description: Get ready for an awesome evening as we dive into Kotlin, the new programming language, and how we can use it in IoT, running on a Raspberry Pi!

speaker: Adam Magaña
title: Code Youngstown
subject: Say Goodbye to Java: Getting Started With Kotlin for Android
description: Adam Magaña will be giving a presentation on getting started with Kotlin for Android

speaker: Simon Wirtz
title: Java User Group Cologne
subject: Kotlin Introduction with Live Coding
description: I'll give a talk at the local JUG about kotlin compared to Java - will provide most important features in live coding session

speaker: Tiago Missão
title: Centro de Treinamento da Novatec
subject: Vantagens do Desenvolvimento Android com Kotlin
description: O objetivo desta palestra é introduzir o participante de maneira prática (partindo do simples “hello world” até o consumo de serviços externos) à nova linguagem em ascensão no mundo Android, Kotlin. Trazendo exemplos e demonstrações das vantagens que essa nova linguagem proporciona ao desenvolvedor, comparando estas com sua equivalência em Java

speaker: Ezequiel Zanetta
title: Android Devs Buenos Aires
subject: Kotlin workshop
description:
Sin dudas el Google I/O de este año nos sorprendió a todos con el anuncio de que Kotlin finalmente es aceptado como lenguaje oficial para el desarrollo de apps Android, con soporte oficial en Android Studio y apoyo de Google + Jetbrains para que siga creciendo.

Por eso les queremos contar que vamos a estar brindando un workshop sobre el mismo. La idea es aprender lo básico sobre el lenguaje, y como utilizarlo para desarrollar nuestras aplicaciones a partir de ahora.

Lo vamos a dividir en dos partes, en la primera vamos a jugar solamente con el lenguaje usando el IDE oficial del mismo, y luego como tarea principal vamos a desarrollar una app Android completa en Kotlin. La idea es que todos se lleven las bases del lenguaje para seguir aprendiendo y aplicándolo.

Los cupos van a ser limitados, ya que nos gustaría ir ayudándolos con las dudas que tengan. En caso de no poder venir, por favor liberar la reserva. Habrá posibilidad de repetir el workshop a futuro si vemos que hay muchos interesados en asistir.

Si ya estás usando Kotlin en tus aplicaciones, y querés participar como mentor del workshop, avisanos, sos bienvenido a colaborar :D

speaker: Alexander Hanschke
title: Java User Group Frankfurt‎
subject: Einführung in Kotlin
description:
Kotlin hat die Version 1.1 erreicht und bringt viele Neuerungen mit. Grund genug sich die Sprache im Detail anzuschauen.

Der Vortrag gibt einen Überblick über Kotlin und die wichtigsten Features. Er zeigt worauf beim Zusammenspiel mit Java zu achten ist und demonstriert den Einsatz auf Basis einer Spring Boot Anwendung.

speaker: MESDOUR Mohamed Nassim
title: GDG Tizi Ouzout‎
subject: Présentation du prochain langage de vos smartphones : Kotlin

speaker: Eric Maxwell
title: Columbus Kotlin User Group
subject: Pleasant Android Development w/ the Anko Library
description:
Anko is a Kotlin library which makes Android application development faster and easier. It makes your code clean and easy to read, and lets you forget about rough edges of the Android SDK for Java.

• Anko Commons

• Anko Layouts

• Anko SQLite

• Anko Coroutines

Then we'll take a deeper look at all the Anko Commons goodies that simplify Android Kotlin development with before and after code samples

speaker: Grzegorz Dyrda
title: JDD Сonference 2017
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: W swojej prezentacji postaram się Wam pokazać największe zalety świetnego (w mojej opinii) języka programowania, jakim jest Kotlin. Koduję w nim od ponad roku, i nie sposób przecenić jego czytelności, eleganckich rozwiązań największych problemów Javy, czy mnóstwa funkcji, których w Javie doczekamy się może za 5 lat… Jeśli dodać do tego fakt, że działa z Androidem out-of-the-box, oraz że zyskał oficjalne wsparcie w Springu 5.0, to robi się naprawdę ciekawie ;)

speaker: Akira Aratani
title: Cyber Agent
subject: Introduce Kotlin Coroutine
description: Kotlin歴は2年

speaker: Felipe Rodrigues
title: Android Meetup - Rio de Janeiro
subject: Usando Delegations no Kotlin
description: E nesse meetup vamos falar sobre Kotlin. O objetivo é engajar a comunidade carioca de desenvolvedores Android com talks, debates, coding dojos e muito networking. Se você é desenvolvedor, designer ou entusiasta de Android e quer conhecer a comunidade, vem pegar uns adesivos e conhecer a galera!

speaker: Peter Ho
title: Auckland Android Community
subject: Kotlin Tips and Tricks
description: Kotlin has taken the Android world by storm - who wouldn't want to learn some tips and tricks from a seasoned developer?

speaker: Pascal Welsch
title: Google Developers Group Dusseldorf
subject: Kotlin in production - one year later
description: Thanks to the community, Kotlin became the new language for Android Apps. Pascal Welsch is already using Kotlin for over an year in production and will talk about his learnings covering features and tools you should use and other which are too risky for a long term project.Thinking about adopting Kotlin in your project? Pascal shows the process of adopting Kotlin in all Android Apps at grandcentrix.

speaker: Dave Ford
title: South Bay JVM User Group
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description:
Kotlin is a super productive and practical language from JetBrains, the makers of IntelliJ. It compiles to JVM, Native and JavaScript. JetBrains is positioning it as a "Statically typed programming language for the JVM, Android and the browser".

I have already ported an entire back-end API from Java to Kotlin. This was the world's smoothest language transition. And now I am in the process of converting the JavaScript front-end to Kotlin.

In this presentation, I'll provide an introduction to Kotlin. I'll also share some of what I learned in porting a production Java/JavaScript app to Kotlin.

speaker: Ethan Brady
title: Twin Cities Kotlin User Group
subject: Using Kotlin for Android
description:
After a huge announcement at Google I/O this year, Kotlin has taken on much greater importance for Android developers. Kotlin is now the 3rd official language for programming on Android besides Java and C++ native development. As such, all Google documentation will have Kotlin examples, Android Studio has Kotlin baked in, and future API updates will no longer break Kotlin support.

Kotlin seems to be displacing Java at many companies and has the momentum to become the default language for Android. Our code shows Kotlin developers know how to produce a lot more "fun" than when writing in other languages, too. ;)

speaker: Brandon Wever
title: Columbus Kotlin User Group
subject: Be More Productive with Kotlin
description: People are excited about developing Android applications with Kotlin. From new side projects to existing enterprise level Java architectures, Kotlin can improve code quality and readability while reducing lines of code and eliminating entire classes of bugs. Find out why Kotlin is being used by developers at companies like Square, Trello, and Pintrest.

speaker: Lora Kulm
title: Austin Android Developers Meetup
subject: Kotlin Book Club
description:
Now that Kotlin is Google official, let's meet to discuss Kotlin for Android Developers!

Kotlin for Android Developers is an example-driven book that will teach you Kotlin as you develop an app. Join us to discuss examples found in the book, ask questions, and learn more about the language with your fellow developers.

For the first session, we'll cover the first 10 chapters. That is a pretty solid basis in what to expect from classes and properties of Kotlin, and will get to fetching data for your weather app.

speaker: Yury Camacho, Jorge Can
title: Google Developers Buenos Aires
subject: Kotlin & Firebase Functions
description:
Durante este meetup vamos a aprender sobre Kotlin, el nuevo lenguaje soportado para desarrollar aplicaciones Android de parte de Yury Camacho, experto en desarrollo de aplicaciones móviles.

Además, Jorge Cano nos va a mostrar cómo funciona y que podemos hacer con firebase functions para poder complementar Firebase sin requerir tener otro servidor.

speaker: Alexander Gherschon
title: My Heritage Hosts: Cross Technologies Challenges
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description:
A new language is on the horizon! Kotlin is the new hot subject, but what is it exactly? Why do we need a new language? In this talk, we will look at why do we indeed need a new language, especially Java developers.

We will look into the syntax differences with Java and learn about the new features and concepts the language brings to us.

speaker: Igor Korotenko
title: Kotlin TLV
subject: Android Production Development with Kotlin
description: We are thrilled to talk more about our favorite new programming language, Kotlin!

speaker: Andrei Tudor Diaconu
title: Google Developers Group Iasi
subject: Android Architecture and Kotlin
description: Google IO brought us Architecture Components and official support for Kotlin. Now that we had some time to play around with the new Architecture Components, we can discuss, exchange ideas, express opinions. The story with Kotlin is a bit different, as there are members of our comunity using it in tests or even production applications for some time. We will be discussing about this also.

speaker: Reto Kiefer
title: Kotlin Rhein-Main
subject: Ein Basic Web Framework mit Kotlin

speaker: Ryutaro Miyashita
title: Tech Talks Kotlin
subject: 開発 4 年目のアプリへの Kotlin 導入

speaker: Kazuya Kitahara
title: Tech Talks Kotlin
subject: 1年ぶりにやりなおすKotlinアプリ開発

speaker: Arthur Dremov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin: MAX PAYNE
description: Котлин даёт множество преимуществ, но мало кто знает о количестве боли, которую он периодически причиняет. Этот доклад — собрание неприятных особенностей языка и его инфраструктуры на основе двухлетнего опыта разработки исключительно на Котлине. Баги, фичи, производительность — затронем самые жесточайшие факторы и расскажем, как с этим живём мы

speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin Coroutines
description: Корутины которые появились в релизе 1.1 за флагом experimental и начинают использоваться в проектах, а у новичков возникает много вопросов что это, зачем и как пользоваться. Ответить на эти вопросы призван этот доклад. В докладе будет примеры использования корутин, обзор стандартной библиотеки, а также будет разобрано, как же корутины работают на самом низком уровне.

speaker: Alberto J Arias
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: Back end development with Spring Boot/Kotlin
description:
Are you looking for a great technology stack to build a rock-solid back end application?

Are you a front-end or mobile developer that wants to learn a little more about back end development and maybe create your own end-to-end application?

If the answer is yes to any of these question then you should come to this talk about back end development with Spring Boot and Kotlin.

Spring Boot is one of the most popular frameworks in the Java world and Kotlin is one of the most promising languages out there.

The Spring Boot and Kotlin stack is really pragmatic and effective and is based on a platform and framework that are proven, stable and offer great performance.

speaker: Peter John
title: Developer User Group
subject: Is Android Ready for Kotlin?
description: At Google I/O 17, Google announced that Kotlin will now be an official language for Android. This talks will be around how Kotlin can be used in android and if its a train android team should be jumping on.

speaker: Jacek Marchwicki
title: Android Developer Group Poznan
subject: Functional programming - what does it mean in Kotlin

speaker: Andrei Chernyshev
title: Kotlin User Group Berlin
subject: Code sharing between Kotlin and Kotlin-Native

speaker: Gyula Vörös
title: Kotlin Budapest User Group
subject: Idiomatic Kotlin TodoMVC
description: Learn how to implement a basic TodoMVC (http://todomvc.com/) web app in full stack Kotlin with native tooling: Gradle Kotlin DSL & Kotlin Frontend Plugin. We will mostly look at - and try to decipher - source code, so the talk will be tech-heavy. Though the tooling didn't reached 1.0, we'll try to give you an early taste of what it looks like to work on the web with Koltin.

speaker: Adam Arold
title: Kotlin Budapest User Group
subject: Idiomatic Kotlin TodoMVC for Java devs
description: This TodoMVC (http://todomvc.com/) web app variant is written in Kotlin but uses Java tooling. With this code-heavy example we'll explore how Kotlin interoperation features help you reuse your existing knowledge of Java frameworks while still letting you take advantage of Kotlin's expressive power. We'll also talk about some gotchas you might encounter on the way and their solutions.

speaker: Mark Heckler
title: GeeCON Prague 2017
subject: Springing into Kotlin: How to Make the Magic even more Magical
description: Developing applications with Spring Boot is already a pretty magical experience, but could it be better? Can the magic get any more powerful than it already is? In this talk, we'll look at how Kotlin can be used to reduce boilerplate, increase code quality, and elevate your wizardry. The presenter will demonstrate how to begin incorporating Kotlin into your existing Spring applications and, once you start your journey, where it can lead. Come to this session to level up on Spring+Kotlin! (Robes optional)

speaker: Dmitry Jemerov
title: Kotlin Night Berlin
subject: Idiomatic Kotlin
description: Getting started with Kotlin is easy - you can build upon your existing Java skills and write your code in the Java style. In this talk, you'll learn about the Kotlin language and standard library features that let you move to the next level and make your code more concise and expressive. Dmitry will also share some of the best practices for using Kotlin features that the JetBrains team has collected, and show how IntelliJ IDEA can automatically convert code into more idiomatic forms.

speaker: René Gröschke
title: Kotlin Night Berlin
subject: The Kotlin DSL experience in Gradle
description:
Since Gradle 3.0, a Kotlin based DSL that allows better tooling, type-safety, and unprecedented expressiveness, can be used to author Gradle build scripts.This comes with a richer IDE experience, with more precise content assist, quicker access to documentation, better source code navigation, refactoring and more when working on your build.

In this presentation you will learn how you and your team can start taking advantage of the Kotlin DSL in Gradle, the improved IDE support and the faster configuration times.

speaker: Eugenio Marletti
title: Kotlin Night Berlin
subject: Unleash the secret power of Kotlin Metadata
description: When compiling Kotlin code for the JVM, the resulting bytecode doesn't understand the advanced features of the language – like the difference between `List` and `MutableList`. These "metadata" are hidden, but not lost, and they're a gold mine when trying to create tools designed from the ground up with Kotlin in mind. Join us to learn where to find them, how they're structured and how we can make the most out of them.

speaker: Jumpei Yamamoto
title: 第6回Kotlin勉強会 ＠ Sansan
subject: みんな大好き拡張関数

speaker: Roberto Orgiu, Lorenzo Quiroli
title: GDG Torino
subject: Kotlin: a brief introduction
description: Kotlin e come usarlo al meglio

speaker: Łukasz Andrzejewski
title: Stacja IT Kraków
subject: Tworzenie aplikacji Android w języku Kotlin - szybki start
description: W czasie warsztatu prowadzący wraz z uczestnikami stworzy od podstaw aplikację wykorzystując język Kotlin - stworzony z myślą o programistach Java,, łatwy w użyciu i bezpieczny. Praktyczne podejście umożliwia szybkie przyswojenie nowych koncepcji i pozwala na pokazanie najważniejszych różnic, zarówno na poziomie samego języka jaki i sposobów rozwiązywania typowych problemów z codziennego życia. Dodatkowo pokażemy także wiele ciekawych bibliotek. Zajęcia będą miały formę czystego warsztatu dlatego zalecane jest, aby uczestnicy mieli doświadczenie w tworzeniu aplikacji na platformę Android oraz pracowali na komputerach wraz z prowadzącym.

speaker: Ira Galata
title: Yalantis Kotlin Meetup 4
subject: Using Kotlin features to create OpenGL shaders builder

speaker: David Vávra, Václav Souhrada
title: Czech Kotlin User Group
subject: Převod Android projektu z Javy
description:
Největší novinkou letošního Google I/O byla oficiální podpora pro Kotlin na Androidu. Všichni Android vývojáři teď řeší - mám začít svoje aplikace přepisovat do Kotlinu? Nebo ještě počkat? Má cenu jenom část aplikace mít v Kotlinu? Nebo je Kotlin pouze pro nové aplikace? Stojí to za to?

Přednáška bude obsahovat live coding část, kde budeme živě převádět sample aplikaci pro Android Architecture Components (druhá největší novinka pro Android vývojáře z I/O!) do Kotlinu.

speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
title: Kotlin Paris Meetup
subject: Why Spring ❤ Kotlin
description:
In this talk, I will explain why Spring ❤ Kotlin and how you can leverage Spring official support for Kotlin (in Framework [1], Boot, Data) to build your next Spring project more efficiently and with more pleasure

I will describe gradually how you can transform your Spring Boot 1.0 Java + Javascript project with into a Spring Boot 2.0 pure Kotlin project running on top of the new WebFlux functional web framework:- Step 1: Why Kotlin and how to use Kotlin instead of Java 8- Step 2: Upgrade to Spring Framework 5 and Spring Boot 2.0- Step 3: Switch from Spring MVC to WebFlux and Reactive APIs- Step 4: Use WebFlux functional API

speaker: Yury Camacho
title: GDG Lima
subject: Kotlin for Android Developers
description: A little introduction to Kotlin for android devs, that how helpfully is this language and how easy is adopt in our new projects

speaker: Hardik Trivedi, Akshay Chordiya
title: GDG Pune
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: This will be a series of complete step-by-step tutorials to walk you through how to accomplish different tasks in Kotlin, right from Getting Started to writing Android applications and more.

speaker: Victoria Gonda
title: 360|AnDev 2017
subject: Kotlin: Uncovered
description: Kotlin does a lot for us in the way of reducing boilerplate. But what is it really doing? We will be inspecting some decompiled Kotlin to discover how it does its job. By looking underneath at how it handles data classes, lambdas, and delegation, we can better understand how the language executes what we write. If you’re curious about the language, or already using it in production, you should walk away from this investigation with a deeper understanding of Kotlin, and some tools for continued exploration.

speaker: Svetlana Isakova
title: Droidcon Berlin 2017
subject: Kotlin Coroutines
description:
The async/await feature allows you to write the asynchronous code in a straightforward way, without a long list of callbacks. Used in C# for quite a while already, it has proven to be extremely useful. In Kotlin 1.1 you have async and await as library functions implemented using coroutines.

A coroutine is a light-weight thread that can be suspended and resumed later. Very precise definition, but might be confusing at first. What ‘light-weight thread’ means? How does suspension work? This talk uncovers the magic.

We’ll discuss the concept of coroutines, the power of async/await, and how you can benefit from defining your asynchronous computations using suspend functions.

speaker: Paulina Strychacz, Grzegorz Dec
title: Droidcon Berlin 2017
subject: Kotlinify your unit tests (and specs!)
description:
Kotlin is finally supported by Google as a first-class language. We’ll present tips on how to write readable unit tests utilizing Kotlin and already available libraries. Let’s check what benefits we can get from libraries like kotlintest and how it may speed up your work. We’re gonna tell you also how to apply Spek Framework to make your tests a live specification. You will be introduced to Expekt library, which can be also used for assertions. With our hints you can easily choose the best library to include in your projects.

Squeeze what's best from Kotlin libs making your tests maintainable and beautiful!

speaker: Josh Skeen
title: Droidcon London 2017
subject: Pragmatic Kotlin on Android
description:
In this talk Josh will share how Kotlin isn’t just syntactic sugar, it’s a better way to build Android apps. We will start with a modern java-based Android project and walk through a complete migration to Kotlin.

In the process, you will see objective examples of how the Android concepts you're already familiar with are expressed in Kotlin more accurately, with less code, and with far fewer chances for bugs!

speaker: Kai Koenig
title: Droidcon London 2017
subject: Kotlin Coroutines and Android sitting in a tree
description:
Since the release of Kotlin 1.1 there is now the new language feature of Kotlin Coroutines available for use in Java and Android projects. Coroutines are a new way to write asynchronous and non-blocking code. They can be thought of as light-weight threads without having to deal with all the problems that threads bring to the table.

A lot of developers think that Kotlin Coroutines are mainly or only useful for Kotlin on the JVM, but that’s not true. There are a variety of use cases in which the application of Coroutines can make a lot of sense on Android.

This talk is introducing the ideas behind Kotlin Coroutines, showing how to use them in Kotlin code for both the JVM and Android via the kotlinx-coroutines APIs and then exploring specific applications in Android. Part of this is a deeper look into the use of Coroutines in higher-level frameworks such as AsyncAwait and Anko.

speaker: Maria Neumayer, Amal Kakaiya
title: Droidcon London 2017
subject: Travelling across Asia - Our journey from Java to Kotlin
description:
Kotlin has established itself in the Android development community since v1.0 last year, and with official support announced at I/O this year, it’s an exciting time to get started with this language in your work.

This talk will take you through Deliveroo’s journey from a full Java codebase to using Kotlin across the project. Learn how to get your colleagues involved and convert them to Kotlin supporters. You will also learn how they got started, the problems they ran into and how Kotlin can improve your codebase, your app and your sanity.

speaker: Cesar Valiente
title: Mobiconf 2017
subject: Unidirectional data flow on Android using Kotlin
description:
Have you ever heard about unidirectional data flow? Flux and/or Redux?

In this talk, we will talk about how to follow the principles that architectures like Flux and Redux do on the web, but on Android.

What is a state? A dispatcher? Middleware? Reducer? How do we glue all these parts together? How to keep our domain isolated from the outer world so is easily testable? how do we can navigate through the app?

We will cover all these topics and much more!!, and you know what? everything with a bit of Kotlin sauce, so we will see how we can take advantage of the cool stuff this language provide us to make our architecture even better.

speaker: Alexander Smirnov
title: Apps Conf 2017
subject: Kotlin Performance on Android
description:
В докладе рассмотрим цену использования Kotlin в Runtime, обсудим варианты, как улучшить картину мира. Смотреть будем с точки зрения производительности, синхронно углубляясь в особенности Android, а также подумаем, как можно использовать получившийся байткод.

В докладе срыв подкапотных оптимизаций, байткод и цифры, которые покажут, насколько сильно вам смогут помочь все указанные оптимизации.

speaker: Supriya Srivatsa
title: Fragments 2017
subject: Hello Kotlin!
description: Kotlin has several amazing features and is uniquely poised to significantly simplify android app development. We shall look at one feature at a time, implement it in code and understand the various Kotlin-specific behaviours, while at the same time creating an android application, built completely with Kotlin. After all, there is no better way to understand the (Kotlin) magic, than working on it hands on.

speaker: Akshay Chordiya
title: Fragments 2017
subject: Kotlin-ize your Android Development
description: Let’s explore how you can write better and less crashable apps with Kotlin while having fun developing them and fill the gap of missing modern language in Android. We will look at some cool features of Kotlin and how you can use them in Android.

speaker: Victoria Gonda
title: Fragments 2017
subject: Kotlin: Uncovered
description: Kotlin does a lot for us in the way of reducing boilerplate. But what is it really doing? We will be inspecting some decompiled Kotlin to discover how it does its job. By looking underneath at how it handles data classes, lambdas, and delegation, we can better understand how the language executes what we write. If you’re curious about the language, or already using it in production, you should walk away from this investigation with a deeper understanding of Kotlin, and some tools for continued exploration.

speaker: Vatsal Bajpai
title: Fragments 2017
subject: Developing Android apps with Kotlin
description: Learning to develop Android application using the Kotlin language and understanding how it can help achieve faster and concise development over Java. Kotlin has been there for couple of years but recently it was announced as an official language for Android development in Google I/O 17.

speaker: Khun Zohn
title: GDG Yangon
subject: The benefits and challenges of using Kotlin

speaker: Armando Picón
title: Kotlin CDMX User Group
subject: Workshop "Crea tu aplicación Android + Firebase, con Kotlin"
description: En este taller pondremos en práctica varios conceptos vistos durante los meetups por medio de la creación de una aplicación empleando Android y Firebase.

speaker: Thomas Girard
title: Montpellier Android User Group
subject: Android - Faire une app Kotlin en deux heures
description: Nous allons tester un mode un peu particulier puisque l’on va essayer de faire un projet from scratch avec toutes les personnes présentes.

speaker: Dmitry Kostyrev
title: Avito Android meetup
subject: Kotlin - coroutines
description: В докладе рассматривается горячая экспериментальная функция Kotlin - coroutines. Разберемся, как одно ключевое слово в языке может открыть столько возможностей для разработчиков, немного посмотрим на устройство стандартной библиотеки kotlinx.coroutines. В докладе будут примеры использования coroutines c RxJava 2 и Android.

speaker: Eugenio Marletti
title: MobileOptimized 2017
subject: Kotlin: More Than An Island
description:
The last Google I/O was probably the most exciting ever, especially for one reason: Kotlin received official recognition as a first-class citizen on Android.

The quantity of developers cheering for this shouldn't come as a surprise, as some of them have already been using the language for years, and for good reasons. Join us to understand what Kotlin really is, and witness how its principles and advanced features make it so unique today, plus what will make it transcend into something even more powerful in the future.

speaker: Nelson Glauber
title: GDG Recife
subject: Turbinando o desenvolvimento Android com Kotlin
description: Nesse Meetup iremos comentar todas as novidades que o Google I/O trouxe esse ano. Entenda que história é essa do Kotlin ser nativo no Android agora e como fazer Instante Apps. E, afinal, o que é o O do Android O?

speaker: Željko Trogrlić
title: Kotlin User Group Croatia
subject: Kotlin – Čemu?
description: Jezik proizvođača ponajboljih programerskih alata pragmatična je mješavina Groovya i Scale koja se izvrsno integrira s postojećim Java kodom. Sažet, siguran, svestran i uskladiv, Kotlin je zavladao je Android developmentom, zamijenit će Groovy u Gradleu, a Spring je u najkraćem roku dodao podršku. Saznajte zašto.

speaker: Yannick Lemin
title: Kotlin Belgium User Group
subject: First steps in Kotlin on Android.

speaker: Damien Bravin

subject: Designing a DSL in Kotlin
description: Kotlin is one of those “new” JVM languages that are currently rocking the boat. Although it’s made a great impact on Android, it’s equally good on the server side. As Domain-Specific Languages are constrained by the language they run on, Kotlin frees developers from Java fluent builders to propose something better. Taking the example of a Vaadin UI DSL, I’ll demo how one could design its own DSL with Kotlin."

- с какими подводными камнями столкнулись при миграции на Kotlin в коммерческом Android-проекте.

title: Granada Geek

speaker: Pascal Lombard
title: Finist JUG
subject: Kotlin pour les développeurs Java
description:
Dans l’écosystème Java, l’extrême verbosité est considérée comme un crime particulièrement grave. Sur la JVM, un langage qui enquête sur ce crime fait maintenant partie d’une unité d’élite, appelée Langages Officiellement Supportés sur Android. Il s’appelle Kotlin. Voici son histoire. (TU-DUM)

Nous passerons en revue les principales qualités (et défauts) de Kotlin, auréolé de sa nouvelle popularité, mais surtout nous tenterons de donner une nouvelle jeunesse à une application moins moderne, sans pour autant devoir casser ce qui fonctionne.

Comparaison avec les autres langages du club JVM, idiomes, patrons de développement et intégration dans les forges classiques, un épisode palpitant nous attend ! (spoiler : ça finit bien)

speaker: Yuya Sat
title: Yochi Yochi Kotlin

description:
Kotlin & Androidの初学者を中心に助け合いながらもくもくする会です。

2週に1回くらいのペースで運用予定です。

サポーターの方も大歓迎です。

基本はもくもく会ですが、ネタがあればLTなども受け付けます。 (事前にコメントをお願いします)

speaker: Yury Camacho
title: GDG Cochabamba
subject: Kotlin: the force awakens
description: Kotlin se anuncio de manea oficial en el pasado Google IO y a partir de ese momento Kotlin empezó a sonar con mas fuerza, y es necesario mostrar todas las bondades del lenguaje y de que manera nos ayudara a los programadores android a mejorar nuestra experiencia en el desarrollo de nuestras aplicaciones

speaker: Toshihiro Yagi
title: Rx Java
subject: Androidの非同期処理をKotlinコルーチンで行う

speaker: Andy Bowes, Michael Richardson
title: The JVM Thing!
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description:
An overview of the Kotlin Language to demonstrate the key features of the language.

This session provides an introduction to the language, covering basic concepts and tips for Java developers to get started with it.

speaker: Andy Bowes, Michael Richardson
title: The JVM Thing!
subject: Kotlin Microservices
description:
Demonstration of use of Kotlin to create REST Microservices using Spring Boot.

This will cover the similarity between Kotlin & Java Spring Boot applications & introduce the new features that are being introduced into the Spring framework to support Kotlin.

speaker: Andy Bowes, Michael Richardson
title: The JVM Thing!
subject: Kotlin Android Applications
description:
Google recently announced first-class support for Kotlin in Android development.

This session will demonstrate the creation of Android applications using Kotlin and highlight the features of the language which make it a natural fit for Android development.

speaker: Joel Humberto Gómez Paredes
title: GDG Monterrey
subject: Novedades del Google IO 2017 e introducción a Kotlin
description: Vamos a hablar sobre las novedades que nos trajo Google en el IO 2017, Android, Actions on Google, Kotlin, etc.

speaker: Roman Elizarov
title: Mosdroid The Moscow Android Group
subject: «Корутины в Kotlin»
description:
Современные мобильные приложения в реальном времени работают с серверами, одновременно обслуживающими тысячи пользователей, и при этом интегрируются с дюжинами микросервисов. На смену монолитным приложения, созданным с использованием потоков, приходят программы, написанных в асинхронных стилях с помощью callbacks, future/promise, реактивных потоков и корутин.

Kotlin — это современный и прагматичный язык для Java Virtual Machine, который был разработан в компании JetBrains с большим упором на совместимость с Java. Благодаря этому любой стиль асинхронного программирования, доступный на Java, также может быть использован и в Kotlin. Можно даже использовать реализации корутин для JVM, которые изменяют байткод, такие как Quasar и JavaFlow. Так зачем тогда Kotlin добавил поддержку корутин прямо в язык и чем они отличаются от generate/yield и async/awаit в таких языках, как C# и Python? Что отличает корутины в Kotlin от потоков?

В своём докладе я постараюсь ответить на все эти вопросы. Мы на примерах разберём, как запускать и дожидаться завершения корутин и что такое suspend fun. А ещё научимся преобразовывать асинхронные библиотеки в корутины — чтобы лапша из callbacks и замыканий превращалась в понятный код, который выглядит так, как будто бы он выполняется синхронно и последовательно.

speaker: Thiago Cortat
title: Android Meetup - Rio de Janeiro
subject: Kotlin
description: E nesse meetup vamos falar sobre Kotlin e Charles Proxy. O objetivo é engajar a comunidade carioca de desenvolvedores Android com talks, debates, coding dojos e muito networking. Se você é desenvolvedor, designer ou entusiasta de Android e quer conhecer a comunidade, vem pegar uns adesivos e conhecer a galera!

speaker: Eyitayo Alimi
title: Lagos Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin for Android 101
description: This talk will introduce attendee to what they could achieve with Kotlin for Android and also how they can start using it. There will also be a Kotlin help desk to solve the challenges faced with Kotlin for Android.

speaker: Inaki Villar
title: GDG Cebu
subject: Kotlin is here
description: Kotlin is the new language for the Android World. Learn about the basics of Kotlin and see how can increase your productivity with Kotlin

speaker: Taro Nagasawa
title: Droid girls
subject: 何らかの言語によるプログラミング経験者

speaker: Cameron Jordan
title: The Sonora Software Developers Group
subject: Mobile Matters: Android Development with Kotlin
description: An introduction to Android development using Kotlin in Android Studio. We'll go through the basic concepts in native Android app development and take you through a working demo of a simple Android application. We'll use Kotlin to build on what we learned in Hands on with Kotlin and showcase a few of the advantages that Kotlin has over Java for native Android development.

speaker: Ivan Lugo
title: Central Florida Android Developers Group
subject: Kotlin, Kotlin, Kotlin.
description: We're all thinking and talking about it, and some of us are even convincing our team leads to start using it. But why Kotlin? What kind of benefits does the language really offer? This will be a brief overview of some of the more simple but highly usable grammatic and syntactic changes that come with Kotlin - type nullability, lambas, extensions, and beyond - that you can easily sink your teeth into to get going. We'll step through some very basic side-by-side examples of Java - vs - Kotlin (from at least one developer's perspective) to get a taste of the language, and how to start your own process of translating between the two.

speaker: Jake Wharton
title: Gradle Summit 2017
subject: A Builder's Intro to Kotlin
description:
Kotlin's popularity has been exploding in the past year. From last year's announcement that Gradle would support it as a build language, to its adoption on large platforms like Android and Spring, to its general applicability for writing IDE and build system plugins, it's hard to find an area that isn't adopting the language in some form.

This talk will be an introduction to the language in the context of Gradle. After covering the language syntax and features and their benefits, we'll look at why it's great for authoring Gradle plugins. Finally, we'll set the stage for Gradle's Kotlin build script support for which there are other full talks at the conference.

speaker: Nadav Cohen, Rodrigo B. de Oliveira
title: Gradle Summit 2017
subject: Powering-up your builds with Kotlin
description:
Gradle now supports a Kotlin-based DSL that allows for better tooling, type-safety, and unprecedented expressiveness. What problems does Gradle Script Kotlin solve? How would you convert existing code to Kotlin? And how would it interact with Groovy in the process?

In this live coding session, we will walk through several Groovy-based build examples and convert them to Kotlin. In this process, we'll uncover a few interesting language features and demonstrate how your builds can leverage them to take your builds to the next level.

speaker: Gevik Valijani, Steven Berard
title: Santa Monica Android Developers
subject: NFC and Getting Started with Kotlin
description:
Gevik will show off what he's learned about reading and writing to NFC chips in an Android app.

Steven will show us all how we can get started with Kotlin in our current projects.

speaker: Somasundaram Mahesh
title: Geek Night Chennai
subject: Kotlin for Android
description: Kotlin will be now shipped with Android Studio working out of the box, starting with version 3.0. No extra installations needed. No more incompatible plugins. All thanks to close collaboration between JetBrains and Google.Let's see how to get started with Kotlin.

speaker: Robert Chrzanowski, Ben Earley
title: GDG Hampton Roads
subject: Kotlin: From Zero to Hero
description: Come learn the cool new programming language, Kotlin. Google now officially supports Android development using Kotlin. We will be going through the Kotlin Koans exercises with help from professional Kotlin programmer Robert Chrzanowski and Ben Earley.

speaker: Roberto Orgiu, Lorenzo Quiroli
title: GDG Torino
subject: Kotlin: why you should love it
description: This is an introductory talk about Kotlin, where we explain the features of the language, we suggest readings, videos and tools that will help you learning this amazing new language.

speaker: José Yoshiriro
title: Virada Tecnológica São Paulo - 2017
subject: Introdução à Kotlin, a Nova Linguagem Oficial para Android
description: Nesta palestra serão apresentadas as principais novidades que a Kotlin traz. Um pequeno projeto Android criado em Kotlin será comparado com o "mesmo", criado em Java.

speaker: Saúl Buentello Sánchez
title: Kotlin CDMX User Group
subject: "Kotlin + Fingerprint" y "Kotlin Tricks"
description:
En esta ocasión tendremos la participación de Daniel Olvera, senior Android Developer, trabajando actualmente para Master Card en New York, quien nos compartirá acerca de Kotlin + Fingerprint para validar a los usuarios y dar accesos, así como para hacer pagos, o cualquier implementación para validar la identidad del usuario.

También tenemos confirmada charla, por parte de Ángel Gladín, miembro del Google Developer Group UNAM y Desarrollador Android. Nos platicará acerca de lo que llama "Kotlin Tricks", puntualizando características y prácticas del lenguaje que, sobre todo para quienes van comenzando, serán de mucha ayuda.

speaker: Hardik Trivedi, Akshay Chordiya
title: GDG Pune
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: This will be a series of complete step-by-step tutorials to walk you through how to accomplish different tasks in Kotlin, right from Getting Started to writing Android applications and more.

speaker: Shadaï Ali
title: Kotlin Meetup Cotonou
subject: Découvrir comment kotlin peut améliorer la productivité des dévéloppeurs android

speaker: Shubham Verma
title: Meetup at Daffodil Software
subject: Kotlin: Full day workshop on 1st July 2017.
description: Kotlin, the new programming language by JetBrains has taken the app development landscape by a storm. As a JVM language it is fairly easy to learn and a fun to work upon with some really helpful features like null-safe types. Today, Kotlin is an ideal option for developing large, complicated and performance-critical applications.

speaker: Qiu Weiming
title: GDG Nanning
subject: 主题：Android-kotlin的优劣
description: 在2017的Google I/O大会上kotlin得到了官方的正式支持。这不单单意味着以后我们编写Android 程序多了一个选择，同时kotlin简洁的语法可以极大的提高我们的开发效率。kotlin 可以100％与java兼容，此外kotlin还具备各种现代编程语言的特性:空类型、函数式编程、拓展函数等，然而静态代码分析工具的缺乏以及推广度低也严重阻碍着kotlin前进的步伐。

speaker: Jussi Hallila

description: Can you imagine a better way to celebrate American independence day than talking about Russian built programming language? Let's get this show on the road and start building a community around Kotlin.

speaker: Taro Nagasawa
title: 【G's Premiere】 Kotlinスタート講座 ～新しいAndroidプログラミング～
subject: KotlinでAndroidアプリ完成！！

title: 日本Androidの会浜松支部 第74回ミーティング #jaghama
subject: Kotlinの開発環境構築

subject: Kotlin概要説明＆Hello, Kotlin!

speaker: Denis Nek
title: Kotlin Singapore User Group
subject: Kotlin Introduction Workshop
description:
Kotlin is the modern programming language that is now officially supported by Google for Android development. And it also good for web and backend developers too.

Kotlin syntax

Kotlin first application

Hands-on: let’s build our first console application with Kotlin

Hands-on: let’s build our first Android application with Kotlin

speaker: Bruno Silva
title: GDG São Paulo
subject: Kotlin na prática: problemas e soluções encontrados durante o desenvolvimento de um app usando kotlin

speaker: Alberto Alonso Ruibal
title: JUG Vigo
subject: Kotlin, o Java para o século XXI
description:
O anuncio do Google I/O ven avalar aos moitos desenvolvedores e empresas que xa confiaban en Kotlin como a súa linguaxe principal para Android.

Pero Kotlin vai moito máis alá de Android: é unha linguaxe da JVM 100% interoperable con Java que tamén pode transpilar a Javascript, compilar a nativo e incluso ser usada en scripts.

Nesta charla discutiremos as características de Kotlin, irmá pequena de Scala, que fan dela unha linguaxe funcional moderna, segura, concisa e productiva, amosando un exemplo de cómo se migrou un código Java existente a Kotlin (o Carballo Chess Engine).

speaker: Ani Fichadia
title: Melbourne Java & JVM Users Group
subject: Kotlin Crash Course
description:
Kotlin has been around on the JVM for a number of years now, and has recently spiked in popularity thanks to Google officially adopting it as a supported language in Android. It features modern language constructs that would be familiar to Scala and Groovy developers and maintains excellent interoperability with existing Java code.

Aniruddh, our Android developer in residence and MelbJVM co-organiser will deliver a jam packed, crash course to Kotlin for Java Developers.

f you missed when we first covered Kotlin a few years ago, would just like a refresher, or have used it yourself and want to share experiences, you'll find this an interesting talk.

speaker: Brad Herrup
title: Joy of Programming DC
subject: The Joy of Haskell and Kotlin!

speaker: Darren Atherton
title: GDG Leeds
subject: Kotlin for Java Developers
description: This month we will have a roundup of all the big things (and maybe the little things you might have missed) announced at IO followed by a talk on the hot, new (old for some!) language for Android, Kotlin, by Darren Atherton.

speaker: Ivan Kocijan
title: Infinum Android Talks Zagreb
subject: Kotlin - do more with less code
description: Google recently announced Kotlin as an official programming language on Android and you might wonder, why is this such a big deal? This talk will show you why everyone is excited and how you can do a lot more with less code if you switch from Java to Kotlin.

speaker: Didier Plaindoux and Emmanuel Vinas
title: GDG Toulouse
subject: De Java à Swift ou Kotlin
description: Java est un langage qui a fait ses preuves depuis pas mal d'année et de ce fait de nombreux développeurs connaissent ce langage. On verra lors de cette présentation comment passer du langage java à Kotlin ou Swift. Ca nous permettra également de voir que ces deux nouveaux langages ne sont pas si éloignés.

speaker: Arnaud Giuliani and Laurent Baresse
title: GDG Toulouse
subject: Migration d’une application Android de Java vers Kotlin en live coding
description:
Nous allons partir d’une application Android Météo écrite en Java.

Au fil de la session, nous allons la migrer pas à pas de Java vers Kotlin afin de démontrer par l’exemple et progressivement le pouvoir d’expression de Kotlin pour les développeurs Android.

speaker: Kim Oath
title: AnDevCon DC 2017
subject: Kotlin and Android: Better Together
description: At Google I/O 2017, the Android team announced official support for Kotlin as a "first-class" programming language on Android. Kotlin is developed by JetBrains, and compiles to JVM bytecode. Kotlin has many characteristics that make it very compelling for use in Android app development, including Interoperability with Java, conciseness, Null Safety, Extension Methods, relatively small size and method count, top notch support in Android Studio, and many others. This tutorial not only introduces Kotlin, but also illustrates the basic use of Kotlin with other popular Android libraries such as Dagger 2, Retrofit 2 and RxJava/RxAndroid.

speaker: Houssan A. Hijazi
title: GDG Maringá
subject: Kotlin, a nova linguagem oficial do Android
description: Vamos falar sobre Kotlin, que há alguns dias, no Google IO 2017 foi divulgada como a linguagem oficial para Android. O objetivo é mostrar algumas características da linguagem e como aplica-las no desenvolvimento Android.

speaker: Jinu Rajendran
title: GDG Kozhikode
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description:
Updates from Google IO 2017.Introduction to Kotlin.How to create human centric web experience.Know each other, build professional connections. Lunch and Networking. Swags.

How to create human centric web experience byRadhakrishnan K G Founder , CEO , Webnamaste Consulting Pvt Ltd.Inbound Marketing Expert.

Hands on introduction to Kotlin, Statically typed programming language for modern multiplatform applications byAjith V , App Developer SoftFruit Solutions.

speaker: Zhu Xiangdong
title: GDG Beijing
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: 朱向东同学是知乎的工程师，他说他是『非著名 Android 开发者』，这次他将给我们做 Kotlin 的语言简介，以及语言特性演示。

speaker: Adam Erb
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: Video games with LibGDX and Kotlin
description: LibGDX is an open-source cross platform game development framework written for the JVM. It features a complete toolset for simple game development, garbage collection friendly implementation, and a broad community. I've been experimentally working on a libGDX/Kotlin project and would like to demo my code and progress.For my talk I'll like to give a brief overview of libGDX, how it interacts with Kotlin, and show the parts where I feel Kotlin is especially beneficial.

speaker: Evgeny Kovalev
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin in Action
description: Доклад ориентирован на разработчиков, которые уже знакомы с синтаксисом языка, но до сих пор не пробовали писать реальный код на нем. Евгений расскажет о преимуществах от перехода на Котлин, поделится собственным опытом миграции проекта с джавы с примерами из кода, а также расскажет, как убедить своих коллег и заказчиков на проекте перейти на новый язык.

speaker: Alexander Salnikov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: DSL in Kotlin
description: Александр рассмотрит особенности языка, которые позволяют написать DSL на Kotlin. А также, напишет свой DSL, который облегчит подготовку данных для тестов.

speaker: Gustavo Lizárraga
title: GDG Cochabamba
subject: MI primera vez con Kotlin para Android
description:
La llegada de Android O ha cambiado muchas cosas en los dispositivos inteligentes. Una de las noticias más llamativas que se han generado es la utilización de un nuevo lenguaje de programación que reemplazará al conocido Java. Su nombre es Kotlin y es la hora de conocer mucho más sobre esta innovación que puede ser muy positiva para los desarrolladores.

Los programadores que han trabajado en la plataforma oficial de desarrollo de apps de Google, Android Studio, ya están familiarizados con Kotlin por ser uno de los lenguajes de programación aceptados en ella. Ahora el reto será mucho más fácil porque deberán adaptarse a la nueva sintaxis que tendrá. En este CodeLab haremos desde una aplicación básica en Android con Kotlin hasta una un poco mas elaborada."

speaker: Yannick Lemin
title: Kotlin Belgium User Group
subject: First steps in Kotlin on Android
description: First steps in Kotlin on Android and Improve code maintainability by using Kotlin.

speaker: Damien Bravin
title: Kotlin Belgium User Group
subject: Improve code maintainability by using Kotlin

speaker: Jeroen Tietema
title: Kotlin Night Sydney
subject: A 100% Kotlin on Android
description: In this talk we will look at the lessons learned from writing an Android app completely in Kotlin. We will look at the advantages and disadvantages of using Kotlin and how it plays with other technologies used, like RxJava & Realm.

speaker: Sergey Tselovalnikov
title: Kotlin Night Sydney
subject: Fantastic DSLs and where to find them
description: Kotlin is a very rich language. Unlike many other languages, it allows building another language inside itself. For example, mimic HTML syntax or construct completely typed SQL query. But Kotlin’s power isn’t limited to simple DSLs. With some Kotlin-fu, it’s possible to write a DSL that allows working on untyped data structures in a typed manner. In this talk, we’ll go through different ways to define a DSL in Kotlin, from very simple to fantastically powerful.

speaker: Ander MacArthur
title: Kotlin Night Sydney
subject: Google I/O summary
description: We all heard what happened at Google I/O this year... You haven't? This talk will bring you up to speed and give a summary of all the Kotlin happenings at the conference.

speaker: Tomasz Kleszczyński
title: Zielona Góra JUG
subject: Kotlin for Java developers
description:
- What are the major advantages / features Kotlin provides?

- Why should someone move from Java to Kotlin?

- What is the future direction of Kotlin?

speaker: Pavel Sikun
title: GDG Kyiv-Center
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: Павло Сікун проведе вступ до Kotlin, покаже як використовувати переваги цієї мови та розкаже про two-way Java bindings.

speaker: Mikhail Goryunov
title: GDG St. Petersburg
subject: Efficient Kotlin
description: Доклад будет про языковые конструкции и методы stdlib'ы и их оверхед на рантайм. Поделюсь советами о том, что нужно делать, чтобы минимизировать этот самый оверхед.

speaker: Ruslan Zakharov
title: GDG St. Petersburg
subject: Safe and sound code with Kotlin
description:
Java достаточно безопасный язык программирования с точки зрения управления памятью и типов. Но с переходом на Kotlin мы можем программировать ещё более безопасно благодаря некоторым фичам языка, недоступных в Java.

Это означает больше времени на бизнес-логику, меньше на велосипеды. И да, с этими фичами некоторые unit-тесты вам больше не понадобятся.

speaker: Walmyr Carvalho, Rodrigo Sicarelli
title: Android Meetup São Paulo
subject: Refatorando com Kotlin
description: O talk foi feito junto com o Rodrigo Sicarelli, mostrando como refatorar seu projeto pra utilizar Kotlin

speaker: Bob Dahlberg
title: Stockholm Android
subject: Adding Kotlin to the Android Blend
description: Even before Kotlin 1.0 was released I had apps on play store with classes written in Kotlin. Just after the release I got my team convinced to use kotlin along side with java on out main application. And it's a big application so there was not an option to re-write it all at ones. I will talk about the bits that worked great, the ones that were troublesome and what just don't work.

speaker: Abdellah SELASSI
title: Rabat Kotlin User Group
subject: First Rabat Kotlin Meetup ! Kotlin : The Wisdom Language
description:
Firstly I will begin with the motivation part & companies who use Kotlin

What is Kotlin ?

Why JetBrains do create Kotlin ?

The Kotlin Language

Kotlin by example

title: Kotlin user group Berlin

On the other hand, you’re still using Java, with all its ceremony regarding code… Wouldn’t it be great if we could pair Spring Boot with a powerful yet simple language?

In this talk, I’ll live code a Spring Boot application using Kotlin, the friendly language provided by JetBrains. Come discover how you can now cut through all the boilerplate and finally focus only the important code – the business code

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: GOTO Conference 2017
subject: Kotlin - Ready for Production
description:
Did you know that Kotlin is being used in production for over a few years now already? Both inside and outside of JetBrains there are people deploying Kotlin applications for Android platform, for Web Applications and just about any other type of application.

Why are people using it instead of Java or some of the other languages out there? Primarily because it provides significant benefits in terms of conciseness, readability and safety, without some of the drawbacks that adopting a new language has such as a higher learning curve or interoperability with existing code and ecosystems.

In this talk we'll cover some aspects of Kotlin that can really help you in your daily development, focusing on solving issues versus highlighting language features.

¿Y ahora que será de Android?

Durante el taller aprenderemos las super habilidades de Kotlin, que nos permite hacer que su primo Java no puede.

Librerias y librerías… ¿Por que no aprender un algunas de las más usadas en empresas como RetroFit o el uso de Android Clean?

A partir de un esqueleto desarrollaremos una app completamente funcional en Kotlin… ¡¡¡¡y si en solo 2 horas!!! aunque puede que necesitemos la ayuda de algún Vengador.

description: You've probably heard about Kotlin Native but might not have had a chance to play with it yet. This talk with cover getting started with Kotlin Native, what the differences are between JVM Kotlin and Native Kotlin, and some live coding to show what's currently possible with the new v0.2 pre-release.

speaker: Siamak Ashrafi
title: Silicon Valley Code Camp
subject: Android Architecture & Material components with Kotlin.
description:
It has always been said that Android is not a complete platform. The app developer must include several popular libraries as a base just to start to build a simple app. Now Google has expressed the same sediment. The four App components of Android (Activities, Services, Broadcast receivers and Content providers) are not the building blocks of an Android app but a contract between the OS and Application. App developers need to rebuild the basic building blocks whenever starting a new App. This causes many problems for developers and leads to ambiguity about how to best build a robust App.

Google is looking to remedy this problem by releasing the Android Architectural Components (Room, Lifecycle-aware components, ViewModels and LiveData). While they individually address developer pain points (Persist Data, Manage Lifecycles, Modular & remove errors) they also work together to implement a sane app architecture. In this talk we will detail each components functions and benefits.

Once we have a clear understanding of the Architectural Components we will explain how they work together to form a robust reference architecture. Common architectural principles: The most important thing you should focus on is the separation of concerns in your app.

The second important principle is that you should drive your UI from a model, preferably a persistent model.

We end the talk by reviewing how these new components replace and interact with current popular Android libraries.

speaker: Troy Miles
title: Silicon Valley Code Camp
subject: Creating an AWS Lambda Function with Kotlin
description:
Kotlin is a language from the tool gurus at JetBrains. In 2016, after about six years of development, Kotlin reached version 1.0. In 2017 it won the hearts of developers and became an officially supported language for Android.

Kotlin, like Java, is for more than creating Android applications. It can replace or enhance Java most places it is used today including on AWS. AWS Lambda functions sometimes called Serverless Computing, is a service which lets us developers build web services without worrying about configuring servers.

In this session, we will create a lambda service on AWS using Kotlin. Along the way, we will learn what a makes Kotlin an excellent replacement for Java and how simple it is to construct an AWS Lambda function.

speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
title: Java Day Minsk 2017
subject: Kotlin Coroutines: Asynchronous Programming Made Simple
description:
Today more and more applications are written with asynchronous code. Languages have first class support for asynchronous programming: go with goroutines, C# and Python with async/await, and at the end JavaScript with callbacks, promises and async/await. There is already a lot of code in JVM ecosystem written for asynchronous applications: Netty, RxJava, Spring Reactor, etc. Even Java 8 provides CompletableFuture, and Java 9 Reactive Streams Interface. So clearly, asynchronous programming is our present and future.

But writing code with asynchronous primitives in Java adds complexity to our systems. Kotlin now offers means to tame this complexity by making coroutines first-class citizens in the language through the single primitive: suspending functions. We will see what are Coroutines in Kotlin, their practical use-cases and interoperability with Java.

speaker: Mustafa Ali
title: Android Ottawa
subject: Kotlin: an introduction
description: This talk will cover the history and origins of the language, syntax and features, how to get started, features that will make your life as an Android dev easier and uses of Kotlin beyond the Android ecosystem.

speaker: Dave Ford
title: Los Angeles Java User Group
subject: Building Client-Side JavaScript Apps with Kotlin
description:
Kotlin is a super productive and practical language from JetBrains, the makers of IntelliJ. It compiles to JVM, Native and JavaScript. JetBrains is positioning it as a "Statically typed programming language for the JVM, Android and the browser".

I have already ported an entire back-end API from Java to Kotlin. This was the world's smoothest language transition. And now I am in the process of converting the JavaScript front-end to Kotlin.

In this presentation, I'll show you how to create an HTML/JavaScript application using Kotlin. I'll also share some of what I learned in porting a production React/JavaScript app to React/Kotlin.

speaker: Eugene Petrenko
title: Kotlin User Group Helsinki

description:
Welcome to Kotlin, the open source, statically typed programming language for multi-platform applications. This gonna be a big and exciting journey. To start with, we have an introduction to the language, no matter you target native, JVM, Android or JavaScript. It covers basic syntax, type inference, lambdas, inline functions, data classes, statically typed DSLs, and much more.

An introduction is impossible without stories and future plans. In addition, I’ll share my own Kotlin experience and several open source projects I created with it.

Both inside and outside of JetBrains there are people deploying Kotlin applications for Android platform, for Web Applications and just about any other type of application. Why are people using it instead of Java or some of the other languages out there? Primarily because it provides significant benefits in terms of conciseness, readability and safety, without some of the drawbacks that adopting a new language has such as a higher learning curve or interoperability with existing code and ecosystems. In this talk we'll cover some aspects of Kotlin that can really help you in your daily development, focusing on solving issues versus highlighting language features.

It was launched 2011 by JetBrains, the company behind Intellij and Android Studio, and has grown exponentially over the last 5 years. It's used frameworks like Spring and Gradle, and in the products of big companies like Pinterest, Evernote and Atlassian. And, if you had any doubts of whether Kotlin was here to stay, Google just announced Kotlin as an official language for Android at Google I/O 2017!

speaker: Roman Elizarov
title: GeekOut 2017
subject: Introduction to Kotlin coroutines
description:
We live in an asynchronous era of concurrency. Modern front-end and mobile applications provide real-time feedback and communication, server-side applications and services handle thousands on-line users while integrating dozens of micro-services. Old-school monolithic applications with thread-based concurrency are going out of fashion and asynchronous styles of programming with callbacks, futures, reactive streams and coroutines are gaining popularity.

Kotlin is a modern and pragmatic JVM language that is developed by JetBrains with a strong emphasis on Java interoperability. Due to its strong Java interop, any Java asynchronous library can be used in Kotlin. You can even use JVM-based byte-code-instrumeting coroutine implementations like Quasar and JavaFlow. So, why Kotlin introduced coroutines as a first-class language feature and how Kotlin coroutines are different from the generate/yield and async/await coroutines in C#, Python, JS and other languages? What makes using coroutines in Kotlin different from using threads?

This talk answers those questions and gives a gentle introduction to the world of Kotlin coroutines with live examples. You’ll learn how to launch and wait for coroutine completion, what are Kotlin suspending functions and how to wrap your favourite asynchronous library into them, turning your asynchronous “callback hell” into an easy-to-read synchronous-like code. You’ll see how you can write scalable applications with Kotlin coroutines to handle lots of concurrent actions (connections, users, conversations, animations, etc) at once.

description: Using Kotlin for Android development has grown in popularity over the past few years and is now officially supported by Google. If you are not already using Kotlin you might be wondering why and how to adopt it. In the first part of this talk, Jake will cover advancing the usage and design patterns of the language for Android development to solve larger problems. In the second part, Christina will share her experience using Kotlin in production, from mistakes to successes, and help you answer questions your team/company might ask about adopting it.

speaker: Drew Stephens
title: Tech Talk DC
subject: Why You Should Use Kotlin
description:
Learn about Kotlin, a new language for the JVM. Kotlin cleans up the worst parts of Java (checked exceptions, verbose syntax) and makes the functional programming constructs easy.

Kotlin isn’t just for Android developers who are have to live in a hobbled JVM—it is Java updated for the modern world. If you like static types but are frustrated by Java’s archaic syntax and lack of modern language conveniences, Kotlin is for you.

Kotlin is a pragmatic replacement for Java that has perfect interoperability with the older language. With it’s shallow learning curve, Kotlin can be easily added to an existing Java codebase and make use of the extensive universe of JVM libraries, just like Java.

A l'occasion de la création d'un catalogue interactif de films, venez découvrir les fonctionnalités majeures de Kotlin, ces différences et son intégration avec Java, comment Kotlin est un langage productif, et comment il peut vous rendre plus productif.

speaker: Svetlana Isakova
title: MCE Positive Tech
subject: Coroutines in Kotlin
description: The async/await feature allows you to write the asynchronous code in a straightforward way, without a long list of callbacks. Used in C# for quite a while already, it has proved to be extremely useful. In fact, async/await is an implementation of a more general concept of coroutines, which first appeared more than 50 years ago. Coroutines are essentially light-weight threads that can be suspended and resumed later. Kotlin brings to the table the native support for coroutines, allowing to implement async/await, yield and similar programming patterns as different libraries, not built-in language constructs. The separate library for RxJava, for instance, can declare 'asyncRx' returning Observable and the 'await' function as an extension on Observable. In this talk we'll start with the essence of async/await and then proceed to the general concept of coroutines with some details of how it's implemented in Kotlin.

speaker: Aleix Morgadas

description: The async/await feature allows you to write the asynchronous code in a straightforward way, without a long list of callbacks. Used in C# for quite a while already, it has proved to be extremely useful. In fact, async/await is an implementation of a more general concept of coroutines, which first appeared more than 50 years ago. Coroutines are essentially light-weight threads that can be suspended and resumed later. Kotlin brings to the table the native support for coroutines, allowing to implement async/await, yield and similar programming patterns as different libraries, not built-in language constructs. The separate library for RxJava, for instance, can declare 'asyncRx' returning Observable and the 'await' function as an extension on Observable. In this talk we'll start with the essence of async/await and then proceed to the general concept of coroutines with some details of how it's implemented in Kotlin.

description: Kotlin is here to save you from Java -- one class at a time. With an elegant syntax similar to that of Swift, Kotlin brings modern programming to the JVM while maintaining full interoperability with existing Java classes and libraries. While you can use Kotlin to replace Java on nearly any platform, Kotlin really shines in the world of modern Android development, and that’s what we’ll focus on in this talk. We’ll go over the basics of Kotlin, cover tips and tricks that make Kotlin a joy to write, and show you how to get started with Kotlin in your existing projects.

Do you dream about life without unexpected nulls? Do you fancy a little bit of functional programming? Are you tired of Java ceremony?

Then maybe 2017 is The Right Moment to choose Kotlin! This JVM language brings you stuff like null-safety and immutability by default. Less boilerplate, more safety. And you can introduce it in your project class after class, module after module, without risky revolution.

I will show you pros and cons of Kotlin, based on last 8 months of my experience. In November 2016 I started a new backend project built on top of Gradle and Spring. Today I still do not regret the decision to write it in Kotlin. Let's see if I convince you! :-)

description:
Since adopting the Kotlin in late 2016, and introducing it to SPA last year, we've been running teams releasing production code in this JVM language for some 18 months now.

In that time the language has been through 2 major releases, with the latest version 1.1 filling some gaps left in the original spec and adding innovative coroutine support, while the tooling continues to improve. As a result our enthusiasm for this strongly typed but expressive gem has, amazingly, grown since last year.

In this session we'll share our experience in migrating existing code, TDD in Kotlin, training developers, publishing libraries, writing DSLs, mixing OO and functional code, and embracing null as a friend.
