description:
Paso el mes del amor, le llaman "Febrero loco y marzo otro poco" asi que es tiempo de darle continuidad a nuestro meetup y hablar de Android como nos gusta.

Regresamos como cada mes con 3 nuevas platicas y esperando que nos acompañen, traigan a sus amiguitos y amiguitas y vengan a pasar un rato magico y maravilloso en compañia de los mas cercanos a ustedes: otros desarrolladores.

En este mes, la gente de Luxoft nos presta sus instalaciones para poder reunirnos a comer pizza y beber cerveza y claro, hablar de Android.

speaker: Kai Koenig
title: GDG Melbourne
subject: The Ultimate Ninja of Kotlin Libraries
description: Kai will be delivering a remote presentation on Kotlin Libraries. Kotlin is a new language for the JVM that aims to be a "better Java". Made in-house by Jetbrains, the company behind IntelliJ IDEA and also Android Studio, it's been in development for more than 5 years. Just a few weeks ago the final version of Kotlin 1.0 saw the light of day.

speaker: 藤田 琢磨
title: 【学生＆若手エンジニア向け勉強会】
subject: Kotlin入門（ハンズオン有） 言語の紹介〜プロダクト導入の知見まで
description:
サポーターズが贈るエンジニア勉強会。

今回のテーマは「今こそ学ぶ、Kotlin入門」。

KotlinはJetBrainsが作った言語で2016年の2月にv1がリリースされました。

Null安全・拡張関数・関数リテラル等の魅力があり、正式リリース以降、

サーバやAndroidなどでの導入事例が増えてきています。

Kotlinの文法のハンズオンから導入の知見までを共有し、

参加者がKotlinをふわっとその場で習得することを目指します。

サーバ・Androidエンジニアだけではなく、

iOSをSwiftで書いている人やAndroid始めたいと思っている方にもおすすめです！

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: Voxxed Days CERN
subject: Kotlin – Ready for production
description:
Did you know that Kotlin is being used in production for over a few years now already? Both inside and outside of JetBrains there are people deploying Kotlin applications for Android platform, for Web Applications and just about any other type of application.

Why are people using it instead of Java or some of the other languages out there? Primarily because it provides significant benefits in terms of conciseness, readability and safety, without some of the drawbacks that adopting a new language has such as a higher learning curve or interoperability with existing code and ecosystems.

In this talk we’ll cover some aspects of Kotlin that can really help you in your daily development, focusing on solving issues versus highlighting language features.

speaker: Kota Mizushima
title: Scala Matsuri 2017
subject: Kotlin for Scala Programmers
description: Kotlin, created by JetBrains, is an application development language for Android that has been getting a lot of attention lately. Kotlin emits JVM bytecode and has its own lightweight runtime library. It is also very easy to learn because its language syntax is greatly influenced by Scala. This talk will present an introduction to Kotlin for Scala programmers.

title: Scala Matsuri 2016
subject: Kotlin Hands on
description: Hands on session with Kotlin

speaker: Leonid Rudenko
title: Selenium Camp
subject: Excuse me, sir, do you have a moment to talk about tests in Kotlin?
description:
Do you remember why your tests are written in language X? Because the project is being developed in language X? It was teamlead’s decision? Do you know good libraries and tools for language X? Maybe it’s time to try to write tests in language Y?

Yes, the tests’ language may differ from the project’s language. And if you are using Java, there are reasons why your tests’ language can be Kotlin. Don’t be afraid, Kotlin is not a rocket science. I’ll tell you how the features of this language make it possible to spend less time on the tests’ support. How strong typing can be similar to the dynamic one. And why your favorite libraries will stay with you. And, of course, the main thing – how to start. Where possible, a comparison with Java and Groovy will be made.

If you do test automation or you develop in Java/Groovy – come to my talk.

speaker: Ilyes Bekaddour
title: UConf 2.0
subject: Kotlin
description: définitions, qualités, et objectifs de Kotlin

speaker: Mike Gouline
title: Android Australia User Group
subject: Kotlin, the pragmatic language for Android
description: Kotlin, a relatively new programming language running on the JVM, has been making headlines as the more elegant alternative to Java in any of its applications. One of them is Android development and this talk will explore the benefits that the language offers for everyday coding

speaker: Armando Picón
title: Droidcon Santo Domingo
subject: Kotlin for Android Developers
description: An introduction talk about how Kotlin can help to Android Developer to improve their app development.

speaker: Juraj Palaščák
title: Night of Chances Technology
subject: Why Kotlin beats Java (Basics)
description: Why should we start using Kotlin today for pleasant Android development. I'll present small app written in both Java and Kotlin, compare differences and introduce helpful timesavers.

speaker: Olivier Hubaut
title: BruJUG - The Brussels Java User Group
subject: Kotlin: Less boilerplate, More fun!
description:
Kotlin has gained some traction amongst the Android developers that were stuck with Java 6. But what did push JetBrains to invent a new language in the first place, and how did they tried to solve the issues they were facing with Java?

In this talk, you will be introduced to concepts and the syntax of the language. We'll dive in what makes it so pragmatic and how it can interoperate with Java.

speaker: Bas Cancrinus
title: Kotlin user group Berlin
subject: Kotlin
description: We're getting together in an informal setting to share our knowledge of Kotlin and catch up. Please step up when you're willing to present something you've done with Kotlin.

speaker: Евгений Шишкин
title: GDG St. Petersburg
subject: Kotlin в продакшн: опыт внедрения Kotlin в большой Android проект на Java
description: В феврале 2016 года состоялся релиз первой версии языка Kotlin. Вокруг этого события поднялось большое количество хайпа среди Android-разработчиков. Многие стали пробовать писать на Kotlin Android-приложения. Весь синтаксический сахар, поддержка иммутабельности, null-safety, extension функции и многое другое выглядело весьма соблазнительно на фоне Java 7. В компании Aviasales тоже не могли пройти мимо данного релиза. Евгений расскажет про тернистый путь миграции крупного продакшн проекта на Kotlin и как теперь с этим живется.

speaker: Станислав Ерохин
title: GDG St. Petersburg
subject: Новые возможности kotlin1.1 и будущее языка
description: Вы услышите, что же нового готовится в релизе 1.1. Будут рассмотрены реальные примеры использования новых фич языка, а также показаны ситуации, в которых эти фичи помогут сделать ваш код более выразительным и кратким. Также будет рассказано о планах развития языка.

speaker: Андрей Бреслав
title: GDG St. Petersburg
subject: Q&A сессия с создателем языка Kotlin
description: Андрей Бреслав с радостью ответит на все интересующие вас вопросы по существующим возможностям языка, о том, что ждать в Kotlin 2.0, а также что такое — этот таинственный Kotlin Native.

speaker: Arnaud Giuliani
title: Devoxx France 2017
subject: Venez développer une application Android météo en Kotlin
description: This is a 3 hours hands-on session to take a tour of the Kotlin language on a real app (a weather application). During the workshop, we will see several presentation about language features. Then we will work on precise cases, in a pragmatic way

speaker: Arnaud Giuliani
title: DevoxxFR 2017
subject: MorningTech - Développez une app Android météo en Kotlin
description: This is a 3-hour practical session to do a Kotlin language tour on a real application (a weather application). During the workshop, we will see several presentations on the characteristics of the language. Then we will work on specific cases, in a pragmatic way

speaker: Thomas Girard
title: Montpellier Android User Group
subject: Kotlin
description: Thomas Girard nous présentera Kotlin, détails à venir mais il devrait y avoir du live coding après une présentation du langage.

speaker: Enrique Lopez Manas
title: Codecamp, Saigon
subject: Kotlin Workshop
description: 3 days of Kotlin Workshop in Saigon, from 0 to 10.

speaker: Rob Shepherd
title: North Wales Tech
subject: Kotlin
description: Continuing the theme of CodeJams looking at particular languages, this time we'll be looking at languages that run on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) such as Kotlin, Clojure, Ceylon and Scala.

speaker: Rob Shepherd
title: BarCoders #2
subject: Tworzenie aplikacji na Android w języku Kotlin
description: Porozmawiamy o oprogramowaniu wpływającym na rzeczywistość, o tym jak tworzyć aplikacje mobilne językiem Kotlin, developmencie aplikacji z Dockerem, koncepcji CQRS oraz doprawianiu swojego Javascrptu czyli krótko o curry i programowaniu funkcyjnym.

subject: Kobalt - modern build tool written in Kotlin
title: Kotlin Night in Warsaw
speaker: Juan Liska
description: Kobalt - modern build tool written in Kotlin. I will present this relatively new (1.5 years old) build tool that lets you write build configurations in Kotlin

subject: Kotlin for Java Developers
title: Kotlin Night Riga
speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
description:
Kotlin is a statically typed language with strong support for both classic OO and object-functional approaches. Kotlin already became main language for many backend and android developers. In this talk we re going to learn Kotlin from the ground up. Topics covered: syntax, interoperability with Java.

I'm currently also trying to get a second speaker from the Kotlin community with more experience who might either substitute me or dive deeper into this language with us. In any case, there will be giveaways for Kotlin fans.

subject: Kotlin & Android
title: Kotlin Night Riga
speaker: Sergejs Luhmirins
description: For a long time android developers were struggling with old Java versions and enviously looked at backend developers using their fancy streams and lambdas. Thanks to Kotlin those times are over. Now any Android developer can use latest and greatest language features, gain from mixing different paradigms and much more. In this talk I will highlight how Kotlin may be beneficial to any Android developer.

subject: Introduction to Bootique and Kotlin Gradle
title: Kotlin Night Riga
speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
description:
Today, many Java developers are tired of the complexity and the bulkiness of containers and existing frameworks.

Bootique is a simple and universal solution to these problems. At the core of Bootique are three pillars that provide developers with everything they need for building an application.

subject: 365 Dias de Kotlin
title: Kotlin Night São Paulo 2017
speaker: Philipe Steiff e Felippe Bisca
description:
Estamos muito felizes de anunciar que o nosso primeiro evento será o Kotlin Night São Paulo 2017, evento oficial de Kotlin realizado pela JetBrains no mundo inteiro, sendo essa a primeira edição Kotlin Night realizado na América do Sul!

O objetivo desse evento é dar um pontapé inicial na comunidade de Kotlin em São Paulo, além de trazer experiências de grandes empresas com a utilização da linguagem.

subject: Build Scripts Gradle em Kotlin
title: Kotlin Night São Paulo 2017
speaker: Rodrigo B. de Oliveira
description:
Estamos muito felizes de anunciar que o nosso primeiro evento será o Kotlin Night São Paulo 2017, evento oficial de Kotlin realizado pela JetBrains no mundo inteiro, sendo essa a primeira edição Kotlin Night realizado na América do Sul!

O objetivo desse evento é dar um pontapé inicial na comunidade de Kotlin em São Paulo, além de trazer experiências de grandes empresas com a utilização da linguagem.

subject: Testes com Kotlin
title: Kotlin Night São Paulo 2017
speaker: Ygor Barboza
description:
Estamos muito felizes de anunciar que o nosso primeiro evento será o Kotlin Night São Paulo 2017, evento oficial de Kotlin realizado pela JetBrains no mundo inteiro, sendo essa a primeira edição Kotlin Night realizado na América do Sul!

O objetivo desse evento é dar um pontapé inicial na comunidade de Kotlin em São Paulo, além de trazer experiências de grandes empresas com a utilização da linguagem.

subject: An introduction to Kotlin by example
title: Riga DevDays 2017
speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
description:
Kotlin is what Java 9 should have been if it was written from scratch.

The goal of this session is to introduce audience to Kotlin programming language. The session is mostly live coding demo based on small programming problems written in Kotlin. It starts with "hello world" and continues to more complex examples ending with Kotlin puzzlers.

Target audience: software developers familiar with Java (Groovy, Scala or similar language).

subject: Kotlin
title: Grand Rapids Java Users Group
speaker: Dan Lindeman
description: Java is great, but is there anything out there better? This talk will cover languages that some think are better than Java, but still take advantage of the JVM. In this talk, Dan Lindeman of Blue Medora talks about Kotlin and how it can make your teams more productive.

subject: Kotlin
title: CodeJam: A Cup Full of JVM
speaker: David Hunnisett
description:
Continuing the theme of CodeJams looking at particular languages, this time we'll be looking at languages that run on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) such as Kotlin, Clojure and maybe even Scala.

The format will be a Kata of sorts where teams will pick one of the JVM languages to all work on the same Kata to later compare how they got on with the different languages.

subject: Kotlin and Android Development - How do we use Kotlin in our Cookpad Android app?
title: Android Talks @Cookpad
speaker: Kittinun Vantasin
description: Meet people, learn stuff, share things about Android Development

subject: Fun With Kotlin
title: Android Developer meetup
speaker: Sebastian Chlan
description: An introduction to Kotlin by the handsome Sebastian Chlan (Zendesk)

subject: Sputnik - A Gradle Plugin Through Kotlin
title: Android Developer meetup
speaker: Elliot Tormey
description: The Elliot Tormey (Tapadoo) Gradle plugin for developers that can’t version good and want to do some proguard things too

subject: First few months with Kotlin - Introduction through Android examples
title: Kotlin User Group Serbia
speaker: Nebojša Vukšić
description:
Predavač Nebojša Vukšić će predstaviti programski jezlik Kotlin i većinu najvažnijih feature-a ovog jezika kroz njegovu primenu u razvoju android aplikacija. Poznavanje razvoja Android aplikacija nije neophodno da bi se razumeli svi koncepti ovog jezika.

Ujedno ovo će biti prilika da predstavimo planove Kotlin korisničke grupe javnosti i da pozovemo sve zainteresovane koji žele da učestvuju u ovom projektu da predlože svoje ideje organizatorima.

subject: Kotlin features for Android
title: Mobile Dev Meetup
speaker: Valentin Iorgu
description:
The Android development experience has improved considerably in the last couple of years thanks to some great libraries and tooling improvements but we're still stuck with an outdated version of Java while other platforms get shiny new toys like Swift.

You might have heard of Kotlin (also during our last meetup), but how exactly does it help? In this presentation we'll go over several Kotlin features that help reduce boilerplate, can increase the stability of your codebase and enhance the overall development experience.

We'll explore things like inline functions, reified generics, receiver lambdas, delegated properties, sneak peak at coroutines and more.

subject: Kotlin
title: GDG Rhein-Main
speaker: Marc Reichelt
description: It's been a long time! Let's kickoff this year with a GDG meetup about machine learning, self-driving cars and more! Also let's share stuff about your favorite languages - Kotlin, Dart, you name it!

subject: Faster development using Anko on Kotlin
title: GDG New Delhi
speaker: Vatsal Bajpai

subject: Two months of Kotlin
title: GDG Bologna
speaker: Erik Minarini
description: Kotlin é un linguaggio conciso e sicuro che puó essere usato come alternativa a Java o al fianco di esso nello sviluppo di applicazioni Android native. Questo talk tratta del primo impatto che ho avuto con questo linguaggio dopo averlo utilizzato per più di due mesi, dei suoi pregi e del perché esso stia prendendo sempre piú piede.

subject: Functional Reactive Programming with Kotlin
title: Mobile Tea #14: Mobile and the City
speaker: Giorgio Natili
description: Reactive programming is a paradigm oriented around data flows and propagation of changes. Kotlin is a programming language intended to be a better Java, and it's designed to be usable and readable across large teams with skill and discipline variances. Despite its object-oriented building blocks, Kotlin fits well in the functional reactive programming landscape. In this essay, I will deep-dive into the most relevant aspects of FRP in Kotlin focusing on the advantages that everyone can get when using this approach to build an Android app. (speech level: intermediate; duration: 20 minutes)

subject: Introduction to the the Kotlin programming language with Alberto Arias
title: Toronto Java Users Group
speaker: Alberto Arias
description:
Let's take a quick tour at the basic features of this modern, and pragmatic language for the JVM. Kotlin is an open-sourced statically-typed programming language created by JetBrains that targets the JVM or JavaScript; It’s designed to interoperate 100% with Java code easily, and allows gradual adoption.

Content

• Why kotlin?

• Installation

• The REPL

• Data types and declaring variables

• Loops and ranges

• Control structures

• OOP: Classes, Objects,

• and Null safety

subject: Kotlin for Android
title: TechAtAgoda #6: Let's talk Mobile
speaker: Tomasz Morcinek
description: We are excited to invite you to our #6 meet-up that will be in mobile mark, we will share our mobile knowledge with you.This meet-up will be divided into 2 tracks, one will be about iOS and the other Android.

subject: Kotlin für den Build Master
title: JavaLand 2017
speaker: Dirk Dittert
description: Kotlin ist eine statisch typisierte Programmiersprache für die Java VM, die sich für eine Vielzahl von Einsatzmöglichkeiten eignet  von der AndroidEntwicklung bis zum Gradle-Build-Skript. Für den Build Master lohnt es sich, einen Blick auf die Sprache zu werfen, da die täglichen Werkzeuge seit kurzem Kotlin unterstützen: Gradle 3 ermöglicht die Erstellung von Build-Skripten in Kotlin statt wie bisher in Groovy, wodurch z.B. wesentlich bessere Code-Vervollständigung in der IDE möglich wird. Aber auch Build-Konfigurationen für TeamCity können direkt mit Kotlin programmiert und in der Versionsverwaltung abgelegt werden.

subject: Curso presencial: Kotlin para desarrolladores Android
title: Kotlin para desarrolladores Android
speaker: Antonio Leiva
description:
¡NUEVA EDICIÓN DEL CURSO PRESENCIAL!

Aprende a crear una aplicación con Kotlin en un día.

El único curso especializado para aprender Kotlin desde cero mientras desarrollas una aplicación Android

En una jornada intensiva interiorizarás todos los conceptos del lenguaje necesarios para crear una app en Android.

Puede que la idea de aprender un lenguaje nuevo te haga pensar que vas a tener que dedicar demasiadas horas a analizar y escribir código hasta dominarlo con un experto. Puede que te preguntes si merecerá la pena el esfuerzo.
Sin embargo, el caso de Kotlin es diferente. Es tan sencillo que un curso intensivo de un día es suficiente para conocer todos los conceptos que necesitas para crear tu primera app utilizando Kotlin como lenguaje principal. Te lo garantizo. Es así porque Kotlin ha sido ideado para facilitar la transición desde Java.
El tiempo que dediques a aprender el lenguaje será tiempo que ganarás en el desarrollo diario de tus proyectos utilizando Kotlin.
Porque los nuevos conceptos que introduce Kotlin te ahorrarán líneas de código innecesarias y te darán soluciones impensables con Java a día de hoy.


Las compañías tecnológicas ya han empezado a utilizar Kotlin para desarrollar sus aplicaciones porque es un lenguaje maduro, que se integra a la perfección con Android Studio, es estable y seguro.
Dominarlo te permitirá situarte a la vanguardia en el desarrollo de apps Android. Cuando la demanda sea masiva estarás preparado para aprovechar las oportunidades profesionales.

Con Kotlin for Android Developers aprenderás en un día:

- A crear una App desde cero utilizando Kotlin: Todos los conceptos básicos necesarios para crear una app.

- A aplicar el lenguaje a Android: Las características exclusivas para Android y la interacción con el framework.

- A utilizar las herramientas de desarrollo: Aprenderás a integrar Kotlin en Android Studio y a utilizarlo en tus proyectos.

- De forma cien por cien práctica: A partir de ejemplos y escribiendo código.

- En un grupo reducido: Seremos un máximo de 15 personas, para poder dedicarte tiempo individualizado.

REQUISITOS: Fluidez con el Framework de Android y portátil propio con la última versión estable de Android Studio.

El acceso al curso presencial incluye nueve horas intensivas de formación presencial en las que aprenderás a crear una App con Kotlin desde cero.

Y además recibirás de forma gratuita…

- El libro en papel Kotlin for Android Developers (in inglés) (29€)
- Soporte por email durante un mes (97€)
- Acceso a mi comunidad privada de desarrolladores de Facebook (97€)
- El curso online Superpoderes para convertirte en un Desarrollador de Éxito (47€)

Me llamo Antonio Leiva, soy Android Engineer.

Desde que descubrí Kotlin en 2015 me he dedicado a exprimirlo al máximo para volcar todo su potencial en el desarrollo de aplicaciones para Android.

Mi objetivo con este curso es trasladarte esos conocimientos, mostrarte cómo utilizar Kotlin en un entorno Android en nueve horas de formación intensiva para que puedas mejorar tu productividad, saltar los límites de otros lenguajes y destacar como desarrollador aplicando un código moderno, sencillo y funcional.

Más información: https://devexperto.com/kotlin-desarrolladores-android-presencial/

subject: Kotlin en Acción
title: Kotlin en Acción para Android Developers
speaker: Armando Picon, Lima Perú
description: Este taller está diseñado para introducir a los desarrolladores android en el uso de este lenguaje de programación. Se hará un repaso de los conceptos básicos del lenguaje y cómo estos pueden aplicarse en el desarrollo de aplicaciones Android.

subject: Kotlin: Customer Review
title: Functional Miners - 02.2017
speaker: Mateusz Sulima
description: Chciałbym przedstawić mocne i słabe strony Kotlina zauważone po pół roku korzystania na produkcji. Szczególnie skupię się na porównaniu do jego bliskich krewnych - Javy i Scali.

subject: Java 6++: Moderne Android-Entwicklung mit Kotlin
title: JavaLand 2017
speaker: Benjamin Schmid
description:
Android-Entwickler können nur sehnsüchtig seufzen: Die neuen Möglichkeiten aus Java 8 wie funktionale Programmierung, Lambdas oder Streams bleiben ihnen noch vorenthalten. Grund: Die Android-Plattform steckt weitgehend noch auf Java 6 fest. Abhilfe schafft hier die JVM-Sprache Kotlin, die nach über fünf Jahren Entwicklung mittlerweile die stabile Version 1.0 erreicht hat. Kotlin verspricht nicht nur weniger Boilerplate Code dank einer ausdrucksstarken und gut lesbaren Syntax mit funktionalen Features. Nein - eine vollständige Binärkompatibilität mit Java 6, die nahtlose Interoperabilität mit bestehenden Java-Code und eine enge Integration in die Android Studio IDE machen Kotlin auch für die moderne Android-Entwicklung zu einer idealen Alternative.

In dieser Session erleben wir live, wie es sich anfühlt, der NullpointerException auf Nimmerwiedersehen zu sagen und sie in für die App-Entwicklung gegen funktionale Features, Dataclasses und Extension-Methods einzutauschen. Eine kleine Beispiel-App hilft beim Kennenlernen und vermittelt lebendige Eindrücke, sodass auch Android-Neulinge gut folgen können. Tools wie wie Anko und die Kotlin Android Extensions unterstützen beim Bändigen des Android SDK. Am Ende konnten wir hoffentlich nicht nur viel Lust und Inspiration auf eigene Experimente und Versuche anregen, sondern auch interessante Einblicke in die Programmiersprache sowie ihren Einsatz unter Android im Speziellen mitnehmen.

subject: Kotlin in Practice
title: JUG Saxony Camp Leipzig 2017
speaker: Philipp Hauer
description: We speak about the introduction of Kotlin at Spreadshirt and the experience we made with this great language. We show how the development with popular frameworks (like Spring, Jackson and Vaadin) can benefit from Kotlin.

subject: Let's go to discover Kotlin!
title: Devoxx France
speaker: David Wursteisen, Mounir Boudraa
description: Kotlin is between Java and Scala : more powerfull than Java with immutable class, extensions method, and other features, without be as complex as Scala. While building an interactive movie catalogues, discover with us major Kotlin features, Java integration, how Kotlin can be a productive language and how it help you to be more productive.

subject: An introduction to Kotlin by example
title: ACCU 2017
speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
description:
Kotlin is a new programming language for the JVM (and JavaScript VM) by JetBrains. It is a statically typed language designed to include the most pragmatic features from Java, Groovy, C# and Scala. Kotlin is what Java 9 should have been in an ideal world.

This session is an overview of Kotlin features using code examples and comparison with other JVM languages. The idea is to move from compiling and running "hello world" to more advanced examples, encounter some Kotlin puzzlers along the way and finish with actual program written in Kotlin (most likely Snake game).

subject: 解剖 Kotlin ~バイトコードを読み解く~
title: DroidKaigi 2017
speaker: Toshihiro Yagi
description: Kotlinの特徴的な機能としてnull許容型や関数型や拡張関数などがよく取り沙汰されます。null安全だとか高階関数で簡潔に記述だとか拡張関数便利最高といった話は枚挙に暇がありません。確かに言語機能としていろいろとJavaに比べて便利なのは分かるんだけど、でもまぁ別にJavaを使っていてクリティカルに困っているわけではないしな〜学習コストとかチームへの導入コストを考えるとそこまで旨味を感じられるわけでもないしな〜みたいなそんな気分。わかります。 本セッションではKotlinのコードをコンパイルして得られるJavaバイトコードを、可読化したりデコンパイルする事によって、Kotlinの特徴的な言語機能がJavaでどのように表現されているかを読み解いていきます。これによりKotlinが肩代わりしてくれるボイラープレートコード群を明らかにします。Kotlinを使うことで省略できたボイラープレートコードが可読性をどのように高め、設計に影響を与えるのかについても言及します。 目次案

subject: Kotlin + RxJava + Dagger2 + Orma + Retrofit で作るAndroidアプリ
title: DroidKaigi 2017
speaker: Aizawa lvla
description:
これらを利用したAndroidアプリケーションの作り方を紹介したいと思います。 目次(予定)

- 各ソフトウェア軽い紹介

- Kotlin?

- RxJava?

- Dagger2?

- Orma?

- Retrofit?

subject: Kotlinを始めようハンズオン
title: DroidKaigi 2017
speaker: 長澤太郎
description: 新しいプログラミング言語のKotlin（ことりん）を使ったAndroidプログラミングのハンズオンです。長らく（特に）Androidエンジニアの注目を集めていたKotlinですが、今年2月に念願のver1.0のリリースと7月に日本初の書籍の出版があり、今非常に勢いのある言語です。

subject: Monthly Kotlin users get-together
title: Kotlin user group Berlin
speaker: Bas Cancrinus
description: We're getting together in an informal setting to share our knowledge of Kotlin and catch up. Please step up when you're willing to present something you've done with Kotlin. Don't be shy :-)

subject: 【東京】JJUG ナイト・セミナー 「Kotlin（ことりん）
title: Japan Java User Group
speaker: 長澤 太郎
description:
ここ数年、注目を集めているJVM言語 Kotlin（ことりん）をテーマに開催します。 JJUGナイトセミナーとしてKotlinを取り上げるのは今回が初めて

Kotlinは、IntelliJ IDEAなどのIDEでおなじみのJetBrainsにより開発されているプログラミング言語です。 Java言語が動く環境を主要なターゲットとしており、その活躍の幅はサーバサイド、デスクトップ、モバイルなど多岐へ渡ります。 近日リリース予定のバージョン1.1やSpring frameworkのKotlinサポートなど、今ホットな言語であると言えるでしょう。

subject: Kotlin Talk
title: Android Developer Group Nürnberg
speaker: Nino Handler
description:
This time we will be talking about Kotlin. And I'm not talking about the Russian island and I won't either compare it to the Indonesian island Java, but talk about both as a language. I recently started learning Kotlin and my talk will introduce you to my first month with Kotlin, things I liked and things I really didn't understand.

I'm currently also trying to get a second speaker from the Kotlin community with more experience who might either substitute me or dive deeper into this language with us. In any case, there will be giveaways for Kotlin fans.

subject: Kotlin all the... tests!
title: Mobius conference
speaker: Danny Preussler
description: Kotlin was the rising star of programming languages in 2016. Not only did it get to version 1.0 but also got rapidly adopted in the Android community. But many companies are struggling to add Kotlin to an existing Java project. It's not easy to add a new language to an existing team. It's much easier to introduce Kotlin to your project using the backdoor: your unit tests. So let's look at Kotlin more from a testing perspective. How does writing tests in Kotlin look like, what possibilities of the language will help us?

subject: Kotlin - der neue Stern am Java Himmel?
title: Java User Group Hamburg
speaker: Dirk Dittert
description:
Schreiben Sie immer noch ellenlangen Boilerplate Code und stolpern in Ihren Projekten über Nullpointer Exceptions? Mit Kotlin gehört beides der Vergangenheit an! Kotlin ist eine statisch typisierte Sprache, die für die Entwicklung großer Projekte wie gemacht ist. Dabei besticht sie sowohl mit einer flachen Lernkurve als auch einer hervorragenden Kompatibilität zu bestehendem Java Code.

Gemeinsam unterziehen wir die kürzlich erschienene erste offizielle Version der Sprache einem Praxistest und lernen durch praxisnahe Codebeispiele die Unterschiede zu Java kennen. Ein Blick auf die verfügbaren Frameworks rundet den Vortrag ab. Ob Kotlin die Erwartungen erfüllen kann?

subject: Functional web applications avec Kotlin and Spring
title: Toulouse Java User Group
speaker: Davin Kevin
description: This presentation made by Sebastien Deleuze will show you a new type of functional application using Spring Reactive and Kotlin. This language fits well for Object and Functional programmation and is very well integrated in Spring stack.

subject: Meetup #2
title: Kotlin Rio
speaker: Lucas Albuquerque
description: Kotlin Live Coding (& Dojo)

subject: Kotlin for Android: The future is now
title: KotlinMAD
speaker: Antonio Leiva
description: Kotlin has come to stay, and it's the perfect time to start using it. Are you bored programming with Java on Android? Tired of seeing how your code is full of NullPointerException? Tired of not being able to use the latest features in modern languages? Thanks to Kotlin, we have a new world of possibilities ahead, hard to imagine until now in Android App development. In this talk we'll see how Kotlin makes interaction with the Android framework easier, how it reduces the complexity of the code and improves its readability, making our apps more robust and maintainable.

subject: Kotlin @PeakGames
title: Javaday Istanbul
speaker: ilkin Balkanay
description: We have 5 successful Android games written in Java programming language. We constantly add new features to these games and we will continue adding new features to them over the next 5 years. Although, we love the Java programming language, we have decided to develop new features in our games using the Kotlin programming language, a modern and pragmatic language. In this presentation you will learn why Kotlin becomes a worthwhile programming language, what the process of learning the language is, and how we solve the problems encountered when adding new features to the existing games with Kotlin.

subject: Kotlin vs Swift
title: Monkey Tech Days
speaker: Emmanuel Vinas
description: That event is a workshop where people will discover differences between Kotlin and swift mainly for non mobile development. It is organized with the GDG Toulouse.

subject: Future of Kotlin: Strategy and Tactics
title: JPoint
speaker: Andrey Breslav
description: A successful project usually grows, and Kotlin is no exception. We are adding new targets (JavaScript and Native) and new computation models (coroutines). This talk is about our vision of the future of Kotlin as a language and an ecosystem. We'll talk strategy: what we think our industry needs at large and how we are going to fit Kotlin into this picture. We'll talk tactics: how we deal with legacy and compatibility issues, and whether there will ever be Kotlin 2.0. We'll talk operations: can we do “continuous delivery” for language features? Or, more generally, how agile can language development be?

subject: Kotlin Puzzlers
title: JPoint
speaker: Anton Keks
description: Kotlin is a marvelous alternative language for the JVM, aiming to improve usability of aging Java. While not exactly new, it has been quickly gaining adoption since its 1.0 release in 2016. Anton will give a brief introduction and present Puzzlers of Kotlin — the gotchas that you may encounter while digging deeper into the language. While Kotlin was in development for 6 years, and aimed to be a perfect practical language, like all other languages, it still has tricky parts that you don't find in the documentation.

subject: The Future of Kotlin: How agile can language development be?
title: Mix-IT
speaker: Andrey Breslav
description: A successful project usually grows, and Kotlin is no exception. We are adding new targets (JavaScript and Native) and new computation models (coroutines). This talk is about our vision of the future of Kotlin as a language and an ecosystem. We'll talk strategy: what we think our industry needs at large and how we are going to fit Kotlin into this picture. We'll talk tactics: how we deal with legacy and compatibility issues, and whether there will ever be Kotlin 2.0. We'll talk operations: can we do “continuous delivery” for language features? Or, more generally, how agile can language development be?.

subject: Kotlin all your tests
title: Сodefest
speaker: JDanny Preussler
description: 2 Kotlin was the rising star of programming languages in 2016. It not only became final with version 1.0 but also got rapidly adopted in the android community. But many companies are struggling to add Kotlin to an existing Java project. It's not easy to add a new language to an existing team. But it's much easier to introduce Kotlin to your project using the backdoor: your unit tests. So let's look at Kotlin more from a testing perspective. How does it look like to write tests in Kotlin, what possibilities of the language will help us?

subject: Kotlin - ett elegant nytt programspråk för JVM:en
title: CADEC - CALLISTA DEVELOPER'S CONFERENCE 2017
speaker: Jesper Holmberg
description: 201General presentation of the Kotlin language, and how it fits within the JVM eco system.

subject: Monthly Kotlin users get-together
title: Kotlin user group Berlin
speaker: Bas Cancrinus
description: We're getting together in an informal setting to share our knowledge of Kotlin and to catch up.

subject: Kotlin
title: Android Meetup - Belo Horizonte
speaker: Rafael Toledo
description: Neste Meetup vamos falar sobre: Kotlin

subject: Functional web applications with Spring and Kotlin
title: Warsaw Cloud Native Meetup
speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
description: Based on a concrete feedback about building a conference website [1], I will show Spring Framework 5.0 in action with its dedicated Kotlin support [2] and its new functional and reactive web API. This reference web application we are going to see in detail has be developed with the following principles

subject: Functional web applications with Spring and Kotlin
title: Kotlin Night in Warsaw
speaker: Sébastien Deleuze

subject: Introductions and Kickoff
title: Brooklyn Kotlin
speaker: Patrick Cousins
description: Starting a meetup for people to get together and discuss Kotlin, learn about it, present, etc. All things Kotlin basically.

subject: Kotlin User Group Cologne
title: Kotlin User Group Cologne Kickoff
speaker: Andreas Eri
description: Dies wird das erste Treffen der Kotlin User Group Cologne, weitere Informationen folgen später. :)

subject: Kotlin: Uncovered
title: Droidcon Boston
speaker: Victoria Gonda
description: Kotlin does a lot for us in the way of reducing boilerplate. But what is it really doing? We will be inspecting some decompiled Kotlin to discover how it does its job. By looking underneath at how it handles data classes, lambdas, and delegation, we can better understand how the language executes what we write. If you’re curious about the language, or already using it in production, you should walk away from this investigation with a deeper understanding of Kotlin, and some tools for continued exploration.

subject: No excuses: switch to Kotlin!
title: Appdevcon
speaker: Thijs Suijten
description:
Are you stuck in the Java world? I’ll share my story about convincing my team and the client of the benefits of Kotlin. Furthermore I’ll delve into how we migrated an existing Java Android app, with 300k active users, to Kotlin.

Even if you have never seen Kotlin before, come and see how you will create better apps with this modern and elegant language. At the end of this talk you’ll be able to convince your team / client why it’s a great to use Kotlin.

title: Chicago Roboto
subject: Kotlin: Uncovered
speaker: Victoria Gonda
description: Kotlin does a lot for us in the way of reducing boilerplate. But what is it really doing? We will be inspecting some decompiled Kotlin to discover how it does its job. By looking underneath at how it handles data classes, lambdas, and delegation, we can better understand how the language executes what we write. If you’re curious about the language, or already using it in production, you should walk away from this investigation with a deeper understanding of Kotlin, and some tools for continued exploration.

title: GDG Wellington
subject: Coding for Android with Kotlin - let’s build a simple app in 90 minutes
speaker: Kai Koenig
description: Kai Koenig has kindly accepted to put together a 90 minute Kotlin walkthrough for our group. At the end of this session we will have created a small Android app.

title: Orange County Java User Group (OCJUG)
subject: Kotlin
speaker: Troy Miles
description:
Kotlin is a relatively new language on the Java Virtual Machine. JetBrains, the creators of IntelliJ IDEA, designed it to be a replacement for Java. Kotlin is also pragmatic; it recognizes the investment that your Java code and knowledge represent. So, it is 100% interoperable with Java. Not only can you call Java classes from Kotlin, but it is equally simple to call Kotlin from Java.

There are plenty of languages on the JVM. Unfortunately, most of them replace Java's complexity with their own. Kotlin does not, is modern, versatile, and streamlined. It offers many features to make you more productive. No more getters and setters. Classes are simpler to create and use. Most of Java's tedious boilerplate code is gone. And it relegates the dreaded null pointer exception to the history books with its type safety.

Not only is Kotlin open source and free to use, switching to it is simple. You can add it to your existing Java project. The following IDEs have Kotlin plugins: Eclipse, NetBeans, and of course, IntelliJ IDEA.

Apple garnered a lot of attention with the release of Swift in 2014. Developers praised its simplicity and beauty when compared to Objective-C, a language created in the 1980's. Kotlin is Swift for the JVM. It makes programming Java, a language born in 1995, fun again.

In this talk, we'll take a quick look at Kotlin. We will check out some of its coolest features, see how easy it is to add it to an existing Java project and finally look how beautiful it makes Android develop. It will be a fast and fun 90 minutes.

title: JUG - CS
subject: Kotlin: getting rid of Java
speaker: Héctor Valls
description:
Retomamos los encuentros mensuales del grupo y para inaugurar 2017 tenemos la charla "Kotlin: getting rid of Java" a cargo de Héctor Valls, ingeniero de software en ADC y desarrollador, entre otros, de proyectos para dispositivos móviles. Héctor nos presentará una introducción a este lenguaje de programación que está ganando peso en el desarrollo de aplicaciones Android comparándolo especialmente con Java.

Como siempre, al finalizar podremos continuar la conversación tomando unas cervezas.

title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Anko
speaker: Kevin Most
description: We'll take a deep dive into Anko, a Kotlin library maintained by JetBrains and designed to make Android development expressive and fast. We'll cover the View DSL, the most well-known part of Anko, which allows clean programmatic creation of views without XML, but will also dive into the rest of this surprisingly comprehensive library, which includes type-safe wrappers for many of the low-level Android APIs, and extension methods for the support libraries to make them feel like a first-class part of the Android ecosystem.

title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Spring Boot
speaker: Yousuf Haque
description: Kotlin and Spring Boot were both designed to help developers move faster. This talk will demonstrate how the combination of the two technologies can make web service development fast, and easy. We will try to show you how to make CRUD apps using Spring Data, and Google’s Firebase.

title: Callista Developer's Conference
subject: Kotlin - ett elegant nytt språk för JVM
speaker: Jesper Holmberg
description: Kotlin - ett elegant nytt språk för JVM

title: January Kotlin Meetup
subject: Show and Tell: Creating a Swing Application with Kotlin
speaker: Christoph Pickl
description: As a (future) Shiatsu practitioner and IT nerd, I've developed my very own software called Gadsu to manage my clients and their treatments, generating printout protocols for my school, synchronizing appointments with Google Calender and much more.

title: January Kotlin Meetup
subject: Spring Boot Microservices with Kotlin
speaker: Christoph Leiter
description: I spent the last 6 month creating a project with about a dozen microservices which is written 100% in Kotlin. In this talk I will tell you what I've learned and share some tips on how to get the most out of Spring Boot, Kotlin and the ecosystem.

speaker: Markus Winand
title: Java User Group Graz
subject: Modern SQL
description:
Die Datenbanksprache SQL hat sich in den letzten Jahrzehnten erheblich weiterentwickelt. Leider hat sich diese Weiterentwicklung weder in der einschlägigen Literatur noch im Kursangebot niedergeschlagen. Die Folge: Viele Entwickler verwenden SQL wie vor 20 Jahren.

Dieser Vortrag zeigt Anwendungsbeispiele der wichtigsten Neuerungen und stellt sie den “alten” Lösungsansätzen von SQL-92 gegenüber. Dadurch wird deutlich, dass zahlreiche Probleme mit modernem SQL sehr einfach und elegant gelöst werden können.

speaker: Svetlana Isakova
title: Stockholm Android
subject: Kotlin presentation from JetBrains
description:
The first Android Meetup for 2017!

This event will have a very special speaker; Svetlana Isakova from JetBrains, who is working as a developer advocate for the Kotlin programming language. We're also happy ot be hosted again at iZettle.

speaker: Alberto J Arias
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: Introduction to the Kotlin programming language, part 2/2
description:
OOP

More about functions

Generics

Interoperability with Java

Miscellaneous

title: "GDG Tours"
subject: GDG#10: Kotlin Android
speaker: Louis Cognault
description:
Kotlin, le langage de programmation développé par JetBrains s'est vu très rapidement adopté par la communauté Android et est facile à prendre en main pour les développeurs Java, Scala et Swift.

Louis Cognault viendra nous présenter le language et son utilisation concrète dans quelques projets, puis fera un petit retour d'expérience.

Notez que la présentation sera orientée utilisation de kotlin sur Android, mais kotlin fonctionne en JVM et se transpile en JS. On est proche d'un language full-stack.

speaker: Juan Liska
title: Guatemala Kotlin Meetup
subject: Introducción a Programación Funcional en Kotlin
description:
Kotlin es un lenguaje relativamente nuevo que compila a Javascript y a bytecode del JVM. Fue diseñado por Jetbrains y ha crecido mucho en popularidad desde que se lanzó la versión 1.0 hace un año. Se usa sobre todo para hacer apps de Android porque es compatible con Java SE 6 pero tiene una sintaxis muy agradable. Se siente como python pero con excelente "type safety" y rendimiento.

Estaremos repasando las características básicas de Kotlin y de la programación funcional en Kotlin. Si el tiempo permite, habrá una demostración de async/await que será parte de kotlin1.1

speaker: Juan Liska
title: Guatemala Kotlin Meetup
subject: Introducción a Programación Funcional en Kotlin
description:
Kotlin es un lenguaje relativamente nuevo que compila a Javascript y a bytecode del JVM. Fue diseñado por Jetbrains y ha crecido mucho en popularidad desde que se lanzó la versión 1.0 hace un año. Se usa sobre todo para hacer apps de Android porque es compatible con Java SE 6 pero tiene una sintaxis muy agradable. Se siente como python pero con excelente "type safety" y rendimiento.

Estaremos repasando las características básicas de Kotlin y de la programación funcional en Kotlin. Si el tiempo permite, habrá una demostración de async/await que será parte de kotlin1.1

speaker: Alexander Frank, Benedict Pregler
title: MobileTech Conference
subject: Kotlin Deep Dive – ein Vergleich des generierten Bytecodes zwischen Kotlin und Java
description: Die JVM-Sprache Kotlin wurde bereits in mehreren Betrachtungen mit ihren Vor- und Nachteilen im Bereich der Quellcode Erstellung vorgestellt. Aber wie sieht es eigentlich mit dem erzeugten Bytecode und dessen Performance aus? Ist der resultierende Bytecode äquivalent zu Java, gibt es Einbußen oder ist das Ergebnis möglicherweise sogar schneller? Wir vergleichen den kompilierten Bytecode gleicher Funktionalität und verwendeter Techniken (z.B. Lambdas, Streams usw.) in Java und Kotlin, um zu betrachten, wie die Verwendung von Kotlin den Bytecode und damit die Laufzeitperformance beeinflusst. Zusätzlich zur Betrachtung mit Standard-Java werfen wir einen Blick auf Android mit der neuen Kompilierungskette „Jack and Jill“ und deren Auswirkungen auf die Verwendung von Kotlin.

speaker: Rene Groeschke
title: CTO Roundtable. Berlin
subject: Gradle build tool and Kotlin
description: Rene is going to be talking about the Gradle build tool and Kotlin. https://twitter.com/breskeby

speaker: Federico Tomassetti
title: Lyon Kotlin User Group
subject: Building languages using Kotlin: how to build tool support for your language
description:
Languages are tools we use to think about problems and build solutions for them. By using the right language we can achieve a boost in productivity. There are situations in which it makes sense to build new languages, crafting them to fit perfectly into our domain.

In this talk we will see how we can combine open-source components, and glue them together using Kotlin. At the end of the talk we will have built:

• a parser

• a validator

• an interpreter

• an editor

for our own Domain Specific Language.

Building such tools used to take tens of man-years worth of development. Today, using Kotlin, we can reduce our development time quite significantly. We can therefore build DSLs quicker and use them in more contexts.

Speaker

Federico Tomassetti is Italian and used to leave in Karlsruhe, Munich and Dublin before moving to Lyon. He got a PhD in Language Engineering, has done research in Italy and Germany, worked at TripAdvisor and Groupon and he is now an independent consultant on Language Engineering. He spends his time building languages, parsers, compilers, editors, simulators, interpreters, static analysis tools and anything related to languages. He blogs regularly at https://tomassetti.me

speaker: Andrei Chernyshev, Mister Ligi
title: Kotlin user group Berlin
subject: Kotlin hands-on knowledge share
description: Kotlin hands-on knowledge share

speaker: Brandon Wever
title: GDG Cincinnati
subject: Android Developers Presentation: Be More Productive with Kotlin
description:
People are excited about developing Android applications with Kotlin. From new side projects to existing enterprise level Java architectures, Kotlin can improve code quality and readability while reducing lines of code and eliminating entire classes of bugs. Find out why Kotlin is being used by developers at companies like Square, Trello, and Pintrest.

Brandon Wever is a mobile developer at Atomic Robot and a recent graduate of NKU's Computer Science Graduate Program. His number one goal in software is to find simple, pragmatic solutions and having tools that work for you.

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: GOTO Chicago
subject: Kotlin - Ready for production
description:
Did you know that Kotlin is being used in production for over a few years now already? Both inside and outside of JetBrains there are people deploying Kotlin applications for Android platform, for Web Applications and just about any other type of application.

Why are people using it instead of Java or some of the other languages out there? Primarily because it provides significant benefits in terms of conciseness, readability and safety, without some of the drawbacks that adopting a new language has such as a higher learning curve or interoperability with existing code and ecosystems.

In this talk we'll cover some aspects of Kotlin that can really help you in your daily development, focusing on solving issues versus highlighting language features.

speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
title: SpringOne Platform 2016
subject: Developing a Geospatial Webservice with Kotlin and Spring Boot
description:
Spring I/O 2016 - 19 -20 May Barcelona

As described in this announcement I made on Spring blog, it is now easy to create a Spring Boot application using Kotlin.

Thanks to a sample Geospatial chat application, I will show how Spring Boot and Kotlin share the same pragmatic, innovative and optionated mindset to allow you to build simple but powerful projects.

That talk will also provide an opportunity to show how to use a relational database with Spring Data but without JPA in order to use advanced PostgreSQL functionalities (like its powerful spatial database extender PostGIS or the native JSON support) while keeping a lightweight stack.

speaker: Gabi Bornea
title: Kotlin User Group Bucharest
subject: Microservices with Kotlin and Spring Boot
description:
The concept of “microservices” has gained a lot of traction in the last couple of years and Spring has made it easy to develop individual applications and connect them with each other.

Kotlin is the statically typed JVM targeted language from JetBrains that is concise, expressive, safe and fully interoperable with Java code which means that it is a perfect fit for Spring applications.

In this talk we will see how we can quickly build a distributed system with Kotlin and Spring.

speaker: Paweł Barszcz
title: Kotlin & Spring: wrażenia po 300 godzinach
subject: Warszawa JUG
description: Kotlin to język programowania, który swoją popularność zyskał dzięki programistom Androida. Czy nadaje się on do pisania backendu opartego na Springu? Czy pracuje się z nim wygodniej lub bezpieczniej, niż z czystą Javą? Podzielę się swoimi spostrzeżeniami oraz przykładami kodu opartymi na doświadczeniu z aktualnego projektu.

speaker: 藤田 琢磨
title: 【学生＆若手エンジニア向け勉強会】
subject: 今こそ学ぶ、Kotlin入門（ハンズオン有）
description:
サポーターズが贈るエンジニア勉強会。

今回のテーマは「今こそ学ぶ、Kotlin入門」。

KotlinはJetBrainsが作った言語で2016年の2月にv1がリリースされました。

Null安全・拡張関数・関数リテラル等の魅力があり、正式リリース以降、

サーバやAndroidなどでの導入事例が増えてきています。

Kotlinの文法のハンズオンから導入の知見までを共有し、

参加者がKotlinをふわっとその場で習得することを目指します。

サーバ・Androidエンジニアだけではなく、

iOSをSwiftで書いている人やAndroid始めたいと思っている方にもおすすめです！

speaker: 高橋良輔
title: 【チャット機能のAndroidアプリを作ろう！】
subject: Kotlin&Firebaseハンズオン
description:
最近Android開発で注目されているプログラミング言語Kotlinを使ったハンズオンセミナーを開催いたします。またGoogle社にて提供しているmBaas（モバイルバックエンドサービス）であるFirebaseを使って簡単なチャット機能のあるAndroidアプリを作ります。

ハンズオンで学習できる内容

  • Kotlin言語の基本
  • Androidアプリ開発の基本
  • Firebaseの使い方

speaker: Sebastien Deleuze
title: Bordeaux JUG
subject: Functional web applications with Kotlin and Spring 5
description:
Cette présentation a pour but de vous montrer un nouveau type d'application fonctionnelle utilisant Spring Reactive ainsi que le langage Kotlin qui convient tout aussi bien à la programmation orientée objet qu'à la programmation fonctionnelle.

Je me baserai sur un exemple concret, en l'occurence le projet du nouveau site de la conférence Mix-IT dont je m'occupe et dont les sources sont disponibles sur GitHub:
- Le support Kotlin intégré à Spring Framework 5 (en exclusivité mondiale ^^)
- Le nouveau framework Spring Web functional
- L'API de récupération de bean basée sur les lambdas (plus de proxy CGLIB)
- Des classes immutables et une injection par constructeur plutôt que par setter
- La puissance des extensions Kotlin pour un code propre
- Un rendu des template client et server avec Mustache
- Une application légère et Reactive basée sur Reactor Netty
- L'utilisation de MongoDB via une API Reactive
- Un fichier de build Gradle écrit également en Kotlin

Ce talk est accessible à tout java-iste et même si vous ne connaissez pas Kotlin.

speaker: Sindre Moen
title: Kotlin Night
subject: Kotlin + Anko
description: Anko is a Kotlin library made by JetBrains to make Android pleasant to work with. One of its biggest features is a DSL for creating views programmatically with no hassle at all, but it also features a lot of helpers for interacting with views, intents, services, async tasks, databases and more. Sindre will talk about how to get started using Anko as well as look at some advanced topics, like extensing the layout DSL.

speaker: Rafael Winterhalter
title: Kotlin Night
subject: Runtime proxies for Kotlin
description: A major distinction of Kotlin to other languages running on the JVM is its default of final classes and methods. While deliberate polymorphism is arguably a good design choice, many existing libraries in the Java ecosystem rely on generating runtime subclasses what exacerbates their use with Kotlin. In this presentation, we look into the need for runtime proxies and introduce alternatives to classical subclass proxying. Doing so, we will look into how the Mockito library overcame this problem and is able to mock non-opened Kotlin classes in its second version. Finally, we discuss the difficulties of proxying and mocking classes when running code on an Android virtual machine.

speaker: Robert Martin
title: Live Webinar
subject: The Three Laws of TDD
description: Test Driven Development continues to grow in popularity as a discipline that exemplifies professional care and diligence. In this webinar, Uncle Bob will describe the three laws of TDD, and will demonstrate the discipline using (sic!) the Kotlin language.

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: OSCON
subject: Functional Programming with Kotlin
description:
Hadi Hariri explains the basics of functional programming using Kotlin—where it fits in with the object orientation paradigm and how to use it in your everyday work. Along the way, Hadi covers important functional programming concepts, such as as lambdas, higher-order functions, currying, partial functions, memoization, and monads, and demonstrates how and where to apply functional patterns to cut down boilerplate code and keep it maintainable.

While the workshop will use Kotlin, many of the concepts can be applied to other programming languages such as Java 8.

speaker: Alberto Arias
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: Introduction to the Kotlin programming language
description: 1-hour intro the the Kotlin programing language. Let's take a quick look at the nicest features of this modern language. Kotlin is an open-sourced statically-typed programming language created by JetBrains that runs on the Java Virtual Machine and also can be compiled to JavaScript source code. Kotlin is designed to interoperate with Java code.

speaker: Hanneli Tavante, Breandan Considine
title: Devoxx US 2017
subject: Typing in Java, Kotlin and Scala: A quick comparison
description: There are several languages which are powered by the JVM. What are the main differences between their type systems? This session will compare bytecode generated by Java, Kotlin and Scala, analyse compilation and execution time, and explore the behaviour of generics and type inference. We will compare and contrast code samples to help understand how each of these languages handle types.

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: Devoxx US 2017
subject: Kotlin 102-Beyond the basics
description:
This talk is about covering the language aspects that you usually don’t see in a 101 talk. Topics include amongst other:

  • Generics and how Kotlin handles Covariance and Contravariance
  • The secrets of inline functions in Kotlin
  • Reified generics and avoiding type erasure on the JVM
  • Lazy evaluation with sequences
  • Using delegation to leverage code reuse
  • Object invocations and lambdas with receivers for better DSL’s
  • A view of asynchronous programming with coroutines

speaker: Breandan Considine
title: EclipseConverge
subject: AceJump: Writing an Eclipse Plugin in Kotlin
description: AceJump, a popular plugin for IntelliJ IDEA, is coming soon to Eclipse! We'll discuss some technical hurdles encountered when migrating this plugin, and how I resolved them using Kotlin, Gradle, and the Eclipse RCP to help you jump to any character in the editor with just a few keystrokes.

speaker: Benjamin Lacroix, Arnaud Piroelle
title: Training
subject: Le langage de Jetbrain pour développer des applications Android: pourquoi et comment passer à Kotlin?
description:
Cette formation intensive de 2 jours a été créé pour les développeurs Android Java souhaitant découvrir une autre façon d’écrire des applications Android en utilisant le langage Kotlin.

Kotlin pour Android permet de radicalement diminuer le temps de développement d’une application Android sans en diminuer la qualité. Kotlin peut s’intégrer à une application existante ou pour une nouvelle application.

speaker: 長澤 太郎 and others
title: 第4回Kotlin勉強会 ＠Sansan
subject: Kotlin LT
description:
第4回Kotlin勉強会を開催いたします！

LTご希望の方Welcomeです！Kotlinを語らって2016年を締めくくりましょう～！s

speaker: Mario Arias
title: F(by) 2016
subject: Functional Programming in Kotlin with funKTionale
description:
A fast introduction to Kotlin programming language and its functional features alongside with funKTionale library:

  • A tiny introduction to Kotlin
  • Function types
  • Extension points
  • Function composition, currying and partial application
  • Option, Either and Disjunction
  • Future developments

speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
title: F(by) 2016
subject: FullStack Web with Kotlin
description: Nowadays we have a choice from the set of languages for web: JavaScript, TypeScript, Scala.js, ClojureScript, Elm and so on and so on. But only few of them become industrial standard. Kotlin - is a new (but already mature) language for JVM, JavaScript and Native in future. Let's see, how we can build both web and backend with them and 3R (Reactive React-Redux).

speaker: Roberto Franchini
title: NoSlidesConf 2016
subject: Kotlin social graph
description:
How to fetch and persist the Twitter stream to an OrientDB graph database using Kotlin as main language, with the support of Docker, of course.

    OrientDB running in a Docker container Twitter4j for fetching the Twitter stream Kotlin to code

speaker: Arnaud Giuliani
title: Geek Breakfast #3
subject: Kotlin
description:
Kotlin, le langage de JVM open source de Jetbrains, est sorti dans sa première version "production ready" en début d'année et a commencé à secouer les communautés des développeurs Android et Spring Framework.

Ce petit déjeuner propose de venir découvrir ce langage, qui reprend certains aspects de groovy ou scala, et qui est très proche de swift dans la syntaxe et les concepts.

Pourquoi investir dans Kotlin et à quel coût ? Comment Kotlin booste la productivité des développements d’applications Java et ouvre les portes du développement réactif?

Atelier animé par Arnaud Giuliani, architecte et développeur senior à ekito

speaker: C.L. Kim
title: AnDevCon
subject: Kotlin and Android, Better Together, Part I
description:
Kotlin is a new language by JetBrains that compiles to JVM bytecode. Version 1.0 was released in early 2016, which was a notable milestone. Kotlin has many characteristics that make it very compelling for use in Android app development, including Interoperability with Java, Lambdas, Null Safety, Extension Methods, Data Classes, relatively small size and method count, top-notch support in Android Studio, and others. This two-part class not only introduces Kotlin, but also illustrates the basic use of Kotlin with other popular Android libraries such as Dagger 2, Retrofit 2 and RxJava/RxAndroid.

In Part I, we will dive into basic syntax fairly broadly though not in depth. Topics include:

    Functions as expressions Conditions as expressions Nullable/non-nullable values and alternate idioms to ensure null safety Type checks and automatic smart casts, safe casting When-expressions ('when' improves on Java's 'switch' but can be an expression as well as a statement) Functional literals aka lambda expressions Closure

See Part II for how we try to provide context for the use of Kotlin in Android app development by using actual code snippets from a no-frills but functional demo Android app.

Level: Overview

speaker: Haim Yadid
title: Java.IL
subject: Taking Kotlin to production, Seriously
description: Next Insurance was founded in the beginning of 2016 and first lines of our production code started accumulating in May 2016. In the beginning I have started writing in Java and experimenting with Kotlin, which saw its 1.0 release two months earlier. 6 months later, the development of our backend services has totally shifted to Kotlin. We still keep a few classes in Java just to make sure that the integration remains seamless but the vast majority of our codebase is written in Kotlin. In this talk I will cover the language features and why I think it is awesome, from null safety to smart casts and data classes. We will also look into the future with 1.1 async/await feature and more.

speaker: 西林拓志
title: Kansai.kt #2
subject: Kotlin Workshop
description:
関西でKotlinの勉強会を開催します。

KotlinはIntellij IDEAで有名なJetBrains社が提供するJVM言語です。

http://kotlinlang.org/

  • 静的型付け
  • 関数リテラル、型推論、パターンマッチ、null安全
  • Androidサポート
  • altJSサポート (実験的段階)

といった特徴があります。

こんな人が対象です。

  • next Javaになる言語を知りたい
  • nullを撲滅したい
  • 関数型っぽいコーディングをしたい
  • Android Java以外でAndroidアプリを開発したい

speaker: Filip Procházka
title: GDG DevFest Minsk 2016
subject: Workshop. Implementing MVP architecture with Kotlin and Rx
description: In the past year Kotlin really started to take off after successfull release of it's stable version. In this workshop, we will go trough transition of an outdated Android application to MVP architecture, utilizing Kotlin advanced features and RxJava/Kotlin.In the past year Kotlin really started to take off after successfull release of it's stable version. In this workshop, we will go trough transition of an outdated Android application to MVP architecture, utilizing Kotlin advanced features and RxJava/Kotlin.

speaker: Stanislav Erokhin
title: GDG DevFest Siberia
subject: New features in kotlin1.1 and what's next
description: Стас работает в команде Kotlin 3.5 года, в основном занимается компилятором и теоритическими задачами, которые возникают по ходу. Интересуется формальными системами типов, выводом типов. Активно учавствует в дизайне новых фич. Расскажет о том, что ждёт пользователей в релизе 1.1.

speaker: Alexander Hanschke
title: JUG Karlsruhe Meetup
subject: Einführung in Kotlin
description:
In diesem Jahr hat Kotlin die Version 1.0 erreicht - Grund genug sich die Programmiersprache einmal näher anzuschauen.

Der Vortrag gibt eine Übersicht über die Sprache und die wichtigsten Features und diskutiert diese anhand einer Beispielanwendung.

Durch die nahtlose Interoperabilität zwischen Java und Kotlin lassen sich bestehende Projekte inkrementell migrieren. Worauf dabei zu achten ist, wird im zweiten Teil des Vortrag thematisiert.

speaker: Anton Keks, Andrei Solntsev
title: TopConf Tallinn
subject: Kotlin Puzzlers
description:
Kotlin is a marvelous alternative language for the JVM, aiming to improve usability of aging Java. While not exactly new, it has been quickly gaining adoption since its 1.0 release early this year.

We will give a brief introduction and then, for the first time ever, will present Puzzlers of Kotlin – the gotchas that you may encounter while digging deeper into the language.

While Kotlin was in development for 6 years, and aimed to be a perfect practical language, like all other languages, it still has tricky parts that you don't find in the documentation.

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: Build Stuff 2016
subject: Creating DSL's in idiomatic Kotlin
description:
Kotlin is a fairly easy language to grasp given its similarity with other mainstream ones such as Java, C# and JavaScript. However, Kotlin provides a few characteristics which makes it possible to write nice DSL’s. But the question is, do we always need full-blown domain specific languages in our applications? Are we really going to write all our business rules in a specific language?

Not necessarily, but that doesn’t mean we should discard DSL’s. In fact, DSL’s are really powerful when they are small and focused. In this talk we’re going to show a few DSL’s that we can create to deal with different aspects of our application, whether it’s business dealing with tax rules or infrastructure and working with transactions, and see how with very little effort we can create more concise, maintainable and readable code.

title: Jacksonville JUG
speaker: Shaun Hubbard
subject: Kotlin, not just for Android!
description:
Kotlin is a high-performance, statically typed "pragmatic language" that leverages the environment of the Java Virtual Machine.

Created by IDE makers JetBrains, it makes use of the existing culture of Java libraries and tooling. Java, in turn, can use items built in Kotlin.

title: Meetup Mobile Grenoble
speaker: Clément Plantier
subject: Présentation de Kotlin, nouveau langage pour Android et la JVM
description: Présentation de Kotlin, nouveau langage pour Android et la JVM

title: Øredev
speaker: Hadi Hariri
subject: Creating Small DSLs with Idiomatic Kotlin
description:
Kotlin is a fairly easy language to grasp given its similarity with other mainstream ones such as Java, C# and JavaScript. However, Kotlin provides a few characteristics which makes it possible to write nice DSL’s. But the question is, do we always need full-blown domain specific languages in our applications? Are we really going to write all our business rules in a specific language?

Not necessarily, but that doesn’t mean we should discard DSL’s. In fact, DSL’s are really powerful when they are small and focused. In this talk we’re going to show a few DSL’s that we can create to deal with different aspects of our application, whether it’s business dealing with tax rules or infrastructure and working with transactions, and see how with very little effort we can create more concise, maintainable and readable code.

title: Øredev
speaker: Eric Cochran
subject: Getting Kotlin in Your Codebase
description: Excitement swirls around Kotlin, and we developers want it in our codebases. From an Android engineer's point of view, Eric will talk about the best ways to start using Kotlin at work and what parts of a Android codebase really benefit from Kotlin usage. With the 1.0 stable release, convincing your coworkers to get Kotlin into at least your tests is an endeavor worth undertaking!

speaker: 荒谷　光（あらたに　あきら）
title: 学生＆若手エンジニア向け勉強会
subject: androidでRxとkotlin ~fluxで複雑な状態管理を解決した話~
description:
サポーターズが贈るエンジニア勉強会。

今回のテーマは「androidでRxとkotlin」。

昨今のモバイルアプリは多数の状態を持つことが多く、設計が複雑になりがちです。

当日は今webで流行しているfluxの概念をRxとkotlinを用いてandroidで実現した方法について解説します。

※ Rxの使い方についての説明はしません

speaker: Justin Lee
title: NY JavaSIG
subject: Why bother with kotlin
description: Kotlin is a new, open-source and lightweight programming language that runs on the JVM and can also be compiled into JavaScript, or even used with Android on mobile devices. It is a very cool and simple language learnable in a few hours, and thanks to its Java relationship, can use any existing Java frameworks/libraries.

speaker: Rene Groeschke
title: Devoxx
subject: Gradle meets Kotlin
description:
The requirements for build automation are constantly growing these days as having a well designed continuous delivery pipeline is essential to deliver features and bugfixes quick to customers. This growing complexity results in more complex custom build logic. This causes developers and build authors to invest more in custom build logic which should be a pleasant experience as writing production code. With Gradle now supporting Kotlin, a statically typed and pragmatic language for the JVM, for writing Gradle build scripts, build masters can easily detect potential misconfigurations at compile time which can reduce problems at runtime dramatically. Kotlin ships with first class IDE support for Eclipse and IDEA that allows more sophisticated tooling support for editing build logic than you have ever seen before by supporting auto completion, documentation lookup, refactoring etc.

The last couple of months the Gradle Team and the Kotlin team have collaborated closely to provide a great expericence to Gradle users. In this session we’ll take a closer look on the Kotlin based Gradle DSL and the IDE support. Furthermore we discuss best practices and future plans.

speaker: Antonio Leiva
title: Curso Presencial
subject: Kotlin para desarrolladores Android
description:
Puede que la idea de aprender un lenguaje nuevo te haga pensar que vas a tener que dedicar demasiadas horas a analizar y escribir código hasta dominarlo con un experto. Puede que te preguntes si merecerá la pena el esfuerzo.

Sin embargo, el caso de Kotlin es diferente. Es tan sencillo que un curso intensivo de un día es suficiente para conocer todos los conceptos que necesitas para crear tu primera app utilizando Kotlin como lenguaje principal. Te lo garantizo. Es así porque Kotlin ha sido ideado para facilitar la transición desde Java.

El tiempo que dediques a aprender el lenguaje será tiempo que ganarás en el desarrollo diario de tus proyectos utilizando Kotlin.

Porque los nuevos conceptos que introduce Kotlin te ahorrarán líneas de código innecesarias y te darán soluciones impensables con Java a día de hoy.

speaker: David Vavra
title: GDG DevFest Pilsen 2016
subject: Firebase + Kotlin + MVP + Rx: Practical Tips
description: New Firebase products announced at I/O make an Android developer’s life so much easier. We have been happily developing with it since January 2016. Sample projects work great, but what if your database structure is complex and you want a solid architecture with MVP, RxJava and Kotlin? Come to learn some practical tips.

title: Mobile Era 2016
speaker: Svetlana Isakova
subject: You can do better with Kotlin
description: The Kotlin programming language is gaining popularity amongst the Android developer community. It’s a modern language that gives more power in everyday routines. Kotlin code generally looks cleaner and nicer, and it’s much easier to work with when you have less verbosity or code duplication. But what’s even more important, is that Kotlin is 100% compatible with all existing Java frameworks, and has good tooling in Android Studio and IntelliJ IDEA. In this talk we’ll discuss the concepts of the language that provide the desired expressiveness, as well as additional goodies designed specifically for Android.

title: JFall 2016
speaker: Thijs Suijten
subject: No excuses: switch to Kotlin
description: Are you stuck in the Java world? I’ll share my story about convincing my team and the client of the benefits of Kotlin. Furthermore I’ll delve into how we migrated an existing Java Android app, with 300k active users, to Kotlin. Even if you have never seen Kotlin before, come and see how you will create better apps with this modern and elegant language. At the end of this talk you’ll be able to convince your team / client why it’s a great to use Kotlin. The power of Kotlin can be leveraged everywhere you use Java, since it compiles to JVM bytecode. So even if you’re not an Android developer, check out this session to get acquainted with Kotlin! No excuses: switch to Kotlin.

title: DevFest Toulouse 2016
speaker: Arnaud Giuliani
subject: Develop a reactive Android app with Kotlin
description: Kotlin est un langage développé par Jetbrains. Sa version 1.0 (production ready) est sortie en début d'année et a fait un certain buzz au sein de la communauté android. Cette session propose de découvrir ce langage, qui reprend certains aspects de groovy ou scala, et qui est très proche de swift dans la syntaxe et les concepts. Nous verrons comment Kotlin boost la productivité du développement d’applications Android et comment il permet de bien accompagner le développement réactif.

title: An evening with Industry Engineers @Square NYC
speaker: Jake Wharton
subject: 10 Kotlin Tricks in 10 Minutes
description: Kotlin is a new and popular language for Android development. Its major advantages and features are immediately appealing and quick to learn, but it also has a lot of small and thoughtful parts which are harder to discover. This short talk will cover 10 of my favorites with real-world examples.

speaker: Damian Petla
title: Tech Shock
subject: A native Android app written 100% in Kotlin
description:
Damian Petla from Schibsted Tech Polska will share his experience on working with the Omni news app, a native Android app written 100% in Kotlin.

Damian started his career as Java Developer in 2006 and for the last 2 years he has been working with Kotlin. He will present how to set up Android a project from scratch, compare the developer experience with Java and share some general tips.
